enums.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT

entries.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC
entries.description: Generic autopilot, full support for everything

entries.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_RESERVED

entries.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC_WAYPOINTS_ONLY

enums.name: MAV_TYPE
enums.description: MAVLINK component type reported in HEARTBEAT message. Flight controllers must report the type of the vehicle on which they are mounted (e.g. MAV_TYPE_OCTOROTOR). All other components must report a value appropriate for their type (e.g. a camera must use MAV_TYPE_CAMERA).

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_GENERIC
entries.description: Generic micro air vehicle

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_FIXED_WING
entries.description: Fixed wing aircraft.

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_QUADROTOR
entries.description: Quadrotor

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_COAXIAL
entries.description: Coaxial helicopter

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_HELICOPTER
entries.description: Normal helicopter with tail rotor.

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_ANTENNA_TRACKER
entries.description: Ground installation

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_GCS
entries.description: Operator control unit / ground control station

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_AIRSHIP
entries.description: Airship, controlled

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_FREE_BALLOON
entries.description: Free balloon, uncontrolled

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_ROCKET
entries.description: Rocket

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_GROUND_ROVER
entries.description: Ground rover

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_SURFACE_BOAT
entries.description: Surface vessel, boat, ship

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_SUBMARINE
entries.description: Submarine

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_HEXAROTOR
entries.description: Hexarotor

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_OCTOROTOR
entries.description: Octorotor

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_TRICOPTER
entries.description: Tricopter

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_FLAPPING_WING
entries.description: Flapping wing

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_KITE
entries.description: Kite

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_ONBOARD_CONTROLLER
entries.description: Onboard companion controller

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_TAILSITTER_DUOROTOR
entries.description: Two-rotor Tailsitter VTOL that additionally uses control surfaces in vertical operation. Note, value previously named MAV_TYPE_VTOL_DUOROTOR.

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_TAILSITTER_QUADROTOR
entries.description: Quad-rotor Tailsitter VTOL using a V-shaped quad config in vertical operation. Note: value previously named MAV_TYPE_VTOL_QUADROTOR.

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_TILTROTOR
entries.description: Tiltrotor VTOL. Fuselage and wings stay (nominally) horizontal in all flight phases. It able to tilt (some) rotors to provide thrust in cruise flight.

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_FIXEDROTOR
entries.description: VTOL with separate fixed rotors for hover and cruise flight. Fuselage and wings stay (nominally) horizontal in all flight phases.

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_TAILSITTER
entries.description: Tailsitter VTOL. Fuselage and wings orientation changes depending on flight phase: vertical for hover, horizontal for cruise. Use more specific VTOL MAV_TYPE_VTOL_TAILSITTER_DUOROTOR or MAV_TYPE_VTOL_TAILSITTER_QUADROTOR if appropriate.

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_TILTWING
entries.description: Tiltwing VTOL. Fuselage stays horizontal in all flight phases. The whole wing, along with any attached engine, can tilt between vertical and horizontal mode.

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_RESERVED5
entries.description: VTOL reserved 5

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_GIMBAL
entries.description: Gimbal

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_ADSB
entries.description: ADSB system

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_PARAFOIL
entries.description: Steerable, nonrigid airfoil

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_DODECAROTOR
entries.description: Dodecarotor

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_CAMERA
entries.description: Camera

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_CHARGING_STATION
entries.description: Charging station

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_FLARM
entries.description: FLARM collision avoidance system

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_SERVO
entries.description: Servo

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_ODID
entries.description: Open Drone ID. See https://mavlink.io/en/services/opendroneid.html.

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_DECAROTOR
entries.description: Decarotor

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_BATTERY
entries.description: Battery

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_PARACHUTE
entries.description: Parachute

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_LOG
entries.description: Log

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_OSD
entries.description: OSD

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_IMU
entries.description: IMU

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_GPS
entries.description: GPS

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_WINCH
entries.description: Winch

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_GENERIC_MULTIROTOR
entries.description: Generic multirotor that does not fit into a specific type or whose type is unknown

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_ILLUMINATOR
entries.description: Illuminator. An illuminator is a light source that is used for lighting up dark areas external to the system: e.g. a torch or searchlight (as opposed to a light source for illuminating the system itself, e.g. an indicator light).

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_SPACECRAFT_ORBITER
entries.description: Orbiter spacecraft. Includes satellites orbiting terrestrial and extra-terrestrial bodies. Follows NASA Spacecraft Classification.

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_GROUND_QUADRUPED
entries.description: A generic four-legged ground vehicle (e.g., a robot dog).

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_GYRODYNE
entries.description: VTOL hybrid of helicopter and autogyro. It has a main rotor for lift and separate propellers for forward flight. The rotor must be powered for hover but can autorotate in cruise flight. See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gyrodyne

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_GRIPPER
entries.description: Gripper

entries.name: MAV_TYPE_RADIO
entries.description: Radio

enums.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG
enums.description: These flags encode the MAV mode, see MAV_MODE enum for useful combinations.

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_SAFETY_ARMED
entries.description: 0b10000000 MAV safety set to armed. Motors are enabled / running / can start. Ready to fly. Additional note: this flag is to be ignore when sent in the command MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MODE and MAV_CMD_COMPONENT_ARM_DISARM shall be used instead. The flag can still be used to report the armed state.

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_MANUAL_INPUT_ENABLED
entries.description: 0b01000000 remote control input is enabled.

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_HIL_ENABLED
entries.description: 0b00100000 hardware in the loop simulation. All motors / actuators are blocked, but internal software is full operational.

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_STABILIZE_ENABLED
entries.description: 0b00010000 system stabilizes electronically its attitude (and optionally position). It needs however further control inputs to move around.

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_GUIDED_ENABLED
entries.description: 0b00001000 guided mode enabled, system flies waypoints / mission items.

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_AUTO_ENABLED
entries.description: 0b00000100 autonomous mode enabled, system finds its own goal positions. Guided flag can be set or not, depends on the actual implementation.

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_TEST_ENABLED
entries.description: 0b00000010 system has a test mode enabled. This flag is intended for temporary system tests and should not be used for stable implementations.

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_CUSTOM_MODE_ENABLED
entries.description: 0b00000001 system-specific custom mode is enabled. When using this flag to enable a custom mode all other flags should be ignored.

enums.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION
enums.description: These values encode the bit positions of the decode position. These values can be used to read the value of a flag bit by combining the base_mode variable with AND with the flag position value. The result will be either 0 or 1, depending on if the flag is set or not.

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_SAFETY
entries.description: First bit: 10000000

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_MANUAL
entries.description: Second bit: 01000000

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_HIL
entries.description: Third bit: 00100000

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_STABILIZE
entries.description: Fourth bit: 00010000

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_GUIDED
entries.description: Fifth bit: 00001000

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_AUTO
entries.description: Sixth bit: 00000100

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_TEST
entries.description: Seventh bit: 00000010

entries.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_CUSTOM_MODE
entries.description: Eighth bit: 00000001

entries.name: MAV_STATE_UNINIT
entries.description: Uninitialized system, state is unknown.

entries.name: MAV_STATE_BOOT
entries.description: System is booting up.

entries.name: MAV_STATE_CALIBRATING
entries.description: System is calibrating and not flight-ready.

entries.name: MAV_STATE_STANDBY
entries.description: System is grounded and on standby. It can be launched any time.

entries.name: MAV_STATE_ACTIVE
entries.description: System is active and might be already airborne. Motors are engaged.

entries.name: MAV_STATE_CRITICAL
entries.description: System is in a non-normal flight mode (failsafe). It can however still navigate.

entries.name: MAV_STATE_EMERGENCY
entries.description: System is in a non-normal flight mode (failsafe). It lost control over parts or over the whole airframe. It is in mayday and going down.

entries.name: MAV_STATE_POWEROFF
entries.description: System just initialized its power-down sequence, will shut down now.

entries.name: MAV_STATE_FLIGHT_TERMINATION
entries.description: System is terminating itself (failsafe or commanded).

enums.name: MAV_COMPONENT
enums.description: Legacy component ID values for particular types of hardware/software that might make up a MAVLink system (autopilot, cameras, servos, avoidance systems etc.). Components are not required or expected to use IDs with names that correspond to their type or function, but may choose to do so. Using an ID that matches the type may slightly reduce the chances of component id clashes, as, for historical reasons, it is less likely to be used by some other type of component. System integration will still need to ensure that all components have unique IDs. Component IDs are used for addressing messages to a particular component within a system. A component can use any unique ID between 1 and 255 (MAV_COMP_ID_ALL value is the broadcast address, used to send to all components). Historically component ID were also used for identifying the type of component. New code must not use component IDs to infer the component type, but instead check the MAV_TYPE in the HEARTBEAT message!

entries.name: MAV_COMP_ID_ALL
entries.description: Target id (target_component) used to broadcast messages to all components of the receiving system. Components should attempt to process messages with this component ID and forward to components on any other interfaces. Note: This is not a valid *source* component id for a message.

entries.name: MAV_COMP_ID_AUTOPILOT1
entries.description: System flight controller component ("autopilot"). Only one autopilot is expected in a particular system.

entries.name: MAV_COMP_ID_USER1
entries.description: Id for a component on privately managed MAVLink network. Can be used for any purpose but may not be published by components outside of the private network.

enums.name: MAV_BOOL

entries.name: MAV_BOOL_FALSE

entries.name: MAV_BOOL_TRUE
entries.description: True.

enums.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY
enums.description: Bitmask of (optional) autopilot capabilities (64 bit). If a bit is set, the autopilot supports this capability.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_MISSION_FLOAT
entries.description: Autopilot supports the MISSION_ITEM float message type. Note that MISSION_ITEM is deprecated, and autopilots should use MISSION_ITEM_INT instead.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_PARAM_FLOAT
entries.description: Autopilot supports the new param float message type.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_MISSION_INT
entries.description: Autopilot supports MISSION_ITEM_INT scaled integer message type. Note that this flag must always be set if missions are supported, because missions must always use MISSION_ITEM_INT (rather than MISSION_ITEM, which is deprecated).

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_COMMAND_INT
entries.description: Autopilot supports COMMAND_INT scaled integer message type.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_PARAM_ENCODE_BYTEWISE
entries.description: Parameter protocol uses byte-wise encoding of parameter values into param_value (float) fields: https://mavlink.io/en/services/parameter.html#parameter-encoding. Note that either this flag or MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_PARAM_ENCODE_C_CAST should be set if the parameter protocol is supported.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_FTP
entries.description: Autopilot supports the File Transfer Protocol v1: https://mavlink.io/en/services/ftp.html.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_SET_ATTITUDE_TARGET
entries.description: Autopilot supports commanding attitude offboard.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_SET_POSITION_TARGET_LOCAL_NED
entries.description: Autopilot supports commanding position and velocity targets in local NED frame.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_SET_POSITION_TARGET_GLOBAL_INT
entries.description: Autopilot supports commanding position and velocity targets in global scaled integers.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_TERRAIN
entries.description: Autopilot supports terrain protocol / data handling.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_RESERVED3
entries.description: Reserved for future use.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_FLIGHT_TERMINATION
entries.description: Autopilot supports the MAV_CMD_DO_FLIGHTTERMINATION command (flight termination).

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_COMPASS_CALIBRATION
entries.description: Autopilot supports onboard compass calibration.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_MAVLINK2
entries.description: Autopilot supports MAVLink version 2.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_MISSION_FENCE
entries.description: Autopilot supports mission fence protocol.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_MISSION_RALLY
entries.description: Autopilot supports mission rally point protocol.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_RESERVED2
entries.description: Reserved for future use.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_PARAM_ENCODE_C_CAST
entries.description: Parameter protocol uses C-cast of parameter values to set the param_value (float) fields: https://mavlink.io/en/services/parameter.html#parameter-encoding. Note that either this flag or MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_PARAM_ENCODE_BYTEWISE should be set if the parameter protocol is supported.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_COMPONENT_IMPLEMENTS_GIMBAL_MANAGER
entries.description: This component implements/is a gimbal manager. This means the GIMBAL_MANAGER_INFORMATION, and other messages can be requested.

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_COMPONENT_ACCEPTS_GCS_CONTROL
entries.description: Component supports locking control to a particular GCS independent of its system (via MAV_CMD_REQUEST_OPERATOR_CONTROL).

entries.name: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_GRIPPER
entries.description: Autopilot has a connected gripper. MAVLink Grippers would set MAV_TYPE_GRIPPER instead.

enums.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE
enums.description: These values define the type of firmware release. These values indicate the first version or release of this type. For example the first alpha release would be 64, the second would be 65.

entries.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_DEV

entries.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_ALPHA
entries.description: alpha release

entries.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_BETA
entries.description: beta release

entries.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_RC
entries.description: release candidate

entries.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE_OFFICIAL
entries.description: official stable release

entries.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_DIFFERENTIAL_PRESSURE
entries.description: Differential pressure sensor failure.

entries.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_ABSOLUTE_PRESSURE

entries.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_3D_ACCEL
entries.description: Accelerometer sensor failure.

entries.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_3D_GYRO
entries.description: Gyroscope sensor failure.

entries.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_3D_MAG
entries.description: Magnetometer sensor failure.

entries.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_TERRAIN
entries.description: Terrain subsystem failure.

entries.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_BATTERY
entries.description: Battery failure/critical low battery.

entries.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_RC_RECEIVER
entries.description: RC receiver failure/no RC connection.

entries.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_OFFBOARD_LINK

entries.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_ENGINE
entries.description: Engine failure.

entries.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_GEOFENCE

entries.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_ESTIMATOR

entries.name: HL_FAILURE_FLAG_MISSION
entries.description: Mission failure.

enums.name: MAV_GOTO
enums.description: Actions that may be specified in MAV_CMD_OVERRIDE_GOTO to override mission execution.

entries.name: MAV_GOTO_DO_HOLD
entries.description: Hold at the current position.

entries.name: MAV_GOTO_DO_CONTINUE
entries.description: Continue with the next item in mission execution.

entries.name: MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_CURRENT_POSITION
entries.description: Hold at the current position of the system

entries.name: MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_SPECIFIED_POSITION
entries.description: Hold at the position specified in the parameters of the DO_HOLD action

enums.name: MAV_MODE
enums.description: Predefined OR-combined MAV_MODE_FLAG values. These can simplify using the flags when setting modes. Note that manual input is enabled in all modes as a safety override.

deprecated.description: Using MAV_MODE to set modes is less predictable than using standard modes (MAV_STANDARD_MODE) or custom modes (MAV_MODE_FLAG_CUSTOM_MODE_ENABLED).

entries.name: MAV_MODE_PREFLIGHT
entries.description: System is not ready to fly, booting, calibrating, etc. No flag is set.

entries.name: MAV_MODE_STABILIZE_DISARMED
entries.description: System is allowed to be active, under assisted RC control (MAV_MODE_FLAG_SAFETY_ARMED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_STABILIZE_ENABLED)

entries.name: MAV_MODE_STABILIZE_ARMED
entries.description: System is allowed to be active, under assisted RC control (MAV_MODE_FLAG_SAFETY_ARMED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_MANUAL_INPUT_ENABLED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_STABILIZE_ENABLED)

entries.name: MAV_MODE_MANUAL_DISARMED
entries.description: System is allowed to be active, under manual (RC) control, no stabilization (MAV_MODE_FLAG_MANUAL_INPUT_ENABLED)

entries.name: MAV_MODE_MANUAL_ARMED
entries.description: System is allowed to be active, under manual (RC) control, no stabilization (MAV_MODE_FLAG_SAFETY_ARMED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_MANUAL_INPUT_ENABLED)

entries.name: MAV_MODE_GUIDED_DISARMED
entries.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control, manual setpoint (MAV_MODE_FLAG_SAFETY_ARMED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_STABILIZE_ENABLED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_GUIDED_ENABLED)

entries.name: MAV_MODE_GUIDED_ARMED
entries.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control, manual setpoint (MAV_MODE_FLAG_SAFETY_ARMED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_MANUAL_INPUT_ENABLED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_STABILIZE_ENABLED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_GUIDED_ENABLED)

entries.name: MAV_MODE_AUTO_DISARMED
entries.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control and navigation (the trajectory is decided onboard and not pre-programmed by waypoints). (MAV_MODE_FLAG_SAFETY_ARMED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_STABILIZE_ENABLED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_GUIDED_ENABLED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_AUTO_ENABLED).

entries.name: MAV_MODE_AUTO_ARMED
entries.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control and navigation (the trajectory is decided onboard and not pre-programmed by waypoints). (MAV_MODE_FLAG_SAFETY_ARMED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_MANUAL_INPUT_ENABLED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_STABILIZE_ENABLED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_GUIDED_ENABLED,MAV_MODE_FLAG_AUTO_ENABLED).

entries.name: MAV_MODE_TEST_DISARMED
entries.description: UNDEFINED mode. This solely depends on the autopilot - use with caution, intended for developers only. (MAV_MODE_FLAG_MANUAL_INPUT_ENABLED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_TEST_ENABLED).

entries.name: MAV_MODE_TEST_ARMED
entries.description: UNDEFINED mode. This solely depends on the autopilot - use with caution, intended for developers only (MAV_MODE_FLAG_SAFETY_ARMED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_MANUAL_INPUT_ENABLED, MAV_MODE_FLAG_TEST_ENABLED)

enums.name: MAV_FRAME
enums.description: Coordinate frames used by MAVLink. Not all frames are supported by all commands, messages, or vehicles. Global frames use the following naming conventions: - "GLOBAL": Global coordinate frame with WGS84 latitude/longitude and altitude positive over mean sea level (MSL) by default. The following modifiers may be used with "GLOBAL": - "RELATIVE_ALT": Altitude is relative to the vehicle home position rather than MSL. - "TERRAIN_ALT": Altitude is relative to ground level rather than MSL. - "INT": Latitude/longitude (in degrees) are scaled by multiplying by 1E7. Local frames use the following naming conventions: - "LOCAL": Origin of local frame is fixed relative to earth. Unless otherwise specified this origin is the origin of the vehicle position-estimator ("EKF"). - "BODY": Origin of local frame travels with the vehicle. NOTE, "BODY" does NOT indicate alignment of frame axis with vehicle attitude. - "OFFSET": Deprecated synonym for "BODY" (origin travels with the vehicle). Not to be used for new frames. Some deprecated frames do not follow these conventions (e.g. MAV_FRAME_BODY_NED and MAV_FRAME_BODY_OFFSET_NED).

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL
entries.description: Global (WGS84) coordinate frame + altitude relative to mean sea level (MSL).

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_NED
entries.description: NED local tangent frame (x: North, y: East, z: Down) with origin fixed relative to earth.

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_MISSION
entries.description: NOT a coordinate frame, indicates a mission command.

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL_RELATIVE_ALT
entries.description: Global (WGS84) coordinate frame + altitude relative to the home position.

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_ENU
entries.description: ENU local tangent frame (x: East, y: North, z: Up) with origin fixed relative to earth.

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL_INT
entries.description: Global (WGS84) coordinate frame (scaled) + altitude relative to mean sea level (MSL).

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL_RELATIVE_ALT_INT
entries.description: Global (WGS84) coordinate frame (scaled) + altitude relative to the home position.

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_OFFSET_NED
entries.description: NED local tangent frame (x: North, y: East, z: Down) with origin that travels with the vehicle.

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_BODY_NED
entries.description: Same as MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_NED when used to represent position values. Same as MAV_FRAME_BODY_FRD when used with velocity/acceleration values.

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_BODY_OFFSET_NED
entries.description: This is the same as MAV_FRAME_BODY_FRD.

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL_TERRAIN_ALT
entries.description: Global (WGS84) coordinate frame with AGL altitude (altitude at ground level).

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL_TERRAIN_ALT_INT
entries.description: Global (WGS84) coordinate frame (scaled) with AGL altitude (altitude at ground level).

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_BODY_FRD
entries.description: FRD local frame aligned to the vehicle's attitude (x: Forward, y: Right, z: Down) with an origin that travels with vehicle.

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_RESERVED_13
entries.description: MAV_FRAME_BODY_FLU - Body fixed frame of reference, Z-up (x: Forward, y: Left, z: Up).

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_RESERVED_14
entries.description: MAV_FRAME_MOCAP_NED - Odometry local coordinate frame of data given by a motion capture system, Z-down (x: North, y: East, z: Down).

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_RESERVED_15
entries.description: MAV_FRAME_MOCAP_ENU - Odometry local coordinate frame of data given by a motion capture system, Z-up (x: East, y: North, z: Up).

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_RESERVED_16
entries.description: MAV_FRAME_VISION_NED - Odometry local coordinate frame of data given by a vision estimation system, Z-down (x: North, y: East, z: Down).

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_RESERVED_17
entries.description: MAV_FRAME_VISION_ENU - Odometry local coordinate frame of data given by a vision estimation system, Z-up (x: East, y: North, z: Up).

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_RESERVED_18
entries.description: MAV_FRAME_ESTIM_NED - Odometry local coordinate frame of data given by an estimator running onboard the vehicle, Z-down (x: North, y: East, z: Down).

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_RESERVED_19
entries.description: MAV_FRAME_ESTIM_ENU - Odometry local coordinate frame of data given by an estimator running onboard the vehicle, Z-up (x: East, y: North, z: Up).

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_FRD
entries.description: FRD local tangent frame (x: Forward, y: Right, z: Down) with origin fixed relative to earth. The forward axis is aligned to the front of the vehicle in the horizontal plane.

entries.name: MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_FLU
entries.description: FLU local tangent frame (x: Forward, y: Left, z: Up) with origin fixed relative to earth. The forward axis is aligned to the front of the vehicle in the horizontal plane.

enums.name: FENCE_TYPE
enums.description: Fence types to enable or disable when using MAV_CMD_DO_FENCE_ENABLE. Note that at least one of these flags must be set in MAV_CMD_DO_FENCE_ENABLE.param2. If none are set, the flight stack will ignore the field and enable/disable its default set of fences (usually all of them).

entries.name: FENCE_TYPE_ALT_MAX
entries.description: Maximum altitude fence

entries.name: FENCE_TYPE_CIRCLE
entries.description: Circle fence

entries.name: FENCE_TYPE_POLYGON
entries.description: Polygon fence

entries.name: FENCE_TYPE_ALT_MIN
entries.description: Minimum altitude fence

enums.name: MAV_MOUNT_MODE
enums.description: Enumeration of possible mount operation modes. This message is used by obsolete/deprecated gimbal messages.

entries.name: MAV_MOUNT_MODE_RETRACT
entries.description: Load and keep safe position (Roll,Pitch,Yaw) from permanent memory and stop stabilization

entries.name: MAV_MOUNT_MODE_NEUTRAL
entries.description: Load and keep neutral position (Roll,Pitch,Yaw) from permanent memory.

entries.name: MAV_MOUNT_MODE_MAVLINK_TARGETING
entries.description: Load neutral position and start MAVLink Roll,Pitch,Yaw control with stabilization

entries.name: MAV_MOUNT_MODE_RC_TARGETING
entries.description: Load neutral position and start RC Roll,Pitch,Yaw control with stabilization

entries.name: MAV_MOUNT_MODE_GPS_POINT
entries.description: Load neutral position and start to point to Lat,Lon,Alt

entries.name: MAV_MOUNT_MODE_SYSID_TARGET
entries.description: Gimbal tracks system with specified system ID

entries.name: MAV_MOUNT_MODE_HOME_LOCATION
entries.description: Gimbal tracks home position

enums.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS
enums.description: Gimbal device (low level) capability flags (bitmap).

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_RETRACT
entries.description: Gimbal device supports a retracted position.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_NEUTRAL
entries.description: Gimbal device supports a horizontal, forward looking position, stabilized.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_ROLL_AXIS
entries.description: Gimbal device supports rotating around roll axis.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_ROLL_FOLLOW
entries.description: Gimbal device supports to follow a roll angle relative to the vehicle.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_ROLL_LOCK
entries.description: Gimbal device supports locking to a roll angle (generally that's the default with roll stabilized).

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_PITCH_AXIS
entries.description: Gimbal device supports rotating around pitch axis.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_PITCH_FOLLOW
entries.description: Gimbal device supports to follow a pitch angle relative to the vehicle.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_PITCH_LOCK
entries.description: Gimbal device supports locking to a pitch angle (generally that's the default with pitch stabilized).

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_YAW_AXIS
entries.description: Gimbal device supports rotating around yaw axis.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_YAW_FOLLOW
entries.description: Gimbal device supports to follow a yaw angle relative to the vehicle (generally that's the default).

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_YAW_LOCK
entries.description: Gimbal device supports locking to an absolute heading, i.e., yaw angle relative to North (earth frame, often this is an option available).

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_SUPPORTS_INFINITE_YAW
entries.description: Gimbal device supports yawing/panning infinitely (e.g. using slip disk).

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_SUPPORTS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME
entries.description: Gimbal device supports yaw angles and angular velocities relative to North (earth frame). This usually requires support by an autopilot via AUTOPILOT_STATE_FOR_GIMBAL_DEVICE. Support can go on and off during runtime, which is reported by the flag GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_CAN_ACCEPT_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_RC_INPUTS
entries.description: Gimbal device supports radio control inputs as an alternative input for controlling the gimbal orientation.

enums.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS
enums.description: Gimbal manager high level capability flags (bitmap). The first 16 bits are identical to the GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS. However, the gimbal manager does not need to copy the flags from the gimbal but can also enhance the capabilities and thus add flags.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_RETRACT
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_RETRACT.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_NEUTRAL
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_NEUTRAL.

entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_ROLL_AXIS.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_ROLL_FOLLOW
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_ROLL_FOLLOW.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_ROLL_LOCK
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_ROLL_LOCK.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_PITCH_AXIS
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_PITCH_AXIS.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_PITCH_FOLLOW
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_PITCH_FOLLOW.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_PITCH_LOCK
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_PITCH_LOCK.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_YAW_AXIS
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_YAW_AXIS.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_YAW_FOLLOW
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_YAW_FOLLOW.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_YAW_LOCK
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_YAW_LOCK.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_SUPPORTS_INFINITE_YAW
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_SUPPORTS_INFINITE_YAW.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_SUPPORTS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_SUPPORTS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_RC_INPUTS
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_RC_INPUTS.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_CAN_POINT_LOCATION_LOCAL
entries.description: Gimbal manager supports to point to a local position.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_CAP_FLAGS_CAN_POINT_LOCATION_GLOBAL
entries.description: Gimbal manager supports to point to a global latitude, longitude, altitude position.

enums.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS
enums.description: Flags for gimbal device (lower level) operation.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_RETRACT
entries.description: Set to retracted safe position (no stabilization), takes precedence over all other flags.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_NEUTRAL
entries.description: Set to neutral/default position, taking precedence over all other flags except RETRACT. Neutral is commonly forward-facing and horizontal (roll=pitch=yaw=0) but may be any orientation.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_ROLL_LOCK
entries.description: Lock roll angle to absolute angle relative to horizon (not relative to vehicle). This is generally the default with a stabilizing gimbal.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_PITCH_LOCK
entries.description: Lock pitch angle to absolute angle relative to horizon (not relative to vehicle). This is generally the default with a stabilizing gimbal.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_LOCK
entries.description: Lock yaw angle to absolute angle relative to North (not relative to vehicle). If this flag is set, the yaw angle and z component of angular velocity are relative to North (earth frame, x-axis pointing North), else they are relative to the vehicle heading (vehicle frame, earth frame rotated so that the x-axis is pointing forward).

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_VEHICLE_FRAME
entries.description: Yaw angle and z component of angular velocity are relative to the vehicle heading (vehicle frame, earth frame rotated such that the x-axis is pointing forward).

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME
entries.description: Yaw angle and z component of angular velocity are relative to North (earth frame, x-axis is pointing North).

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_ACCEPTS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME
entries.description: Gimbal device can accept yaw angle inputs relative to North (earth frame). This flag is only for reporting (attempts to set this flag are ignored).

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_RC_EXCLUSIVE
entries.description: The gimbal orientation is set exclusively by the RC signals feed to the gimbal's radio control inputs. MAVLink messages for setting the gimbal orientation (GIMBAL_DEVICE_SET_ATTITUDE) are ignored.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_RC_MIXED
entries.description: The gimbal orientation is determined by combining/mixing the RC signals feed to the gimbal's radio control inputs and the MAVLink messages for setting the gimbal orientation (GIMBAL_DEVICE_SET_ATTITUDE). How these two controls are combined or mixed is not defined by the protocol but is up to the implementation.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_RETRACT

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_NEUTRAL

entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_PITCH_LOCK.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_YAW_LOCK
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_LOCK.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_YAW_IN_VEHICLE_FRAME
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_VEHICLE_FRAME.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME
entries.description: Based on GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME.

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_ACCEPTS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME

entries.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_RC_MIXED

enums.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS
enums.description: Gimbal device (low level) error flags (bitmap, 0 means no error)

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_AT_ROLL_LIMIT
entries.description: Gimbal device is limited by hardware roll limit.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_AT_PITCH_LIMIT
entries.description: Gimbal device is limited by hardware pitch limit.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_AT_YAW_LIMIT
entries.description: Gimbal device is limited by hardware yaw limit.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_ENCODER_ERROR
entries.description: There is an error with the gimbal encoders.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_POWER_ERROR
entries.description: There is an error with the gimbal power source.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_MOTOR_ERROR
entries.description: There is an error with the gimbal motors.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_SOFTWARE_ERROR
entries.description: There is an error with the gimbal's software.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_COMMS_ERROR
entries.description: There is an error with the gimbal's communication.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_CALIBRATION_RUNNING
entries.description: Gimbal device is currently calibrating.

entries.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_ERROR_FLAGS_NO_MANAGER
entries.description: Gimbal device is not assigned to a gimbal manager.

enums.name: GRIPPER_ACTIONS
enums.description: Gripper actions.

entries.name: GRIPPER_ACTION_RELEASE
entries.description: Gripper release cargo.

entries.name: GRIPPER_ACTION_GRAB
entries.description: Gripper grab onto cargo.

entries.name: GRIPPER_ACTION_HOLD
entries.description: Gripper hold current grip state/position.

enums.name: WINCH_ACTIONS
enums.description: Winch actions.

entries.name: WINCH_RELAXED
entries.description: Allow motor to freewheel.

entries.name: WINCH_RELATIVE_LENGTH_CONTROL
entries.description: Wind or unwind specified length of line, optionally using specified rate.

entries.name: WINCH_RATE_CONTROL
entries.description: Wind or unwind line at specified rate.

entries.name: WINCH_LOCK
entries.description: Perform the locking sequence to relieve motor while in the fully retracted position. Only action and instance command parameters are used, others are ignored.

entries.name: WINCH_DELIVER
entries.description: Sequence of drop, slow down, touch down, reel up, lock. Only action and instance command parameters are used, others are ignored.

entries.name: WINCH_HOLD
entries.description: Engage motor and hold current position. Only action and instance command parameters are used, others are ignored.

entries.name: WINCH_RETRACT
entries.description: Return the reel to the fully retracted position. Only action and instance command parameters are used, others are ignored.

entries.name: WINCH_LOAD_LINE
entries.description: Load the reel with line. The winch will calculate the total loaded length and stop when the tension exceeds a threshold. Only action and instance command parameters are used, others are ignored.

entries.name: WINCH_ABANDON_LINE
entries.description: Spool out the entire length of the line. Only action and instance command parameters are used, others are ignored.

entries.name: WINCH_LOAD_PAYLOAD
entries.description: Spools out just enough to present the hook to the user to load the payload. Only action and instance command parameters are used, others are ignored

enums.name: UAVCAN_NODE_HEALTH
enums.description: Generalized UAVCAN node health

entries.name: UAVCAN_NODE_HEALTH_OK
entries.description: The node is functioning properly.

entries.name: UAVCAN_NODE_HEALTH_WARNING
entries.description: A critical parameter went out of range or the node has encountered a minor failure.

entries.name: UAVCAN_NODE_HEALTH_ERROR
entries.description: The node has encountered a major failure.

entries.name: UAVCAN_NODE_HEALTH_CRITICAL
entries.description: The node has suffered a fatal malfunction.

enums.name: UAVCAN_NODE_MODE
enums.description: Generalized UAVCAN node mode

entries.name: UAVCAN_NODE_MODE_OPERATIONAL
entries.description: The node is performing its primary functions.

entries.name: UAVCAN_NODE_MODE_INITIALIZATION
entries.description: The node is initializing; this mode is entered immediately after startup.

entries.name: UAVCAN_NODE_MODE_MAINTENANCE
entries.description: The node is under maintenance.

entries.name: UAVCAN_NODE_MODE_SOFTWARE_UPDATE
entries.description: The node is in the process of updating its software.

entries.name: UAVCAN_NODE_MODE_OFFLINE
entries.description: The node is no longer available online.

enums.name: STORAGE_STATUS

entries.name: STORAGE_STATUS_EMPTY
entries.description: Storage is missing (no microSD card loaded for example.)

entries.name: STORAGE_STATUS_UNFORMATTED
entries.description: Storage present but unformatted.

entries.name: STORAGE_STATUS_READY
entries.description: Storage present and ready.

entries.name: STORAGE_STATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED
entries.description: Camera does not supply storage status information. Capacity information in STORAGE_INFORMATION fields will be ignored.

enums.name: STORAGE_TYPE
enums.description: Flags to indicate the type of storage.

entries.name: STORAGE_TYPE_UNKNOWN
entries.description: Storage type is not known.

entries.name: STORAGE_TYPE_USB_STICK
entries.description: Storage type is USB device.

entries.name: STORAGE_TYPE_SD
entries.description: Storage type is SD card.

entries.name: STORAGE_TYPE_MICROSD
entries.description: Storage type is microSD card.

entries.name: STORAGE_TYPE_CF
entries.description: Storage type is CFast.

entries.name: STORAGE_TYPE_CFE
entries.description: Storage type is CFexpress.

entries.name: STORAGE_TYPE_XQD
entries.description: Storage type is XQD.

entries.name: STORAGE_TYPE_HD
entries.description: Storage type is HD mass storage type.

entries.name: STORAGE_TYPE_OTHER
entries.description: Storage type is other, not listed type.

enums.name: STORAGE_USAGE_FLAG
enums.description: Flags to indicate usage for a particular storage (see STORAGE_INFORMATION.storage_usage and MAV_CMD_SET_STORAGE_USAGE).

entries.name: STORAGE_USAGE_FLAG_SET
entries.description: Always set to 1 (indicates STORAGE_INFORMATION.storage_usage is supported).

entries.name: STORAGE_USAGE_FLAG_PHOTO

entries.name: STORAGE_USAGE_FLAG_VIDEO
entries.description: Storage for saving videos.

entries.name: STORAGE_USAGE_FLAG_LOGS
entries.description: Storage for saving logs.

enums.name: ORBIT_YAW_BEHAVIOUR
enums.description: Yaw behaviour during orbit flight.

entries.name: ORBIT_YAW_BEHAVIOUR_HOLD_FRONT_TO_CIRCLE_CENTER
entries.description: Vehicle front points to the center (default).

entries.name: ORBIT_YAW_BEHAVIOUR_HOLD_INITIAL_HEADING
entries.description: Vehicle front holds heading when message received.

entries.name: ORBIT_YAW_BEHAVIOUR_UNCONTROLLED
entries.description: Yaw uncontrolled.

entries.name: ORBIT_YAW_BEHAVIOUR_HOLD_FRONT_TANGENT_TO_CIRCLE
entries.description: Vehicle front follows flight path (tangential to circle).

entries.name: ORBIT_YAW_BEHAVIOUR_RC_CONTROLLED
entries.description: Yaw controlled by RC input.

entries.name: ORBIT_YAW_BEHAVIOUR_UNCHANGED
entries.description: Vehicle uses current yaw behaviour (unchanged). The vehicle-default yaw behaviour is used if this value is specified when orbit is first commanded.

enums.name: COMP_METADATA_TYPE
enums.description: Supported component metadata types. These are used in the "general" metadata file returned by COMPONENT_METADATA to provide information about supported metadata types. The types are not used directly in MAVLink messages.

entries.name: COMP_METADATA_TYPE_GENERAL
entries.description: General information about the component. General metadata includes information about other metadata types supported by the component. Files of this type must be supported, and must be downloadable from vehicle using a MAVLink FTP URI.

entries.name: COMP_METADATA_TYPE_PARAMETER
entries.description: Parameter meta data.

entries.name: COMP_METADATA_TYPE_COMMANDS
entries.description: Meta data that specifies which commands and command parameters the vehicle supports. (WIP)

entries.name: COMP_METADATA_TYPE_PERIPHERALS

entries.name: COMP_METADATA_TYPE_EVENTS
entries.description: Meta data for the events interface.

entries.name: COMP_METADATA_TYPE_ACTUATORS
entries.description: Meta data for actuator configuration (motors, servos and vehicle geometry) and testing.

enums.name: ACTUATOR_CONFIGURATION

entries.name: ACTUATOR_CONFIGURATION_BEEP

entries.name: ACTUATOR_CONFIGURATION_3D_MODE_ON
entries.description: Permanently set the actuator (ESC) to 3D mode (reversible thrust).

entries.name: ACTUATOR_CONFIGURATION_3D_MODE_OFF

entries.name: ACTUATOR_CONFIGURATION_SPIN_DIRECTION1
entries.description: Permanently set the actuator (ESC) to spin direction 1 (which can be clockwise or counter-clockwise).

entries.name: ACTUATOR_CONFIGURATION_SPIN_DIRECTION2
entries.description: Permanently set the actuator (ESC) to spin direction 2 (opposite of direction 1).

enums.name: AUTOTUNE_AXIS
enums.description: Axes that will be autotuned by MAV_CMD_DO_AUTOTUNE_ENABLE. Note that at least one flag must be set in MAV_CMD_DO_AUTOTUNE_ENABLE.param2: if none are set, the flight stack will tune its default set of axes.

entries.name: AUTOTUNE_AXIS_ROLL
entries.description: Autotune roll axis.

entries.name: AUTOTUNE_AXIS_PITCH
entries.description: Autotune pitch axis.

entries.name: AUTOTUNE_AXIS_YAW
entries.description: Autotune yaw axis.

enums.name: PREFLIGHT_STORAGE_PARAMETER_ACTION
enums.description: Actions for reading/writing parameters between persistent and volatile storage when using MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_STORAGE. (Commonly parameters are loaded from persistent storage (flash/EEPROM) into volatile storage (RAM) on startup and written back when they are changed.)

entries.name: PARAM_READ_PERSISTENT
entries.description: Read all parameters from persistent storage. Replaces values in volatile storage.

entries.name: PARAM_WRITE_PERSISTENT
entries.description: Write all parameter values to persistent storage (flash/EEPROM)

entries.name: PARAM_RESET_CONFIG_DEFAULT
entries.description: Reset all user configurable parameters to their default value (including airframe selection, sensor calibration data, safety settings, and so on). Does not reset values that contain operation counters and vehicle computed statistics.

entries.name: PARAM_RESET_SENSOR_DEFAULT
entries.description: Reset only sensor calibration parameters to factory defaults (or firmware default if not available)

entries.name: PARAM_RESET_ALL_DEFAULT
entries.description: Reset all parameters, including operation counters, to default values

enums.name: PREFLIGHT_STORAGE_MISSION_ACTION
enums.description: Actions for reading and writing plan information (mission, rally points, geofence) between persistent and volatile storage when using MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_STORAGE. (Commonly missions are loaded from persistent storage (flash/EEPROM) into volatile storage (RAM) on startup and written back when they are changed.)

entries.name: MISSION_READ_PERSISTENT
entries.description: Read current mission data from persistent storage

entries.name: MISSION_WRITE_PERSISTENT
entries.description: Write current mission data to persistent storage

entries.name: MISSION_RESET_DEFAULT
entries.description: Erase all mission data stored on the vehicle (both persistent and volatile storage)

enums.name: REBOOT_SHUTDOWN_ACTION
enums.description: Reboot/shutdown action for selected component in MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_REBOOT_SHUTDOWN.

entries.name: REBOOT_SHUTDOWN_ACTION_NONE
entries.description: Do nothing.

entries.name: REBOOT_SHUTDOWN_ACTION_REBOOT
entries.description: Reboot component.

entries.name: REBOOT_SHUTDOWN_ACTION_SHUTDOWN
entries.description: Shutdown component.

entries.name: REBOOT_SHUTDOWN_ACTION_REBOOT_TO_BOOTLOADER
entries.description: Reboot component and keep it in the bootloader until upgraded.

entries.name: REBOOT_SHUTDOWN_ACTION_POWER_ON
entries.description: Power on component. Do nothing if component is already powered (ACK command with MAV_RESULT_ACCEPTED).

enums.name: REBOOT_SHUTDOWN_CONDITIONS
enums.description: Specifies the conditions under which the MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_REBOOT_SHUTDOWN command should be accepted.

entries.name: REBOOT_SHUTDOWN_CONDITIONS_SAFETY_INTERLOCKED
entries.description: Reboot/Shutdown only if allowed by safety checks, such as being landed.

entries.name: REBOOT_SHUTDOWN_CONDITIONS_FORCE
entries.description: Force reboot/shutdown of the autopilot/component regardless of system state.

enums.name: MAV_CMD
enums.description: Commands to be executed by the MAV. They can be executed on user request, or as part of a mission script. If the action is used in a mission, the parameter mapping to the waypoint/mission message is as follows: Param 1, Param 2, Param 3, Param 4, X: Param 5, Y:Param 6, Z:Param 7. This command list is similar what ARINC 424 is for commercial aircraft: A data format how to interpret waypoint/mission data. NaN and INT32_MAX may be used in float/integer params (respectively) to indicate optional/default values (e.g. to use the component's current yaw or latitude rather than a specific value). See https://mavlink.io/en/guide/xml_schema.html#MAV_CMD for information about the structure of the MAV_CMD entries

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_WAYPOINT
entries.description: Navigate to waypoint. This is intended for use in missions (for guided commands outside of missions use MAV_CMD_DO_REPOSITION).

params.label: Hold
params.description: Hold time. (ignored by fixed wing, time to stay at waypoint for rotary wing)

params.label: Accept Radius
params.description: Acceptance radius (if the sphere with this radius is hit, the waypoint counts as reached)

params.label: Pass Radius
params.description: 0 to pass through the WP, if > 0 radius to pass by WP. Positive value for clockwise orbit, negative value for counter-clockwise orbit. Allows trajectory control.

params.label: Yaw
params.description: Desired yaw angle at waypoint (rotary wing). NaN to use the current system yaw heading mode (e.g. yaw towards next waypoint, yaw to home, etc.).

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_UNLIM
entries.description: Loiter around this waypoint an unlimited amount of time

params.label: Radius
params.description: Loiter radius around waypoint for forward-only moving vehicles (not multicopters). If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise

params.label: Yaw
params.description: Desired yaw angle. NaN to use the current system yaw heading mode (e.g. yaw towards next waypoint, yaw to home, etc.).

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TURNS
entries.description: Loiter around this waypoint for X turns

params.label: Heading Required
params.description: Leave loiter circle only when track heads towards the next waypoint (MAV_BOOL_FALSE: Leave when turns complete). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

params.label: Radius
params.description: Loiter radius around waypoint for forward-only moving vehicles (not multicopters). If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise

params.label: Xtrack Location
params.description: Loiter circle exit location and/or path to next waypoint ("xtrack") for forward-only moving vehicles (not multicopters). 0 for the vehicle to converge towards the center xtrack when it leaves the loiter (the line between the centers of the current and next waypoint), 1 to converge to the direct line between the location that the vehicle exits the loiter radius and the next waypoint. Otherwise the angle (in degrees) between the tangent of the loiter circle and the center xtrack at which the vehicle must leave the loiter (and converge to the center xtrack). NaN to use the current system default xtrack behaviour.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TIME
entries.description: Loiter at the specified latitude, longitude and altitude for a certain amount of time. Multicopter vehicles stop at the point (within a vehicle-specific acceptance radius). Forward-only moving vehicles (e.g. fixed-wing) circle the point with the specified radius/direction. If the Heading Required parameter (2) is non-zero forward moving aircraft will only leave the loiter circle once heading towards the next waypoint.

params.label: Time
params.description: Loiter time (only starts once Lat, Lon and Alt is reached).

params.label: Heading Required
params.description: Leave loiter circle only when track heading towards the next waypoint (MAV_BOOL_FALSE: Leave on time expiry). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

params.label: Radius
params.description: Loiter radius around waypoint for forward-only moving vehicles (not multicopters). If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise.

params.label: Xtrack Location
params.description: Loiter circle exit location and/or path to next waypoint ("xtrack") for forward-only moving vehicles (not multicopters). 0 for the vehicle to converge towards the center xtrack when it leaves the loiter (the line between the centers of the current and next waypoint), 1 to converge to the direct line between the location that the vehicle exits the loiter radius and the next waypoint. Otherwise the angle (in degrees) between the tangent of the loiter circle and the center xtrack at which the vehicle must leave the loiter (and converge to the center xtrack). NaN to use the current system default xtrack behaviour.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_RETURN_TO_LAUNCH
entries.description: Return to launch location

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAND
entries.description: Land at location.

params.label: Abort Alt
params.description: Minimum target altitude if landing is aborted (0 = undefined/use system default).

params.label: Yaw Angle
params.description: Desired yaw angle. NaN to use the current system yaw heading mode (e.g. yaw towards next waypoint, yaw to home, etc.).

params.label: Altitude
params.description: Landing altitude (ground level in current frame).

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_TAKEOFF
entries.description: Takeoff from ground / hand. Vehicles that support multiple takeoff modes (e.g. VTOL quadplane) should take off using the currently configured mode.

params.label: Pitch
params.description: Minimum pitch (if airspeed sensor present), desired pitch without sensor

params.label: Yaw
params.description: Yaw angle (if magnetometer present), ignored without magnetometer. NaN to use the current system yaw heading mode (e.g. yaw towards next waypoint, yaw to home, etc.).

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAND_LOCAL
entries.description: Land at local position (local frame only)

params.label: Offset
params.description: Maximum accepted offset from desired landing position - computed magnitude from spherical coordinates: d = sqrt(x^2 + y^2 + z^2), which gives the maximum accepted distance between the desired landing position and the position where the vehicle is about to land

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_TAKEOFF_LOCAL
entries.description: Takeoff from local position (local frame only)

params.label: Pitch
params.description: Minimum pitch (if airspeed sensor present), desired pitch without sensor

params.label: Yaw
params.description: Yaw angle (if magnetometer or another yaw estimation source present), ignored without one of these

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FOLLOW
entries.description: Vehicle following, i.e. this waypoint represents the position of a moving vehicle

params.label: Following
params.description: Following logic to use (e.g. loitering or sinusoidal following) - depends on specific autopilot implementation

params.label: Ground Speed
params.description: Ground speed of vehicle to be followed

params.label: Radius
params.description: Radius around waypoint. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_CONTINUE_AND_CHANGE_ALT
entries.description: Continue on the current course and climb/descend to specified altitude. When the altitude is reached continue to the next command (i.e., don't proceed to the next command until the desired altitude is reached.

params.label: Action
params.description: Climb or Descend (0 = Neutral, command completes when within 5m of this command's altitude, 1 = Climbing, command completes when at or above this command's altitude, 2 = Descending, command completes when at or below this command's altitude.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TO_ALT
entries.description: Begin loiter at the specified Latitude and Longitude. If Lat=Lon=0, then loiter at the current position. Don't consider the navigation command complete (don't leave loiter) until the altitude has been reached. Additionally, if the Heading Required parameter is non-zero the aircraft will not leave the loiter until heading toward the next waypoint.

params.label: Heading Required
params.description: Leave loiter circle only when track heading towards the next waypoint (MAV_BOOL_FALSE: Leave when altitude reached). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

params.label: Radius
params.description: Loiter radius around waypoint for forward-only moving vehicles (not multicopters). If positive loiter clockwise, negative counter-clockwise, 0 means no change to standard loiter.

params.label: Xtrack Location
params.description: Loiter circle exit location and/or path to next waypoint ("xtrack") for forward-only moving vehicles (not multicopters). 0 for the vehicle to converge towards the center xtrack when it leaves the loiter (the line between the centers of the current and next waypoint), 1 to converge to the direct line between the location that the vehicle exits the loiter radius and the next waypoint. Otherwise the angle (in degrees) between the tangent of the loiter circle and the center xtrack at which the vehicle must leave the loiter (and converge to the center xtrack). NaN to use the current system default xtrack behaviour.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FOLLOW
entries.description: Begin following a target

params.label: System ID
params.description: System ID (of the FOLLOW_TARGET beacon). Send 0 to disable follow-me and return to the default position hold mode.

params.label: Altitude Mode
params.description: Altitude mode: 0: Keep current altitude, 1: keep altitude difference to target, 2: go to a fixed altitude above home.

params.label: Time to Land
params.description: Time to land in which the MAV should go to the default position hold mode after a message RX timeout.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FOLLOW_REPOSITION
entries.description: Reposition the MAV after a follow target command has been sent

params.label: Camera Q1
params.description: Camera q1 (where 0 is on the ray from the camera to the tracking device)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_ORBIT
entries.description: Start orbiting on the circumference of a circle defined by the parameters. Setting values to NaN/INT32_MAX (as appropriate) results in using defaults.

params.label: Radius
params.description: Radius of the circle. Positive: orbit clockwise. Negative: orbit counter-clockwise. NaN: Use vehicle default radius, or current radius if already orbiting.

params.label: Velocity
params.description: Tangential Velocity. NaN: Use vehicle default velocity, or current velocity if already orbiting.

params.label: Orbits
params.description: Orbit around the centre point for this many radians (i.e. for a three-quarter orbit set 270*Pi/180). 0: Orbit forever. NaN: Use vehicle default, or current value if already orbiting.

params.label: Latitude/X
params.description: Center point latitude (if no MAV_FRAME specified) / X coordinate according to MAV_FRAME. INT32_MAX (or NaN if sent in COMMAND_LONG): Use current vehicle position, or current center if already orbiting.

params.label: Longitude/Y
params.description: Center point longitude (if no MAV_FRAME specified) / Y coordinate according to MAV_FRAME. INT32_MAX (or NaN if sent in COMMAND_LONG): Use current vehicle position, or current center if already orbiting.

params.label: Altitude/Z
params.description: Center point altitude (MSL) (if no MAV_FRAME specified) / Z coordinate according to MAV_FRAME. NaN: Use current vehicle altitude.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FIGURE_EIGHT
entries.description: Fly a figure eight path as defined by the parameters. Set parameters to NaN/INT32_MAX (as appropriate) to use system-default values. The command is intended for fixed wing vehicles (and VTOL hybrids flying in fixed-wing mode), allowing POI tracking for gimbals that don't support infinite rotation. This command only defines the flight path. Speed should be set independently (use e.g. MAV_CMD_DO_CHANGE_SPEED). Yaw and other degrees of freedom are not specified, and will be flight-stack specific (on vehicles where they can be controlled independent of the heading).

params.label: Major Radius
params.description: Major axis radius of the figure eight. Positive: orbit the north circle clockwise. Negative: orbit the north circle counter-clockwise. NaN: The radius will be set to 2.5 times the minor radius and direction is clockwise. Must be greater or equal to two times the minor radius for feasible values.

params.label: Minor Radius
params.description: Minor axis radius of the figure eight. Defines the radius of the two circles that make up the figure. Negative value has no effect. NaN: The radius will be set to the default loiter radius.

params.label: Orientation
params.description: Orientation of the figure eight major axis with respect to true north (range: [-pi,pi]). NaN: use default orientation aligned to true north.

params.label: Latitude/X
params.description: Center point latitude/X coordinate according to MAV_FRAME. If no MAV_FRAME specified, MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL is assumed. INT32_MAX or NaN: Use current vehicle position, or current center if already loitering.

params.label: Longitude/Y
params.description: Center point longitude/Y coordinate according to MAV_FRAME. If no MAV_FRAME specified, MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL is assumed. INT32_MAX or NaN: Use current vehicle position, or current center if already loitering.

params.label: Altitude/Z
params.description: Center point altitude MSL/Z coordinate according to MAV_FRAME. If no MAV_FRAME specified, MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL is assumed. INT32_MAX or NaN: Use current vehicle altitude.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_ROI
entries.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) for a sensor set or the vehicle itself. This can then be used by the vehicle's control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.

params.label: WP Index
params.description: Waypoint index/ target ID. (see MAV_ROI enum)

params.label: ROI Index
params.description: ROI index (allows a vehicle to manage multiple ROI's)

params.label: X
params.description: x the location of the fixed ROI (see MAV_FRAME)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_PATHPLANNING
entries.description: Control autonomous path planning on the MAV.

params.label: Local Ctrl
params.description: 0: Disable local obstacle avoidance / local path planning (without resetting map), 1: Enable local path planning, 2: Enable and reset local path planning

params.label: Global Ctrl
params.description: 0: Disable full path planning (without resetting map), 1: Enable, 2: Enable and reset map/occupancy grid, 3: Enable and reset planned route, but not occupancy grid

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_SPLINE_WAYPOINT
entries.description: Navigate to waypoint using a spline path.

params.label: Hold
params.description: Hold time. (ignored by fixed wing, time to stay at waypoint for rotary wing)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_VTOL_TAKEOFF
entries.description: Takeoff from ground using VTOL mode, and transition to forward flight with specified heading. The command should be ignored by vehicles that dont support both VTOL and fixed-wing flight (multicopters, boats,etc.).

params.label: Yaw Angle
params.description: Yaw angle. NaN to use the current system yaw heading mode (e.g. yaw towards next waypoint, yaw to home, etc.).

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_VTOL_LAND
entries.description: Land using VTOL mode

params.label: Approach Altitude
params.description: Approach altitude (with the same reference as the Altitude field). NaN if unspecified.

params.label: Yaw
params.description: Yaw angle. NaN to use the current system yaw heading mode (e.g. yaw towards next waypoint, yaw to home, etc.).

params.label: Ground Altitude
params.description: Altitude (ground level) relative to the current coordinate frame. NaN to use system default landing altitude (ignore value).

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_GUIDED_ENABLE
entries.description: Hand control over to an external controller

params.label: Enable
params.description: Guided mode on (MAV_BOOL_FALSE: Off). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_DELAY
entries.description: Delay the next navigation command a number of seconds or until a specified time

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_PAYLOAD_PLACE
entries.description: Descend and place payload. Vehicle moves to specified location, descends until it detects a hanging payload has reached the ground, and then releases the payload. If ground is not detected before the reaching the maximum descent value (param1), the command will complete without releasing the payload.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAST
entries.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the NAV/ACTION commands in the enumeration

entries.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_DELAY
entries.description: Delay mission state machine.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_CHANGE_ALT
entries.description: Ascend/descend to target altitude at specified rate. Delay mission state machine until desired altitude reached.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_DISTANCE
entries.description: Delay mission state machine until within desired distance of next NAV point.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_YAW
entries.description: Reach a certain target angle.

params.label: Angle
params.description: target angle [0-360]. Absolute angles: 0 is north. Relative angle: 0 is initial yaw. Direction set by param3.

params.label: Direction
params.description: direction: -1: counter clockwise, 0: shortest direction, 1: clockwise

params.label: Relative
params.description: Relative offset (MAV_BOOL_FALSE: absolute angle). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_LAST
entries.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the CONDITION commands in the enumeration

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MODE
entries.description: Set system mode.

params.label: Mode
params.description: Mode flags. MAV_MODE values can be used to set some mode flag combinations.

params.label: Custom Mode
params.description: Custom system-specific mode (see target autopilot specifications for mode information). If MAV_MODE_FLAG_CUSTOM_MODE_ENABLED is set in param1 (mode) this mode is used: otherwise the field is ignored.

params.label: Custom Submode
params.description: Custom sub mode - this is system specific, please refer to the individual autopilot specifications for details.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP
entries.description: Jump to the desired command in the mission list. Repeat this action only the specified number of times

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CHANGE_SPEED
entries.description: Change speed and/or throttle set points. The value persists until it is overridden or there is a mode change

params.label: Speed Type
params.description: Speed type of value set in param2 (such as airspeed, ground speed, and so on)

params.label: Speed
params.description: Speed (-1 indicates no change, -2 indicates return to default vehicle speed)

params.label: Throttle
params.description: Throttle (-1 indicates no change, -2 indicates return to default vehicle throttle value)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_HOME
entries.description: Sets the home position to either to the current position or a specified position. The home position is the default position that the system will return to and land on. The position is set automatically by the system during the takeoff (and may also be set using this command). Note: the current home position may be emitted in a HOME_POSITION message on request (using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE with param1=242).

params.label: Use Current
params.description: Use current location (MAV_BOOL_FALSE: use specified location). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

params.label: Roll
params.description: Roll angle (of surface). Range: -180..180 degrees. NAN or 0 means value not set. 0.01 indicates zero roll.

params.label: Pitch
params.description: Pitch angle (of surface). Range: -90..90 degrees. NAN or 0 means value not set. 0.01 means zero pitch.

params.label: Yaw
params.description: Yaw angle. NaN to use default heading. Range: -180..180 degrees.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER
entries.description: Set a system parameter. Caution! Use of this command requires knowledge of the numeric enumeration value of the parameter.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_RELAY
entries.description: Set a relay to a condition.

params.label: Setting
params.description: Setting. (1=on, 0=off, others possible depending on system hardware)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPEAT_RELAY
entries.description: Cycle a relay on and off for a desired number of cycles with a desired period.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_SERVO
entries.description: Set a servo to a desired PWM value.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPEAT_SERVO
entries.description: Cycle a between its nominal setting and a desired PWM for a desired number of cycles with a desired period.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FLIGHTTERMINATION
entries.description: Terminate flight immediately. Flight termination immediately and irreversibly terminates the current flight, returning the vehicle to ground. The vehicle will ignore RC or other input until it has been power-cycled. Termination may trigger safety measures, including: disabling motors and deployment of parachute on multicopters, and setting flight surfaces to initiate a landing pattern on fixed-wing). On multicopters without a parachute it may trigger a crash landing. Support for this command can be tested using the protocol bit: MAV_PROTOCOL_CAPABILITY_FLIGHT_TERMINATION. Support for this command can also be tested by sending the command with param1=0 (< 0.5); the ACK should be either MAV_RESULT_FAILED or MAV_RESULT_UNSUPPORTED.

params.label: Terminate
params.description: Flight termination activated if > 0.5. Otherwise not activated and ACK with MAV_RESULT_FAILED.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CHANGE_ALTITUDE
entries.description: Change altitude set point.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ACTUATOR
entries.description: Sets actuators (e.g. servos) to a desired value. The actuator numbers are mapped to specific outputs (e.g. on any MAIN or AUX PWM or UAVCAN) using a flight-stack specific mechanism (i.e. a parameter).

params.label: Actuator 1
params.description: Actuator 1 value, scaled from [-1 to 1]. NaN to ignore.

params.label: Actuator 2
params.description: Actuator 2 value, scaled from [-1 to 1]. NaN to ignore.

params.label: Actuator 3
params.description: Actuator 3 value, scaled from [-1 to 1]. NaN to ignore.

params.label: Actuator 4
params.description: Actuator 4 value, scaled from [-1 to 1]. NaN to ignore.

params.label: Actuator 5
params.description: Actuator 5 value, scaled from [-1 to 1]. NaN to ignore.

params.label: Actuator 6
params.description: Actuator 6 value, scaled from [-1 to 1]. NaN to ignore.

params.label: Index
params.description: Index of actuator set (i.e if set to 1, Actuator 1 becomes Actuator 7)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_RETURN_PATH_START
entries.description: Mission item to specify the start of a failsafe/landing return-path segment (the end of the segment is the next MAV_CMD_DO_LAND_START item). A vehicle that is using missions for landing (e.g. in a return mode) will join the mission on the closest path of the return-path segment (instead of MAV_CMD_DO_LAND_START or the nearest waypoint). The main use case is to minimize the failsafe flight path in corridor missions, where the inbound/outbound paths are constrained (by geofences) to the same particular path. The MAV_CMD_NAV_RETURN_PATH_START would be placed at the start of the return path. If a failsafe occurs on the outbound path the vehicle will move to the nearest point on the return path (which is parallel for this kind of mission), effectively turning round and following the shortest path to landing. If a failsafe occurs on the inbound path the vehicle is already on the return segment and will continue to landing. The Latitude/Longitude/Altitude are optional, and may be set to 0 if not needed. If specified, the item defines the waypoint at which the return segment starts. If sent using as a command, the vehicle will perform a mission landing (using the land segment if defined) or reject the command if mission landings are not supported, or no mission landing is defined. When used as a command any position information in the command is ignored.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_LAND_START
entries.description: Mission item to mark the start of a mission landing pattern, or a command to land with a mission landing pattern. When used in a mission, this is a marker for the start of a sequence of mission items that represent a landing pattern. It should be followed by a navigation item that defines the first waypoint of the landing sequence. The start marker positional params are used only for selecting what landing pattern to use if several are defined in the mission (the selected pattern will be the one with the marker position that is closest to the vehicle when a landing is commanded). If the marker item position has zero-values for latitude, longitude, and altitude, then landing pattern selection is instead based on the position of the first waypoint in the landing sequence. When sent as a command it triggers a landing using a mission landing pattern. The location parameters are not used in this case, and should be set to 0.

params.label: Latitude
params.description: Latitude for landing sequence selection, or 0 (see description). Ignored in commands (set 0).

params.label: Longitude
params.description: Longitude for landing sequence selection, or 0 (see description). Ignored in commands (set 0).

params.label: Altitude
params.description: Altitude for landing sequence selection, or 0 (see description). Ignored in commands (set 0).

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_RALLY_LAND
entries.description: Mission command to perform a landing from a rally point.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GO_AROUND
entries.description: Mission command to safely abort an autonomous landing.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPOSITION
entries.description: Reposition the vehicle to a specific WGS84 global position. This command is intended for guided commands (for missions use MAV_CMD_NAV_WAYPOINT instead).

params.label: Speed
params.description: Ground speed, less than 0 (-1) for default

params.label: Radius
params.description: Loiter radius for planes. Positive values only, direction is controlled by Yaw value. A value of zero or NaN is ignored.

params.label: Yaw
params.description: Yaw heading (heading reference defined in Bitmask field). NaN to use the current system yaw heading mode (e.g. yaw towards next waypoint, yaw to home, etc.). For planes indicates loiter direction (0: clockwise, 1: counter clockwise)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_PAUSE_CONTINUE
entries.description: If in a GPS controlled position mode, hold the current position or continue.

params.label: Continue
params.description: Continue mission (MAV_BOOL_TRUE), Pause current mission or reposition command, hold current position (MAV_BOOL_FALSE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid. A VTOL capable vehicle should enter hover mode (multicopter and VTOL planes). A plane should loiter with the default loiter radius.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_REVERSE
entries.description: Set moving direction to forward or reverse.

params.label: Reverse
params.description: Reverse direction (MAV_BOOL_FALSE: Forward direction). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI_LOCATION
entries.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) to a location. This can then be used by the vehicle's control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras. This command can be sent to a gimbal manager but not to a gimbal device. A gimbal is not to react to this message.

params.label: Gimbal device ID
params.description: Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 for all gimbal device components. Send command multiple times for more than one gimbal (but not all gimbals).

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI_WPNEXT_OFFSET
entries.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) to be toward next waypoint, with optional pitch/roll/yaw offset. This can then be used by the vehicle's control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras. This command can be sent to a gimbal manager but not to a gimbal device. A gimbal device is not to react to this message.

params.label: Gimbal device ID
params.description: Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 for all gimbal device components. Send command multiple times for more than one gimbal (but not all gimbals).

params.label: Pitch Offset
params.description: Pitch offset from next waypoint, positive pitching up

params.label: Roll Offset
params.description: Roll offset from next waypoint, positive rolling to the right

params.label: Yaw Offset
params.description: Yaw offset from next waypoint, positive yawing to the right

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI_NONE
entries.description: Cancels any previous ROI command returning the vehicle/sensors to default flight characteristics. This can then be used by the vehicle's control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras. This command can be sent to a gimbal manager but not to a gimbal device. A gimbal device is not to react to this message. After this command the gimbal manager should go back to manual input if available, and otherwise assume a neutral position.

params.label: Gimbal device ID
params.description: Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 for all gimbal device components. Send command multiple times for more than one gimbal (but not all gimbals).

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI_SYSID
entries.description: Mount tracks system with specified system ID. Determination of target vehicle position may be done with GLOBAL_POSITION_INT or any other means. This command can be sent to a gimbal manager but not to a gimbal device. A gimbal device is not to react to this message.

params.label: Gimbal device ID
params.description: Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 for all gimbal device components. Send command multiple times for more than one gimbal (but not all gimbals).

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CONTROL_VIDEO
entries.description: Control onboard camera system.

params.label: Transmission
params.description: Transmission: 0: disabled, 1: enabled compressed, 2: enabled raw

params.label: Interval
params.description: Transmission mode: 0: video stream, >0: single images every n seconds

params.label: Recording
params.description: Recording: 0: disabled, 1: enabled compressed, 2: enabled raw

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI
entries.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) for a sensor set or the vehicle itself. This can then be used by the vehicle's control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.

params.label: WP Index
params.description: Waypoint index/ target ID (depends on param 1).

params.label: ROI Index
params.description: Region of interest index. (allows a vehicle to manage multiple ROI's)
MAV_ROI_WPNEXT: pitch offset from next waypoint, MAV_ROI_LOCATION: latitude
MAV_ROI_WPNEXT: roll offset from next waypoint, MAV_ROI_LOCATION: longitude
MAV_ROI_WPNEXT: yaw offset from next waypoint, MAV_ROI_LOCATION: altitude

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_DIGICAM_CONFIGURE
entries.description: Configure digital camera. This is a fallback message for systems that have not yet implemented PARAM_EXT_XXX messages and camera definition files (see https://mavlink.io/en/services/camera_def.html ).

params.label: Mode
params.description: Modes: P, TV, AV, M, Etc.

params.label: Shutter Speed
params.description: Shutter speed: Divisor number for one second.

params.label: Engine Cut-off
params.description: Main engine cut-off time before camera trigger. (0 means no cut-off)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_DIGICAM_CONTROL
entries.description: Control digital camera. This is a fallback message for systems that have not yet implemented PARAM_EXT_XXX messages and camera definition files (see https://mavlink.io/en/services/camera_def.html ).

params.label: Zoom Relative
params.description: Zooming step value to offset zoom from the current position

params.label: Shot ID
