params.description: Test shot identifier. If set to 1, image will only be captured, but not counted towards internal frame count.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONFIGURE
entries.description: Mission command to configure a camera or antenna mount

params.label: Stabilize Roll
params.description: Stabilize roll (MAV_BOOL_TRUE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

params.label: Stabilize Pitch
params.description: Stabilize pitch (MAV_BOOL_TRUE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

params.label: Stabilize Yaw
params.description: Stabilize yaw (MAV_BOOL_TRUE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

params.label: Roll Input Mode
params.description: Roll input (0 = angle body frame, 1 = angular rate, 2 = angle absolute frame)

params.label: Pitch Input Mode
params.description: Pitch input (0 = angle body frame, 1 = angular rate, 2 = angle absolute frame)

params.label: Yaw Input Mode
params.description: Yaw input (0 = angle body frame, 1 = angular rate, 2 = angle absolute frame)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL
entries.description: Mission command to control a camera or antenna mount

params.label: Pitch
params.description: pitch depending on mount mode (degrees or degrees/second depending on pitch input).

params.label: Roll
params.description: roll depending on mount mode (degrees or degrees/second depending on roll input).

params.label: Yaw
params.description: yaw depending on mount mode (degrees or degrees/second depending on yaw input).

params.label: Latitude
params.description: latitude, set if appropriate mount mode.

params.label: Longitude
params.description: longitude, set if appropriate mount mode.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST
entries.description: Mission command to set camera trigger distance for this flight. The camera is triggered each time this distance is exceeded. This command can also be used to set the shutter integration time for the camera.

params.label: Distance
params.description: Camera trigger distance. 0 to stop triggering.

params.label: Shutter
params.description: Camera shutter integration time. -1 or 0 to ignore

params.label: Trigger
params.description: Trigger camera once, immediately (MAV_BOOL_TRUE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

params.label: Target Camera ID
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FENCE_ENABLE
entries.description: Enable the geofence. This can be used in a mission or via the command protocol. The persistence/lifetime of the setting is undefined. Depending on flight stack implementation it may persist until superseded, or it may revert to a system default at the end of a mission. Flight stacks typically reset the setting to system defaults on reboot.

params.label: Types
params.description: Fence types to enable or disable as a bitmask. 0: field is unused/all fences should be enabled or disabled (for compatibility reasons). Parameter is ignored if param1=2.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_PARACHUTE
entries.description: Mission item/command to release a parachute or enable/disable auto release.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOTOR_TEST
entries.description: Command to perform motor test.

params.label: Instance
params.description: Motor instance number (from 1 to max number of motors on the vehicle).

params.label: Throttle Type
params.description: Throttle type (whether the Throttle Value in param3 is a percentage, PWM value, etc.)

params.label: Timeout
params.description: Timeout between tests that are run in sequence.

params.label: Motor Count
params.description: Motor count. Number of motors to test in sequence: 0/1=one motor, 2= two motors, etc. The Timeout (param4) is used between tests.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_INVERTED_FLIGHT
entries.description: Change to/from inverted flight.

params.label: Inverted
params.description: Inverted flight (MAV_BOOL_False: normal flight). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GRIPPER
entries.description: Mission command to operate a gripper.

params.label: Gripper ID
params.description: Gripper ID. 1-6 for an autopilot connected gripper. In missions this may be set to 1-6 for an autopilot gripper, or the gripper component id for a MAVLink gripper. 0 targets all grippers.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_AUTOTUNE_ENABLE
entries.description: Enable/disable autotune.

params.label: Enable
params.description: Enable autotune (MAV_BOOL_FALSE: disable autotune). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

params.label: Axis
params.description: Specify axes for which autotuning is enabled/disabled. 0 indicates the field is unused (for compatibility reasons). If 0 the autopilot will follow its default behaviour, which is usually to tune all axes.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_SET_YAW_SPEED
entries.description: Sets a desired vehicle turn angle and speed change.

params.label: Yaw
params.description: Yaw angle to adjust steering by.

params.label: Angle
params.description: Relative final angle (MAV_BOOL_FALSE: Absolute angle). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_INTERVAL
entries.description: Mission command to set camera trigger interval for this flight. If triggering is enabled, the camera is triggered each time this interval expires. This command can also be used to set the shutter integration time for the camera.

params.label: Trigger Cycle
params.description: Camera trigger cycle time. -1 or 0 to ignore.

params.label: Shutter Integration
params.description: Camera shutter integration time. Should be less than trigger cycle time. -1 or 0 to ignore.

params.label: Target Camera ID
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL_QUAT
entries.description: Mission command to control a camera or antenna mount, using a quaternion as reference.

params.label: Q1
params.description: quaternion param q1, w (1 in null-rotation)

params.label: Q2
params.description: quaternion param q2, x (0 in null-rotation)

params.label: Q3
params.description: quaternion param q3, y (0 in null-rotation)

params.label: Q4
params.description: quaternion param q4, z (0 in null-rotation)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GUIDED_MASTER
entries.description: set id of master controller

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GUIDED_LIMITS
entries.description: Set limits for external control

params.label: Timeout
params.description: Timeout - maximum time that external controller will be allowed to control vehicle. 0 means no timeout.

params.label: Min Altitude
params.description: Altitude (MSL) min - if vehicle moves below this alt, the command will be aborted and the mission will continue. 0 means no lower altitude limit.

params.label: Max Altitude
params.description: Altitude (MSL) max - if vehicle moves above this alt, the command will be aborted and the mission will continue. 0 means no upper altitude limit.

params.label: Horiz. Move Limit
params.description: Horizontal move limit - if vehicle moves more than this distance from its location at the moment the command was executed, the command will be aborted and the mission will continue. 0 means no horizontal move limit.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_ENGINE_CONTROL
entries.description: Control vehicle engine. This is interpreted by the vehicles engine controller to change the target engine state. It is intended for vehicles with internal combustion engines

params.label: Start Engine
params.description: Start engine (MAV_BOOL_False: Stop engine). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

params.label: Cold Start
params.description: Cold start engine (MAV_BOOL_FALSE: Warm start). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid. Controls use of choke where applicable

params.label: Height Delay
params.description: Height delay. This is for commanding engine start only after the vehicle has gained the specified height. Used in VTOL vehicles during takeoff to start engine after the aircraft is off the ground. Zero for no delay.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MISSION_CURRENT
entries.description: Set the mission item with sequence number seq as the current item and emit MISSION_CURRENT (whether or not the mission number changed). If a mission is currently being executed, the system will continue to this new mission item on the shortest path, skipping any intermediate mission items. Note that mission jump repeat counters are not reset unless param2 is set (see MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP param2). This command may trigger a mission state-machine change on some systems: for example from MISSION_STATE_NOT_STARTED or MISSION_STATE_PAUSED to MISSION_STATE_ACTIVE. If the system is in mission mode, on those systems this command might therefore start, restart or resume the mission. If the system is not in mission mode this command must not trigger a switch to mission mode. The mission may be "reset" using param2. Resetting sets jump counters to initial values (to reset counters without changing the current mission item set the param1 to `-1`). Resetting also explicitly changes a mission state of MISSION_STATE_COMPLETE to MISSION_STATE_PAUSED or MISSION_STATE_ACTIVE, potentially allowing it to resume when it is (next) in a mission mode. The command will ACK with MAV_RESULT_FAILED if the sequence number is out of range (including if there is no mission item).

params.label: Number
params.description: Mission sequence value to set. -1 for the current mission item (use to reset mission without changing current mission item).

params.label: Reset Mission
params.description: Reset mission (MAV_BOOL_TRUE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid. Resets jump counters to initial values and changes mission state "completed" to be "active" or "paused".

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_LAST
entries.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the DO commands in the enumeration

entries.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_CALIBRATION
entries.description: Trigger calibration. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode. Except for Temperature Calibration, only one sensor should be set in a single message and all others should be zero.

params.label: Magnetometer
params.description: Magnetometer calibration. Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

params.label: Ground Pressure
params.description: Ground pressure calibration. Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

params.label: Remote Control
params.description: 1: radio RC calibration, 2: RC trim calibration

params.label: Accelerometer
params.description: 1: accelerometer calibration, 2: board level calibration, 3: accelerometer temperature calibration, 4: simple accelerometer calibration

params.label: Compmot or Airspeed
params.description: 1: APM: compass/motor interference calibration (PX4: airspeed calibration, deprecated), 2: airspeed calibration

entries.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_SET_SENSOR_OFFSETS
entries.description: Set sensor offsets. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.

params.label: Sensor Type
params.description: Sensor to adjust the offsets for: 0: gyros, 1: accelerometer, 2: magnetometer, 3: barometer, 4: optical flow, 5: second magnetometer, 6: third magnetometer

params.label: X Offset
params.description: X axis offset (or generic dimension 1), in the sensor's raw units

params.label: Y Offset
params.description: Y axis offset (or generic dimension 2), in the sensor's raw units

params.label: Z Offset
params.description: Z axis offset (or generic dimension 3), in the sensor's raw units

params.label: 4th Dimension
params.description: Generic dimension 4, in the sensor's raw units

params.label: 5th Dimension
params.description: Generic dimension 5, in the sensor's raw units

params.label: 6th Dimension
params.description: Generic dimension 6, in the sensor's raw units

entries.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_UAVCAN
entries.description: Trigger UAVCAN configuration (actuator ID assignment and direction mapping). Note that this maps to the legacy UAVCAN v0 function UAVCAN_ENUMERATE, which is intended to be executed just once during initial vehicle configuration (it is not a normal pre-flight command and has been poorly named).

params.label: Actuator ID
params.description: 1: Trigger actuator ID assignment and direction mapping. 0: Cancel command.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_STORAGE
entries.description: Request storage of different parameter values and logs. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.

params.label: Parameter Storage
params.description: Action to perform on the persistent parameter storage

params.label: Mission Storage
params.description: Action to perform on the persistent mission storage

params.label: Logging Rate
params.description: Onboard logging: 0: Ignore, 1: Start default rate logging, -1: Stop logging, > 1: logging rate (e.g. set to 1000 for 1000 Hz logging)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_REBOOT_SHUTDOWN
entries.description: Request the reboot or shutdown of system components.

params.label: Companion
params.description: Action to take for onboard computer.

params.label: Component Action
params.description: Action to take for component specified in param4.

params.label: Component ID
params.description: MAVLink Component ID targeted in param3 (0 for all components).

params.label: Conditions
params.description: Conditions under which reboot/shutdown is allowed.
WIP: ID (e.g. camera ID -1 for all IDs)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_OVERRIDE_GOTO
entries.description: Override current mission with command to pause mission, pause mission and move to position, continue/resume mission. When param 1 indicates that the mission is paused (MAV_GOTO_DO_HOLD), param 2 defines whether it holds in place or moves to another position.

params.label: Continue
params.description: MAV_GOTO_DO_HOLD: pause mission and either hold or move to specified position (depending on param2), MAV_GOTO_DO_CONTINUE: resume mission.

params.label: Position
params.description: MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_CURRENT_POSITION: hold at current position, MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_SPECIFIED_POSITION: hold at specified position.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_OBLIQUE_SURVEY
entries.description: Mission command to set a Camera Auto Mount Pivoting Oblique Survey (Replaces CAM_TRIGG_DIST for this purpose). The camera is triggered each time this distance is exceeded, then the mount moves to the next position. Params 4~6 set-up the angle limits and number of positions for oblique survey, where mount-enabled vehicles automatically roll the camera between shots to emulate an oblique camera setup (providing an increased HFOV). This command can also be used to set the shutter integration time for the camera.

params.label: Distance
params.description: Camera trigger distance. 0 to stop triggering.

params.label: Shutter
params.description: Camera shutter integration time. 0 to ignore

params.label: Min Interval
params.description: The minimum interval in which the camera is capable of taking subsequent pictures repeatedly. 0 to ignore.

params.label: Positions
params.description: Total number of roll positions at which the camera will capture photos (images captures spread evenly across the limits defined by param5).

params.label: Roll Angle
params.description: Angle limits that the camera can be rolled to left and right of center.

params.label: Pitch Angle
params.description: Fixed pitch angle that the camera will hold in oblique mode if the mount is actuated in the pitch axis.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_STANDARD_MODE
entries.description: Enable the specified standard MAVLink mode. If the specified mode is not supported, the vehicle should ACK with MAV_RESULT_FAILED. See https://mavlink.io/en/services/standard_modes.html

entries.name: MAV_CMD_MISSION_START
entries.description: start running a mission

params.label: First Item
params.description: first_item: the first mission item to run

params.label: Last Item
params.description: last_item: the last mission item to run (after this item is run, the mission ends)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_ACTUATOR_TEST
entries.description: Actuator testing command. This is similar to MAV_CMD_DO_MOTOR_TEST but operates on the level of output functions, i.e. it is possible to test Motor1 independent from which output it is configured on. Autopilots must NACK this command with MAV_RESULT_TEMPORARILY_REJECTED while armed.

params.label: Value
params.description: Output value: 1 means maximum positive output, 0 to center servos or minimum motor thrust (expected to spin), -1 for maximum negative (if not supported by the motors, i.e. motor is not reversible, smaller than 0 maps to NaN). And NaN maps to disarmed (stop the motors).

params.label: Timeout
params.description: Timeout after which the test command expires and the output is restored to the previous value. A timeout has to be set for safety reasons. A timeout of 0 means to restore the previous value immediately.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_CONFIGURE_ACTUATOR
entries.description: Actuator configuration command.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_COMPONENT_ARM_DISARM
entries.description: Arms / Disarms a component

params.label: Arm
params.description: Arm (MAV_BOOL_FALSE: disarm). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

params.label: Force
params.description: 0: arm-disarm unless prevented by safety checks (i.e. when landed), 21196: force arming/disarming (e.g. allow arming to override preflight checks and disarming in flight)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_RUN_PREARM_CHECKS
entries.description: Instructs a target system to run pre-arm checks. This allows preflight checks to be run on demand, which may be useful on systems that normally run them at low rate, or which do not trigger checks when the armable state might have changed. This command should return MAV_RESULT_ACCEPTED if it will run the checks. The results of the checks are usually then reported in SYS_STATUS messages (this is system-specific). The command should return MAV_RESULT_TEMPORARILY_REJECTED if the system is already armed.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_ILLUMINATOR_ON_OFF
entries.description: Turns illuminators ON/OFF. An illuminator is a light source that is used for lighting up dark areas external to the system: e.g. a torch or searchlight (as opposed to a light source for illuminating the system itself, e.g. an indicator light).

params.label: Enable
params.description: Illuminators on/off (MAV_BOOL_TRUE: illuminators on). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_ILLUMINATOR_CONFIGURE
entries.description: Configures illuminator settings. An illuminator is a light source that is used for lighting up dark areas external to the system: e.g. a torch or searchlight (as opposed to a light source for illuminating the system itself, e.g. an indicator light).

params.label: Strobe Period
params.description: Strobe period in seconds where 0 means strobing is not used

params.label: Strobe Duty
params.description: Strobe duty cycle where 100% means it is on constantly and 0 means strobing is not used

entries.name: MAV_CMD_GET_HOME_POSITION
entries.description: Request the home position from the vehicle. The vehicle will ACK the command and then emit the HOME_POSITION message.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_INJECT_FAILURE
entries.description: Inject artificial failure for testing purposes. Note that autopilots should implement an additional protection before accepting this command such as a specific param setting.

params.label: Failure unit
params.description: The unit which is affected by the failure.

params.label: Failure type
params.description: The type how the failure manifests itself.

params.label: Instance
params.description: Instance affected by failure (0 to signal all).

entries.name: MAV_CMD_START_RX_PAIR
entries.description: Starts receiver pairing.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_GET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL
entries.description: Request the interval between messages for a particular MAVLink message ID. The receiver should ACK the command and then emit its response in a MESSAGE_INTERVAL message.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_SET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL
entries.description: Set the interval between messages for a particular MAVLink message ID. This interface replaces REQUEST_DATA_STREAM.

params.label: Interval
params.description: The interval between two messages. -1: disable. 0: request default rate (which may be zero).

params.label: Req Param 3
params.description: Use for index ID, if required. Otherwise, the use of this parameter (if any) must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0). When used as an index ID, 0 means "all instances", "1" means the first instance in the sequence (the emitted message will have an id of 0 if message ids are 0-indexed, or 1 if index numbers start from one).

params.label: Req Param 4
params.description: The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0).

params.label: Req Param 5
params.description: The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0/NaN).

params.label: Req Param 6
params.description: The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0/NaN).

params.label: Response Target
params.description: Target address of message stream (if message has target address fields). 0: Flight-stack default (recommended), 1: address of requester, 2: broadcast.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE
entries.description: Request the target system(s) emit a single instance of a specified message (i.e. a "one-shot" version of MAV_CMD_SET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL).

params.label: Message ID
params.description: The MAVLink message ID of the requested message.

params.label: Req Param 1
params.description: Use for index ID, if required. Otherwise, the use of this parameter (if any) must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0).

params.label: Req Param 2
params.description: The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0).

params.label: Req Param 3
params.description: The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0).

params.label: Req Param 4
params.description: The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0).

params.label: Req Param 5
params.description: The use of this parameter (if any), must be defined in the requested message. By default assumed not used (0).

params.label: Response Target
params.description: Target address for requested message (if message has target address fields). 0: Flight-stack default, 1: address of requester, 2: broadcast.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_PROTOCOL_VERSION
entries.description: Request MAVLink protocol version compatibility. All receivers should ACK the command and then emit their capabilities in an PROTOCOL_VERSION message

params.label: Protocol
params.description: Request supported protocol versions by all nodes on the network (MAV_BOOL_TRUE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_AUTOPILOT_CAPABILITIES
entries.description: Request autopilot capabilities. The receiver should ACK the command and then emit its capabilities in an AUTOPILOT_VERSION message

params.label: Version
params.description: Request autopilot version (MAV_BOOL_TRUE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_CAMERA_INFORMATION
entries.description: Request camera information (CAMERA_INFORMATION).

params.label: Capabilities
params.description: Request camera capabilities (MAV_BOOL_TRUE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_CAMERA_SETTINGS
entries.description: Request camera settings (CAMERA_SETTINGS).

params.label: Settings
params.description: Request camera settings (MAV_BOOL_TRUE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_STORAGE_INFORMATION
entries.description: Request storage information (STORAGE_INFORMATION). Use the command's target_component to target a specific component's storage.

params.label: Storage ID
params.description: Storage ID (0 for all, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

params.label: Information
params.description: Request storage information (MAV_BOOL_TRUE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_STORAGE_FORMAT
entries.description: Format a storage medium. Once format is complete, a STORAGE_INFORMATION message is sent. Use the command's target_component to target a specific component's storage.

params.label: Storage ID
params.description: Storage ID (1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

params.label: Format
params.description: Format storage (and reset image log). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

params.label: Reset Image Log
params.description: Reset Image Log (without formatting storage medium). This will reset CAMERA_CAPTURE_STATUS.image_count and CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURED.image_index. Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_CAMERA_CAPTURE_STATUS
entries.description: Request camera capture status (CAMERA_CAPTURE_STATUS)

params.label: Capture Status
params.description: Request camera capture status (MAV_BOOL_TRUE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_FLIGHT_INFORMATION
entries.description: Request flight information (FLIGHT_INFORMATION)

params.label: Flight Information
params.description: Request flight information (MAV_BOOL_TRUE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_RESET_CAMERA_SETTINGS
entries.description: Reset all camera settings to Factory Default

params.label: Reset
params.description: Reset all settings (MAV_BOOL_TRUE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

params.label: Target Camera ID
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_MODE
entries.description: Set camera running mode. Use NaN for reserved values. GCS will send a MAV_CMD_REQUEST_VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS command after a mode change if the camera supports video streaming.

params.label: id
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_ZOOM
entries.description: Set camera zoom. Camera must respond with a CAMERA_SETTINGS message (on success).

params.label: Zoom Value
params.description: Zoom value. The range of valid values depend on the zoom type.

params.label: Target Camera ID
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_FOCUS
entries.description: Set camera focus. Camera must respond with a CAMERA_SETTINGS message (on success).

params.label: Target Camera ID
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_SET_STORAGE_USAGE
entries.description: Set that a particular storage is the preferred location for saving photos, videos, and/or other media (e.g. to set that an SD card is used for storing videos). There can only be one preferred save location for each particular media type: setting a media usage flag will clear/reset that same flag if set on any other storage. If no flag is set the system should use its default storage. A target system can choose to always use default storage, in which case it should ACK the command with MAV_RESULT_UNSUPPORTED. A target system can choose to not allow a particular storage to be set as preferred storage, in which case it should ACK the command with MAV_RESULT_DENIED.

params.label: Storage ID
params.description: Storage ID (1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_SOURCE
entries.description: Set camera source. Changes the camera's active sources on cameras with multiple image sensors.

params.label: device id
params.description: Component Id of camera to address or 1-6 for non-MAVLink cameras, 0 for all cameras.

params.label: secondary source
params.description: Secondary Source. If non-zero the second source will be displayed as picture-in-picture.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_JUMP_TAG
entries.description: Tagged jump target. Can be jumped to with MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP_TAG.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP_TAG
entries.description: Jump to the matching tag in the mission list. Repeat this action for the specified number of times. A mission should contain a single matching tag for each jump. If this is not the case then a jump to a missing tag should complete the mission, and a jump where there are multiple matching tags should always select the one with the lowest mission sequence number.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GIMBAL_MANAGER_PITCHYAW
entries.description: Set gimbal manager pitch/yaw setpoints (low rate command). It is possible to set combinations of the values below. E.g. an angle as well as a desired angular rate can be used to get to this angle at a certain angular rate, or an angular rate only will result in continuous turning. NaN is to be used to signal unset. Note: only the gimbal manager will react to this command - it will be ignored by a gimbal device. Use GIMBAL_MANAGER_SET_PITCHYAW if you need to stream pitch/yaw setpoints at higher rate.

params.label: Pitch angle
params.description: Pitch angle (positive to pitch up, relative to vehicle for FOLLOW mode, relative to world horizon for LOCK mode).

params.label: Yaw angle
params.description: Yaw angle (positive to yaw to the right, relative to vehicle for FOLLOW mode, absolute to North for LOCK mode).

params.label: Yaw rate
params.description: Yaw rate (positive to yaw to the right).

params.label: Gimbal device ID
params.description: Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 for all gimbal device components. Send command multiple times for more than one gimbal (but not all gimbals).

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GIMBAL_MANAGER_CONFIGURE
entries.description: Gimbal configuration to set which sysid/compid is in primary and secondary control.

params.label: sysid primary control
params.description: Sysid for primary control (0: no one in control, -1: leave unchanged, -2: set itself in control (for missions where the own sysid is still unknown), -3: remove control if currently in control).

params.label: compid primary control
params.description: Compid for primary control (0: no one in control, -1: leave unchanged, -2: set itself in control (for missions where the own sysid is still unknown), -3: remove control if currently in control).

params.label: sysid secondary control
params.description: Sysid for secondary control (0: no one in control, -1: leave unchanged, -2: set itself in control (for missions where the own sysid is still unknown), -3: remove control if currently in control).

params.label: compid secondary control
params.description: Compid for secondary control (0: no one in control, -1: leave unchanged, -2: set itself in control (for missions where the own sysid is still unknown), -3: remove control if currently in control).

params.label: Gimbal device ID
params.description: Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 for all gimbal device components. Send command multiple times for more than one gimbal (but not all gimbals).

entries.name: MAV_CMD_IMAGE_START_CAPTURE
entries.description: Start image capture sequence. CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURED must be emitted after each capture. Param1 (id) may be used to specify the target camera: 0: all cameras, 1 to 6: autopilot-connected cameras, 7-255: MAVLink camera component ID. It is needed in order to target specific cameras connected to the autopilot, or specific sensors in a multi-sensor camera (neither of which have a distinct MAVLink component ID). It is also needed to specify the target camera in missions. When used in a mission, an autopilot should execute the MAV_CMD for a specified local camera (param1 = 1-6), or resend it as a command if it is intended for a MAVLink camera (param1 = 7 - 255), setting the command's target_component as the param1 value (and setting param1 in the command to zero). If the param1 is 0 the autopilot should do both. When sent in a command the target MAVLink address is set using target_component. If addressed specifically to an autopilot: param1 should be used in the same way as it is for missions (though command should NACK with MAV_RESULT_DENIED if a specified local camera does not exist). If addressed to a MAVLink camera, param 1 can be used to address all cameras (0), or to separately address 1 to 7 individual sensors. Other values should be NACKed with MAV_RESULT_DENIED. If the command is broadcast (target_component is 0) then param 1 should be set to 0 (any other value should be NACKED with MAV_RESULT_DENIED). An autopilot would trigger any local cameras and forward the command to all channels.

params.label: Target Camera ID
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

params.label: Interval
params.description: Desired elapsed time between two consecutive pictures (in seconds). Minimum values depend on hardware (typically greater than 2 seconds).

params.label: Total Images
params.description: Total number of images to capture. 0 to capture forever/until MAV_CMD_IMAGE_STOP_CAPTURE.

params.label: Sequence Number
params.description: Capture sequence number starting from 1. This is only valid for single-capture (param3 == 1), otherwise set to 0. Increment the capture ID for each capture command to prevent double captures when a command is re-transmitted.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_IMAGE_STOP_CAPTURE
entries.description: Stop image capture sequence. Param1 (id) may be used to specify the target camera: 0: all cameras, 1 to 6: autopilot-connected cameras, 7-255: MAVLink camera component ID. It is needed in order to target specific cameras connected to the autopilot, or specific sensors in a multi-sensor camera (neither of which have a distinct MAVLink component ID). It is also needed to specify the target camera in missions. When used in a mission, an autopilot should execute the MAV_CMD for a specified local camera (param1 = 1-6), or resend it as a command if it is intended for a MAVLink camera (param1 = 7 - 255), setting the command's target_component as the param1 value (and setting param1 in the command to zero). If the param1 is 0 the autopilot should do both. When sent in a command the target MAVLink address is set using target_component. If addressed specifically to an autopilot: param1 should be used in the same way as it is for missions (though command should NACK with MAV_RESULT_DENIED if a specified local camera does not exist). If addressed to a MAVLink camera, param1 can be used to address all cameras (0), or to separately address 1 to 7 individual sensors. Other values should be NACKed with MAV_RESULT_DENIED. If the command is broadcast (target_component is 0) then param 1 should be set to 0 (any other value should be NACKED with MAV_RESULT_DENIED). An autopilot would trigger any local cameras and forward the command to all channels.

params.label: Target Camera ID
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURE
entries.description: Re-request a CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURED message.

params.label: Number
params.description: Sequence number for missing CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURED message

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_TRIGGER_CONTROL
entries.description: Enable or disable on-board camera triggering system.

params.label: Enable
params.description: Trigger enable/disable (0 for disable, 1 for start), -1 to ignore

params.label: Reset
params.description: 1 to reset the trigger sequence, -1 or 0 to ignore

params.label: Pause
params.description: 1 to pause triggering, but without switching the camera off or retracting it. -1 to ignore

params.label: Target Camera ID
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_CAMERA_TRACK_POINT
entries.description: If the camera supports point visual tracking (CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_TRACKING_POINT is set), this command allows to initiate the tracking.

params.label: Point x
params.description: Point to track x value (normalized 0..1, 0 is left, 1 is right).

params.label: Point y
params.description: Point to track y value (normalized 0..1, 0 is top, 1 is bottom).

params.label: Radius
params.description: Point radius (normalized 0..1, 0 is one pixel, 1 is full image width).

params.label: Target Camera ID
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_CAMERA_TRACK_RECTANGLE
entries.description: If the camera supports rectangle visual tracking (CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_TRACKING_RECTANGLE is set), this command allows to initiate the tracking.

params.label: Top left corner x
params.description: Top left corner of rectangle x value (normalized 0..1, 0 is left, 1 is right).

params.label: Top left corner y
params.description: Top left corner of rectangle y value (normalized 0..1, 0 is top, 1 is bottom).

params.label: Bottom right corner x
params.description: Bottom right corner of rectangle x value (normalized 0..1, 0 is left, 1 is right).

params.label: Bottom right corner y
params.description: Bottom right corner of rectangle y value (normalized 0..1, 0 is top, 1 is bottom).

params.label: Target Camera ID
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_CAMERA_STOP_TRACKING
entries.description: Stops ongoing tracking.

params.label: Target Camera ID
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_START_CAPTURE
entries.description: Starts video capture (recording).

params.label: Stream ID
params.description: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams)

params.label: Status Frequency
params.description: Frequency CAMERA_CAPTURE_STATUS messages should be sent while recording (0 for no messages, otherwise frequency)

params.label: Target Camera ID
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_STOP_CAPTURE
entries.description: Stop the current video capture (recording).

params.label: Stream ID
params.description: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams)

params.label: Target Camera ID
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_START_STREAMING
entries.description: Start video streaming

params.label: Stream ID
params.description: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

params.label: Target Camera ID
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_VIDEO_STOP_STREAMING
entries.description: Stop the given video stream

params.label: Stream ID
params.description: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

params.label: Target Camera ID
params.description: Target camera ID. 7 to 255: MAVLink camera component id. 1 to 6 for cameras attached to the autopilot, which don't have a distinct component id. 0: all cameras. This is used to target specific autopilot-connected cameras. It is also used to target specific cameras when the MAV_CMD is used in a mission.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_VIDEO_STREAM_INFORMATION
entries.description: Request video stream information (VIDEO_STREAM_INFORMATION)

params.label: Stream ID
params.description: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS
entries.description: Request video stream status (VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS)

params.label: Stream ID
params.description: Video Stream ID (0 for all streams, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_LOGGING_START
entries.description: Request to start streaming logging data over MAVLink (see also LOGGING_DATA message)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_LOGGING_STOP
entries.description: Request to stop streaming log data over MAVLink

params.label: Landing Gear Position
params.description: Landing gear position (Down: 0, Up: 1, NaN for no change)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_CONTROL_HIGH_LATENCY
entries.description: Request to start/stop transmitting over the high latency telemetry

params.label: Enable
params.description: Start transmission over high latency telemetry (MAV_BOOL_FALSE: stop transmission). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_PANORAMA_CREATE
entries.description: Create a panorama at the current position

params.label: Horizontal Angle
params.description: Viewing angle horizontal of the panorama (+- 0.5 the total angle)

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_VTOL_TRANSITION
entries.description: Request VTOL transition

params.label: State
params.description: The target VTOL state. For normal transitions, only MAV_VTOL_STATE_MC and MAV_VTOL_STATE_FW can be used.

params.label: Immediate
params.description: Force immediate transition to the specified MAV_VTOL_STATE. 1: Force immediate, 0: normal transition. Can be used, for example, to trigger an emergency "Quadchute". Caution: Can be dangerous/damage vehicle, depending on autopilot implementation of this command.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_ARM_AUTHORIZATION_REQUEST
entries.description: Request authorization to arm the vehicle to a external entity, the arm authorizer is responsible to request all data that is needs from the vehicle before authorize or deny the request. If approved the COMMAND_ACK message progress field should be set with period of time that this authorization is valid in seconds. If the authorization is denied COMMAND_ACK.result_param2 should be set with one of the reasons in ARM_AUTH_DENIED_REASON.

params.label: System ID
params.description: Vehicle system id, this way ground station can request arm authorization on behalf of any vehicle

entries.name: MAV_CMD_SET_GUIDED_SUBMODE_STANDARD
entries.description: This command sets the submode to standard guided when vehicle is in guided mode. The vehicle holds position and altitude and the user can input the desired velocities along all three axes.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_SET_GUIDED_SUBMODE_CIRCLE
entries.description: This command sets submode circle when vehicle is in guided mode. Vehicle flies along a circle facing the center of the circle. The user can input the velocity along the circle and change the radius. If no input is given the vehicle will hold position.

params.label: Radius
params.description: Radius of desired circle in CIRCLE_MODE

params.label: Latitude
params.description: Target latitude of center of circle in CIRCLE_MODE

params.label: Longitude
params.description: Target longitude of center of circle in CIRCLE_MODE

entries.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_GATE
entries.description: Delay mission state machine until gate has been reached.

params.label: Geometry
params.description: Geometry: 0: orthogonal to path between previous and next waypoint.

params.label: UseAltitude
params.description: Use altitude (MAV_BOOL_FALSE: ignore altitude). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_RETURN_POINT
entries.description: Fence return point (there can only be one such point in a geofence definition). If rally points are supported they should be used instead.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_POLYGON_VERTEX_INCLUSION
entries.description: Fence vertex for an inclusion polygon (the polygon must not be self-intersecting). The vehicle must stay within this area. Minimum of 3 vertices required. The vertices for a polygon must be sent sequentially, each with param1 set to the total number of vertices in the polygon.

params.label: Vertex Count
params.description: Polygon vertex count. This is the number of vertices in the current polygon (all vertices will have the same number).

params.label: Inclusion Group
params.description: Vehicle must be inside ALL inclusion zones in a single group, vehicle must be inside at least one group, must be the same for all points in each polygon

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_POLYGON_VERTEX_EXCLUSION
entries.description: Fence vertex for an exclusion polygon (the polygon must not be self-intersecting). The vehicle must stay outside this area. Minimum of 3 vertices required. The vertices for a polygon must be sent sequentially, each with param1 set to the total number of vertices in the polygon.

params.label: Vertex Count
params.description: Polygon vertex count. This is the number of vertices in the current polygon (all vertices will have the same number).

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_CIRCLE_INCLUSION
entries.description: Circular fence area. The vehicle must stay inside this area.

params.label: Inclusion Group
params.description: Vehicle must be inside ALL inclusion zones in a single group, vehicle must be inside at least one group

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_CIRCLE_EXCLUSION
entries.description: Circular fence area. The vehicle must stay outside this area.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_RALLY_POINT
entries.description: Rally point. You can have multiple rally points defined.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_UAVCAN_GET_NODE_INFO
entries.description: Commands the vehicle to respond with a sequence of messages UAVCAN_NODE_INFO, one message per every UAVCAN node that is online. Note that some of the response messages can be lost, which the receiver can detect easily by checking whether every received UAVCAN_NODE_STATUS has a matching message UAVCAN_NODE_INFO received earlier; if not, this command should be sent again in order to request re-transmission of the node information messages.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_SAFETY_SWITCH_STATE
entries.description: Change state of safety switch.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_ADSB_OUT_IDENT
entries.description: Trigger the start of an ADSB-out IDENT. This should only be used when requested to do so by an Air Traffic Controller in controlled airspace. This starts the IDENT which is then typically held for 18 seconds by the hardware per the Mode A, C, and S transponder spec.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_PAYLOAD_PREPARE_DEPLOY
entries.description: Deploy payload on a Lat / Lon / Alt position. This includes the navigation to reach the required release position and velocity.

params.label: Operation Mode
params.description: Operation mode. 0: prepare single payload deploy (overwriting previous requests), but do not execute it. 1: execute payload deploy immediately (rejecting further deploy commands during execution, but allowing abort). 2: add payload deploy to existing deployment list.

params.label: Approach Vector
params.description: Desired approach vector in compass heading. A negative value indicates the system can define the approach vector at will.

params.label: Ground Speed
params.description: Desired ground speed at release time. This can be overridden by the airframe in case it needs to meet minimum airspeed. A negative value indicates the system can define the ground speed at will.

params.label: Altitude Clearance
params.description: Minimum altitude clearance to the release position. A negative value indicates the system can define the clearance at will.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_PAYLOAD_CONTROL_DEPLOY
entries.description: Control the payload deployment.

params.label: Operation Mode
params.description: Operation mode. 0: Abort deployment, continue normal mission. 1: switch to payload deployment mode. 100: delete first payload deployment request. 101: delete all payload deployment requests.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_FIXED_MAG_CAL_YAW
entries.description: Magnetometer calibration based on provided known yaw. This allows for fast calibration using WMM field tables in the vehicle, given only the known yaw of the vehicle. If Latitude and longitude are both zero then use the current vehicle location.

params.label: Yaw
params.description: Yaw of vehicle in earth frame.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_DO_WINCH
entries.description: Command to operate winch.

params.label: Length
params.description: Length of line to release (negative to wind).

entries.name: MAV_CMD_EXTERNAL_POSITION_ESTIMATE
entries.description: Provide an external position estimate for use when dead-reckoning. This is meant to be used for occasional position resets that may be provided by a external system such as a remote pilot using landmarks over a video link.

params.label: transmission_time
params.description: Timestamp that this message was sent as a time in the transmitters time domain. The sender should wrap this time back to zero based on required timing accuracy for the application and the limitations of a 32 bit float. For example, wrapping at 10 hours would give approximately 1ms accuracy. Recipient must handle time wrap in any timing jitter correction applied to this field. Wrap rollover time should not be at not more than 250 seconds, which would give approximately 10 microsecond accuracy.

params.label: processing_time
params.description: The time spent in processing the sensor data that is the basis for this position. The recipient can use this to improve time alignment of the data. Set to zero if not known.

params.label: accuracy
params.description: estimated one standard deviation accuracy of the measurement. Set to NaN if not known.

params.label: Altitude
params.description: Altitude, not used. Should be sent as NaN. May be supported in a future version of this message.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_1
entries.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_2
entries.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_3
entries.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_4
entries.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_WAYPOINT_USER_5
entries.description: User defined waypoint item. Ground Station will show the Vehicle as flying through this item.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_1
entries.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_2
entries.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_3
entries.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_4
entries.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_SPATIAL_USER_5
entries.description: User defined spatial item. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: ROI item.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_USER_1
entries.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_USER_2
entries.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_USER_3
entries.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_USER_4
entries.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_USER_5
entries.description: User defined command. Ground Station will not show the Vehicle as flying through this item. Example: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER item.

entries.name: MAV_CMD_CAN_FORWARD
entries.description: Request forwarding of CAN packets from the given CAN bus to this component. CAN Frames are sent using CAN_FRAME and CANFD_FRAME messages

params.label: bus
params.description: Bus number (0 to disable forwarding, 1 for first bus, 2 for 2nd bus, 3 for 3rd bus).

enums.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM
enums.description: A data stream is not a fixed set of messages, but rather a recommendation to the autopilot software. Individual autopilots may or may not obey the recommended messages.

entries.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_ALL
entries.description: Enable all data streams

entries.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_RAW_SENSORS
entries.description: Enable IMU_RAW, GPS_RAW, GPS_STATUS packets.

entries.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_EXTENDED_STATUS
entries.description: Enable GPS_STATUS, CONTROL_STATUS, AUX_STATUS

entries.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_RC_CHANNELS
entries.description: Enable RC_CHANNELS_SCALED, RC_CHANNELS_RAW, SERVO_OUTPUT_RAW

entries.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_RAW_CONTROLLER
entries.description: Enable ATTITUDE_CONTROLLER_OUTPUT, POSITION_CONTROLLER_OUTPUT, NAV_CONTROLLER_OUTPUT.

entries.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_POSITION
entries.description: Enable LOCAL_POSITION, GLOBAL_POSITION_INT messages.

entries.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_EXTRA1
entries.description: Dependent on the autopilot

enums.name: MAV_RESULT
enums.description: Result from a MAVLink command (MAV_CMD)

entries.name: MAV_RESULT_ACCEPTED
entries.description: Command is valid (is supported and has valid parameters), and was executed.

entries.name: MAV_RESULT_TEMPORARILY_REJECTED
entries.description: Command is valid, but cannot be executed at this time. This is used to indicate a problem that should be fixed just by waiting (e.g. a state machine is busy, can't arm because have not got GPS lock, etc.). Retrying later should work.

entries.name: MAV_RESULT_DENIED
entries.description: Command is invalid; it is supported but one or more parameter values are invalid (i.e. parameter reserved, value allowed by spec but not supported by flight stack, and so on). Retrying the same command and parameters will not work.

entries.name: MAV_RESULT_UNSUPPORTED
entries.description: Command is not supported (unknown).

entries.name: MAV_RESULT_FAILED
entries.description: Command is valid, but execution has failed. This is used to indicate any non-temporary or unexpected problem, i.e. any problem that must be fixed before the command can succeed/be retried. For example, attempting to write a file when out of memory, attempting to arm when sensors are not calibrated, etc.

entries.name: MAV_RESULT_IN_PROGRESS
entries.description: Command is valid and is being executed. This will be followed by further progress updates, i.e. the component may send further COMMAND_ACK messages with result MAV_RESULT_IN_PROGRESS (at a rate decided by the implementation), and must terminate by sending a COMMAND_ACK message with final result of the operation. The COMMAND_ACK.progress field can be used to indicate the progress of the operation.

entries.name: MAV_RESULT_CANCELLED
entries.description: Command has been cancelled (as a result of receiving a COMMAND_CANCEL message).

entries.name: MAV_RESULT_COMMAND_LONG_ONLY
entries.description: Command is only accepted when sent as a COMMAND_LONG.

entries.name: MAV_RESULT_COMMAND_INT_ONLY
entries.description: Command is only accepted when sent as a COMMAND_INT.

entries.name: MAV_RESULT_COMMAND_UNSUPPORTED_MAV_FRAME
entries.description: Command is invalid because a frame is required and the specified frame is not supported.

entries.name: MAV_RESULT_NOT_IN_CONTROL
entries.description: Command has been rejected because source system is not in control of the target system/component.

enums.name: MAV_MISSION_RESULT
enums.description: Result of mission operation (in a MISSION_ACK message).

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_ACCEPTED
entries.description: mission accepted OK

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_ERROR
entries.description: Generic error / not accepting mission commands at all right now.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_UNSUPPORTED_FRAME
entries.description: Coordinate frame is not supported.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_UNSUPPORTED
entries.description: Command is not supported.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_NO_SPACE
entries.description: Mission items exceed storage space.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID
entries.description: One of the parameters has an invalid value.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM1
entries.description: param1 has an invalid value.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM2
entries.description: param2 has an invalid value.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM3
entries.description: param3 has an invalid value.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM4
entries.description: param4 has an invalid value.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM5_X
entries.description: x / param5 has an invalid value.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM6_Y
entries.description: y / param6 has an invalid value.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_PARAM7
entries.description: z / param7 has an invalid value.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID_SEQUENCE
entries.description: Mission item received out of sequence

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_DENIED
entries.description: Not accepting any mission commands from this communication partner.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_OPERATION_CANCELLED
entries.description: Current mission operation cancelled (e.g. mission upload, mission download).

enums.name: MAV_SEVERITY
enums.description: Indicates the severity level, generally used for status messages to indicate their relative urgency. Based on RFC-5424 using expanded definitions at: http://www.kiwisyslog.com/kb/info:-syslog-message-levels/.

entries.name: MAV_SEVERITY_EMERGENCY
entries.description: System is unusable. This is a "panic" condition.

entries.name: MAV_SEVERITY_ALERT
entries.description: Action should be taken immediately. Indicates error in non-critical systems.

entries.name: MAV_SEVERITY_CRITICAL
entries.description: Action must be taken immediately. Indicates failure in a primary system.

entries.name: MAV_SEVERITY_ERROR
entries.description: Indicates an error in secondary/redundant systems.

entries.name: MAV_SEVERITY_WARNING
entries.description: Indicates about a possible future error if this is not resolved within a given timeframe. Example would be a low battery warning.

entries.name: MAV_SEVERITY_NOTICE
entries.description: An unusual event has occurred, though not an error condition. This should be investigated for the root cause.

entries.name: MAV_SEVERITY_INFO
entries.description: Normal operational messages. Useful for logging. No action is required for these messages.

entries.name: MAV_SEVERITY_DEBUG
entries.description: Useful non-operational messages that can assist in debugging. These should not occur during normal operation.

enums.name: MAV_MISSION_TYPE
enums.description: Type of mission items being requested/sent in mission protocol.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_TYPE_MISSION
entries.description: Items are mission commands for main mission.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_TYPE_FENCE
entries.description: Specifies GeoFence area(s). Items are MAV_CMD_NAV_FENCE_ GeoFence items.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_TYPE_RALLY
entries.description: Specifies the rally points for the vehicle. Rally points are alternative RTL points. Items are MAV_CMD_NAV_RALLY_POINT rally point items.

entries.name: MAV_MISSION_TYPE_ALL
entries.description: Only used in MISSION_CLEAR_ALL to clear all mission types.

enums.name: MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE
enums.description: Enumeration of estimator types

entries.name: MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_UNKNOWN
entries.description: Unknown type of the estimator.

entries.name: MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_NAIVE
entries.description: This is a naive estimator without any real covariance feedback.

entries.name: MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_VISION
entries.description: Computer vision based estimate. Might be up to scale.

entries.name: MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_VIO
entries.description: Visual-inertial estimate.

entries.name: MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_GPS
entries.description: Plain GPS estimate.

entries.name: MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_GPS_INS
entries.description: Estimator integrating GPS and inertial sensing.

entries.name: MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_MOCAP
entries.description: Estimate from external motion capturing system.

entries.name: MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_LIDAR
entries.description: Estimator based on lidar sensor input.

entries.name: MAV_ESTIMATOR_TYPE_AUTOPILOT
entries.description: Estimator on autopilot.

enums.name: MAV_BATTERY_TYPE
enums.description: Enumeration of battery types

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_TYPE_UNKNOWN
entries.description: Not specified.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_TYPE_LIPO
entries.description: Lithium polymer battery

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_TYPE_LIFE
entries.description: Lithium-iron-phosphate battery

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_TYPE_LION
entries.description: Lithium-ION battery

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_TYPE_NIMH
entries.description: Nickel metal hydride battery

enums.name: MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION
enums.description: Enumeration of battery functions

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION_UNKNOWN
entries.description: Battery function is unknown

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION_ALL
entries.description: Battery supports all flight systems

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION_PROPULSION
entries.description: Battery for the propulsion system

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION_AVIONICS
entries.description: Avionics battery

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_FUNCTION_PAYLOAD
entries.description: Payload battery

enums.name: MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE
enums.description: Enumeration for battery charge states.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_UNDEFINED
entries.description: Low battery state is not provided

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_OK
entries.description: Battery is not in low state. Normal operation.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_LOW
entries.description: Battery state is low, warn and monitor close.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_CRITICAL
entries.description: Battery state is critical, return or abort immediately.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_EMERGENCY
entries.description: Battery state is too low for ordinary abort sequence. Perform fastest possible emergency stop to prevent damage.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_FAILED
entries.description: Battery failed, damage unavoidable. Possible causes (faults) are listed in MAV_BATTERY_FAULT.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_UNHEALTHY
entries.description: Battery is diagnosed to be defective or an error occurred, usage is discouraged / prohibited. Possible causes (faults) are listed in MAV_BATTERY_FAULT.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_CHARGING
entries.description: Battery is charging.

enums.name: MAV_BATTERY_MODE
enums.description: Battery mode. Note, the normal operation mode (i.e. when flying) should be reported as MAV_BATTERY_MODE_UNKNOWN to allow message trimming in normal flight.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_MODE_UNKNOWN
entries.description: Battery mode not supported/unknown battery mode/normal operation.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_MODE_AUTO_DISCHARGING
entries.description: Battery is auto discharging (towards storage level).

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_MODE_HOT_SWAP
entries.description: Battery in hot-swap mode (current limited to prevent spikes that might damage sensitive electrical circuits).

enums.name: MAV_BATTERY_FAULT
enums.description: Smart battery supply status/fault flags (bitmask) for health indication. The battery must also report either MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_FAILED or MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_UNHEALTHY if any of these are set.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_FAULT_DEEP_DISCHARGE
entries.description: Battery has deep discharged.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_FAULT_SPIKES
entries.description: Voltage spikes.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_FAULT_CELL_FAIL
entries.description: One or more cells have failed. Battery should also report MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_FAILE (and should not be used).

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_FAULT_OVER_CURRENT
entries.description: Over-current fault.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_FAULT_OVER_TEMPERATURE
entries.description: Over-temperature fault.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_FAULT_UNDER_TEMPERATURE
entries.description: Under-temperature fault.

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_FAULT_INCOMPATIBLE_VOLTAGE
entries.description: Vehicle voltage is not compatible with this battery (batteries on same power rail should have similar voltage).

entries.name: MAV_BATTERY_FAULT_INCOMPATIBLE_FIRMWARE
entries.description: Battery firmware is not compatible with current autopilot firmware.

entries.name: BATTERY_FAULT_INCOMPATIBLE_CELLS_CONFIGURATION
entries.description: Battery is not compatible due to cell configuration (e.g. 5s1p when vehicle requires 6s).

enums.name: MAV_FUEL_TYPE
enums.description: Fuel types for use in FUEL_TYPE. Fuel types specify the units for the maximum, available and consumed fuel, and for the flow rates.

entries.name: MAV_FUEL_TYPE_UNKNOWN
entries.description: Not specified. Fuel levels are normalized (i.e. maximum is 1, and other levels are relative to 1).

entries.name: MAV_FUEL_TYPE_LIQUID
entries.description: A generic liquid fuel. Fuel levels are in millilitres (ml). Fuel rates are in millilitres/second.

entries.name: MAV_FUEL_TYPE_GAS
entries.description: A gas tank. Fuel levels are in kilo-Pascal (kPa), and flow rates are in milliliters per second (ml/s).

enums.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG
enums.description: Flags to report status/failure cases for a power generator (used in GENERATOR_STATUS). Note that FAULTS are conditions that cause the generator to fail. Warnings are conditions that require attention before the next use (they indicate the system is not operating properly).

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_OFF
entries.description: Generator is off.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_READY
entries.description: Generator is ready to start generating power.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_GENERATING
entries.description: Generator is generating power.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_CHARGING
entries.description: Generator is charging the batteries (generating enough power to charge and provide the load).

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_REDUCED_POWER
entries.description: Generator is operating at a reduced maximum power.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_MAXPOWER
entries.description: Generator is providing the maximum output.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_OVERTEMP_WARNING
entries.description: Generator is near the maximum operating temperature, cooling is insufficient.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_OVERTEMP_FAULT
entries.description: Generator hit the maximum operating temperature and shutdown.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_ELECTRONICS_OVERTEMP_WARNING
entries.description: Power electronics are near the maximum operating temperature, cooling is insufficient.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_ELECTRONICS_OVERTEMP_FAULT
entries.description: Power electronics hit the maximum operating temperature and shutdown.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_ELECTRONICS_FAULT
entries.description: Power electronics experienced a fault and shutdown.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_POWERSOURCE_FAULT
entries.description: The power source supplying the generator failed e.g. mechanical generator stopped, tether is no longer providing power, solar cell is in shade, hydrogen reaction no longer happening.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_COMMUNICATION_WARNING
entries.description: Generator controller having communication problems.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_COOLING_WARNING
entries.description: Power electronic or generator cooling system error.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_POWER_RAIL_FAULT
entries.description: Generator controller power rail experienced a fault.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_OVERCURRENT_FAULT
entries.description: Generator controller exceeded the overcurrent threshold and shutdown to prevent damage.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_BATTERY_OVERCHARGE_CURRENT_FAULT
entries.description: Generator controller detected a high current going into the batteries and shutdown to prevent battery damage.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_OVERVOLTAGE_FAULT
entries.description: Generator controller exceeded it's overvoltage threshold and shutdown to prevent it exceeding the voltage rating.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_BATTERY_UNDERVOLT_FAULT
entries.description: Batteries are under voltage (generator will not start).

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_START_INHIBITED
entries.description: Generator start is inhibited by e.g. a safety switch.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_MAINTENANCE_REQUIRED
entries.description: Generator requires maintenance.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_WARMING_UP
entries.description: Generator is not ready to generate yet.

entries.name: MAV_GENERATOR_STATUS_FLAG_IDLE
entries.description: Generator is idle.

entries.name: MAV_VTOL_STATE_MC

entries.name: MAV_VTOL_STATE_FW

enums.name: ESTIMATOR_STATUS_FLAGS
enums.description: Flags in ESTIMATOR_STATUS message

entries.name: ESTIMATOR_ATTITUDE
entries.description: True if the attitude estimate is good

entries.name: ESTIMATOR_VELOCITY_HORIZ
entries.description: True if the horizontal velocity estimate is good

entries.name: ESTIMATOR_VELOCITY_VERT
entries.description: True if the vertical velocity estimate is good

entries.name: ESTIMATOR_POS_HORIZ_REL
entries.description: True if the horizontal position (relative) estimate is good

entries.name: ESTIMATOR_POS_HORIZ_ABS
entries.description: True if the horizontal position (absolute) estimate is good

entries.name: ESTIMATOR_POS_VERT_ABS
entries.description: True if the vertical position (absolute) estimate is good

entries.name: ESTIMATOR_POS_VERT_AGL
entries.description: True if the vertical position (above ground) estimate is good

entries.name: ESTIMATOR_CONST_POS_MODE
entries.description: True if the EKF is in a constant position mode and is not using external measurements (eg GPS or optical flow)

entries.name: ESTIMATOR_PRED_POS_HORIZ_REL
entries.description: True if the EKF has sufficient data to enter a mode that will provide a (relative) position estimate

entries.name: ESTIMATOR_PRED_POS_HORIZ_ABS
entries.description: True if the EKF has sufficient data to enter a mode that will provide a (absolute) position estimate

entries.name: ESTIMATOR_GPS_GLITCH
entries.description: True if the EKF has detected a GPS glitch

entries.name: ESTIMATOR_ACCEL_ERROR
entries.description: True if the EKF has detected bad accelerometer data

enums.name: MOTOR_TEST_ORDER

entries.description: Default autopilot motor test method.

entries.name: MOTOR_TEST_ORDER_SEQUENCE
entries.description: Motor numbers are specified as their index in a predefined vehicle-specific sequence.

entries.name: MOTOR_TEST_ORDER_BOARD
entries.description: Motor numbers are specified as the output as labeled on the board.

enums.name: MOTOR_TEST_THROTTLE_TYPE

entries.name: MOTOR_TEST_THROTTLE_PERCENT
entries.description: Throttle as a percentage (0 ~ 100)

entries.name: MOTOR_TEST_THROTTLE_PWM
entries.description: Throttle as an absolute PWM value (normally in range of 1000~2000).

entries.name: MOTOR_TEST_THROTTLE_PILOT
entries.description: Throttle pass-through from pilot's transmitter.

entries.name: MOTOR_TEST_COMPASS_CAL
entries.description: Per-motor compass calibration test.

entries.name: GPS_INPUT_IGNORE_FLAG_VERTICAL_ACCURACY

enums.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION
enums.description: Possible actions an aircraft can take to avoid a collision.

entries.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_NONE
entries.description: Ignore any potential collisions

entries.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_REPORT
entries.description: Report potential collision

entries.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_ASCEND_OR_DESCEND
entries.description: Ascend or Descend to avoid threat

entries.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_MOVE_HORIZONTALLY
entries.description: Move horizontally to avoid threat

entries.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_MOVE_PERPENDICULAR
entries.description: Aircraft to move perpendicular to the collision's velocity vector

entries.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_RTL
entries.description: Aircraft to fly directly back to its launch point

entries.name: MAV_COLLISION_ACTION_HOVER
entries.description: Aircraft to stop in place

enums.name: MAV_COLLISION_THREAT_LEVEL
enums.description: Aircraft-rated danger from this threat.

entries.name: MAV_COLLISION_THREAT_LEVEL_NONE
entries.description: Not a threat

entries.name: MAV_COLLISION_THREAT_LEVEL_LOW
entries.description: Craft is mildly concerned about this threat

entries.name: MAV_COLLISION_THREAT_LEVEL_HIGH
entries.description: Craft is panicking, and may take actions to avoid threat

enums.name: MAV_COLLISION_SRC
enums.description: Source of information about this collision.

entries.name: MAV_COLLISION_SRC_ADSB
entries.description: ID field references ADSB_VEHICLE packets

entries.name: MAV_COLLISION_SRC_MAVLINK_GPS_GLOBAL_INT
entries.description: ID field references MAVLink SRC ID

entries.name: GPS_FIX_TYPE_RTK_FLOAT

entries.name: GPS_FIX_TYPE_PPP

entries.name: RTK_BASELINE_COORDINATE_SYSTEM_NED

enums.name: LANDING_TARGET_TYPE
enums.description: Type of landing target

entries.name: LANDING_TARGET_TYPE_LIGHT_BEACON
entries.description: Landing target signaled by light beacon (ex: IR-LOCK)

entries.name: LANDING_TARGET_TYPE_RADIO_BEACON

enums.name: VTOL_TRANSITION_HEADING
enums.description: Direction of VTOL transition

entries.name: VTOL_TRANSITION_HEADING_VEHICLE_DEFAULT
entries.description: Respect the heading configuration of the vehicle.

entries.name: VTOL_TRANSITION_HEADING_NEXT_WAYPOINT
entries.description: Use the heading pointing towards the next waypoint.

entries.name: VTOL_TRANSITION_HEADING_TAKEOFF
entries.description: Use the heading on takeoff (while sitting on the ground).

entries.name: VTOL_TRANSITION_HEADING_SPECIFIED
entries.description: Use the specified heading in parameter 4.

entries.name: VTOL_TRANSITION_HEADING_ANY
entries.description: Use the current heading when reaching takeoff altitude (potentially facing the wind when weather-vaning is active).

enums.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS
enums.description: Camera capability flags (Bitmap)

entries.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_CAPTURE_VIDEO
entries.description: Camera is able to record video

entries.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_CAPTURE_IMAGE
entries.description: Camera is able to capture images

entries.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_MODES
entries.description: Camera has separate Video and Image/Photo modes (MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_MODE)

entries.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_CAN_CAPTURE_IMAGE_IN_VIDEO_MODE
entries.description: Camera can capture images while in video mode

entries.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_CAN_CAPTURE_VIDEO_IN_IMAGE_MODE
entries.description: Camera can capture videos while in Photo/Image mode

entries.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_IMAGE_SURVEY_MODE
entries.description: Camera has image survey mode (MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_MODE)

entries.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_BASIC_ZOOM
entries.description: Camera has basic zoom control (MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_ZOOM)

entries.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_BASIC_FOCUS
entries.description: Camera has basic focus control (MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_FOCUS)

entries.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_VIDEO_STREAM
entries.description: Camera has video streaming capabilities (request VIDEO_STREAM_INFORMATION with MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE for video streaming info)

entries.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_TRACKING_POINT
entries.description: Camera supports tracking of a point on the camera view.

entries.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_TRACKING_RECTANGLE
entries.description: Camera supports tracking of a selection rectangle on the camera view.

entries.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_TRACKING_GEO_STATUS
entries.description: Camera supports tracking geo status (CAMERA_TRACKING_GEO_STATUS).

entries.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_THERMAL_RANGE
entries.description: Camera supports absolute thermal range (request CAMERA_THERMAL_RANGE with MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE).

entries.name: CAMERA_CAP_FLAGS_HAS_MTI
entries.description: Camera supports Moving Target Indicators (MTI) on the camera view (using MAV_CMD_CAMERA_START_MTI).

entries.name: VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS_FLAGS_THERMAL

entries.name: VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS_FLAGS_THERMAL_RANGE_ENABLED

entries.name: VIDEO_STREAM_ENCODING_H265
