enums.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_STATUS_FLAGS
enums.description: Camera tracking status flags

entries.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_STATUS_FLAGS_IDLE
entries.description: Camera is not tracking

entries.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_STATUS_FLAGS_ACTIVE
entries.description: Camera is tracking

entries.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_STATUS_FLAGS_ERROR
entries.description: Camera tracking in error state

entries.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_STATUS_FLAGS_MTI
entries.description: Camera Moving Target Indicators (MTI) are active

entries.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_STATUS_FLAGS_COASTING

enums.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_MODE
enums.description: Camera tracking modes

entries.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_MODE_NONE
entries.description: Not tracking

entries.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_MODE_POINT
entries.description: Target is a point

entries.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_MODE_RECTANGLE
entries.description: Target is a rectangle

enums.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_TARGET_DATA
enums.description: Camera tracking target data (shows where tracked target is within image)

entries.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_TARGET_DATA_EMBEDDED
entries.description: Target data embedded in image data (proprietary)

entries.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_TARGET_DATA_RENDERED
entries.description: Target data rendered in image

entries.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_TARGET_DATA_IN_STATUS
entries.description: Target data within status message (Point or Rectangle)

enums.name: CAMERA_ZOOM_TYPE
enums.description: Zoom types for MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_ZOOM

entries.name: ZOOM_TYPE_STEP
entries.description: Zoom one step increment (-1 for wide, 1 for tele)

entries.name: ZOOM_TYPE_CONTINUOUS
entries.description: Continuous normalized zoom in/out rate until stopped. Range -1..1, negative: wide, positive: narrow/tele, 0 to stop zooming. Other values should be clipped to the range.

entries.name: ZOOM_TYPE_RANGE
entries.description: Zoom value as proportion of full camera range (a percentage value between 0.0 and 100.0)

entries.name: ZOOM_TYPE_FOCAL_LENGTH
entries.description: Zoom value/variable focal length in millimetres. Note that there is no message to get the valid zoom range of the camera, so this can type can only be used for cameras where the zoom range is known (implying that this cannot reliably be used in a GCS for an arbitrary camera)

entries.name: ZOOM_TYPE_HORIZONTAL_FOV
entries.description: Zoom value as horizontal field of view in degrees.

enums.name: SET_FOCUS_TYPE
enums.description: Focus types for MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_FOCUS

entries.name: FOCUS_TYPE_STEP
entries.description: Focus one step increment (-1 for focusing in, 1 for focusing out towards infinity).

entries.name: FOCUS_TYPE_CONTINUOUS
entries.description: Continuous normalized focus in/out rate until stopped. Range -1..1, negative: in, positive: out towards infinity, 0 to stop focusing. Other values should be clipped to the range.

entries.name: FOCUS_TYPE_RANGE
entries.description: Focus value as proportion of full camera focus range (a value between 0.0 and 100.0)

entries.name: FOCUS_TYPE_METERS
entries.description: Focus value in metres. Note that there is no message to get the valid focus range of the camera, so this can type can only be used for cameras where the range is known (implying that this cannot reliably be used in a GCS for an arbitrary camera).

entries.name: FOCUS_TYPE_AUTO
entries.description: Focus automatically.

entries.name: FOCUS_TYPE_AUTO_SINGLE
entries.description: Single auto focus. Mainly used for still pictures. Usually abbreviated as AF-S.

entries.name: FOCUS_TYPE_AUTO_CONTINUOUS
entries.description: Continuous auto focus. Mainly used for dynamic scenes. Abbreviated as AF-C.

enums.name: CAMERA_SOURCE
enums.description: Camera sources for MAV_CMD_SET_CAMERA_SOURCE

entries.name: CAMERA_SOURCE_DEFAULT
entries.description: Default camera source.

entries.name: CAMERA_SOURCE_RGB
entries.description: RGB camera source.

entries.name: CAMERA_SOURCE_IR
entries.description: IR camera source.

entries.name: CAMERA_SOURCE_NDVI
entries.description: NDVI camera source.

enums.name: PARAM_ACK
enums.description: Result from PARAM_EXT_SET message.

entries.name: PARAM_ACK_ACCEPTED
entries.description: Parameter value ACCEPTED and SET

entries.name: PARAM_ACK_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED
entries.description: Parameter value UNKNOWN/UNSUPPORTED

entries.name: PARAM_ACK_FAILED
entries.description: Parameter failed to set

entries.name: PARAM_ACK_IN_PROGRESS
entries.description: Parameter value received but not yet set/accepted. A subsequent PARAM_EXT_ACK with the final result will follow once operation is completed. This is returned immediately for parameters that take longer to set, indicating that the the parameter was received and does not need to be resent.

enums.name: CAMERA_MODE
enums.description: Camera Modes.

entries.name: CAMERA_MODE_IMAGE
entries.description: Camera is in image/photo capture mode.

entries.name: CAMERA_MODE_VIDEO
entries.description: Camera is in video capture mode.

entries.name: CAMERA_MODE_IMAGE_SURVEY
entries.description: Camera is in image survey capture mode. It allows for camera controller to do specific settings for surveys.

entries.name: MAV_ARM_AUTH_DENIED_REASON_GENERIC
entries.description: Not a specific reason

entries.name: MAV_ARM_AUTH_DENIED_REASON_NONE
entries.description: Authorizer will send the error as string to GCS

entries.name: MAV_ARM_AUTH_DENIED_REASON_INVALID_WAYPOINT
entries.description: At least one waypoint have a invalid value

entries.name: MAV_ARM_AUTH_DENIED_REASON_TIMEOUT
entries.description: Timeout in the authorizer process(in case it depends on network)

entries.name: MAV_ARM_AUTH_DENIED_REASON_AIRSPACE_IN_USE
entries.description: Airspace of the mission in use by another vehicle, second result parameter can have the waypoint id that caused it to be denied.

entries.name: MAV_ARM_AUTH_DENIED_REASON_BAD_WEATHER
entries.description: Weather is not good to fly

enums.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK
enums.description: Bitmap to indicate which dimensions should be ignored by the vehicle: a value of 0b0000000000000000 or 0b0000001000000000 indicates that none of the setpoint dimensions should be ignored. If bit 9 is set the floats afx afy afz should be interpreted as force instead of acceleration.

entries.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_X_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore position x

entries.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_Y_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore position y

entries.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_Z_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore position z

entries.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_VX_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore velocity x

entries.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_VY_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore velocity y

entries.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_VZ_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore velocity z

entries.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_AX_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore acceleration x

entries.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_AY_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore acceleration y

entries.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_AZ_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore acceleration z

entries.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_FORCE_SET
entries.description: Use force instead of acceleration

entries.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_YAW_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore yaw

entries.name: POSITION_TARGET_TYPEMASK_YAW_RATE_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore yaw rate

enums.name: ATTITUDE_TARGET_TYPEMASK
enums.description: Bitmap to indicate which dimensions should be ignored by the vehicle: a value of 0b00000000 indicates that none of the setpoint dimensions should be ignored.

entries.name: ATTITUDE_TARGET_TYPEMASK_BODY_ROLL_RATE_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore body roll rate

entries.name: ATTITUDE_TARGET_TYPEMASK_BODY_PITCH_RATE_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore body pitch rate

entries.name: ATTITUDE_TARGET_TYPEMASK_BODY_YAW_RATE_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore body yaw rate

entries.name: ATTITUDE_TARGET_TYPEMASK_THRUST_BODY_SET
entries.description: Use 3D body thrust setpoint instead of throttle

entries.name: ATTITUDE_TARGET_TYPEMASK_THROTTLE_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore throttle

entries.name: ATTITUDE_TARGET_TYPEMASK_ATTITUDE_IGNORE
entries.description: Ignore attitude

enums.name: CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG
enums.description: These flags encode the cellular network status

entries.name: CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG_UNKNOWN
entries.description: State unknown or not reportable.

entries.name: CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG_FAILED
entries.description: Modem is unusable

entries.name: CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG_INITIALIZING
entries.description: Modem is being initialized

entries.name: CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG_LOCKED
entries.description: Modem is locked

entries.name: CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG_DISABLED
entries.description: Modem is not enabled and is powered down

entries.name: CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG_DISABLING
entries.description: Modem is currently transitioning to the CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG_DISABLED state

entries.name: CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG_ENABLING
entries.description: Modem is currently transitioning to the CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG_ENABLED state

entries.name: CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG_ENABLED
entries.description: Modem is enabled and powered on but not registered with a network provider and not available for data connections

entries.name: CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG_SEARCHING
entries.description: Modem is searching for a network provider to register

entries.name: CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG_REGISTERED
entries.description: Modem is registered with a network provider, and data connections and messaging may be available for use

entries.name: CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG_DISCONNECTING
entries.description: Modem is disconnecting and deactivating the last active packet data bearer. This state will not be entered if more than one packet data bearer is active and one of the active bearers is deactivated

entries.name: CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG_CONNECTING
entries.description: Modem is activating and connecting the first packet data bearer. Subsequent bearer activations when another bearer is already active do not cause this state to be entered

entries.name: CELLULAR_STATUS_FLAG_CONNECTED
entries.description: One or more packet data bearers is active and connected

entries.name: CELLULAR_NETWORK_FAILED_REASON_SIM_ERROR

enums.name: PRECISION_LAND_MODE

entries.name: PRECISION_LAND_MODE_DISABLED
entries.description: Normal (non-precision) landing.

entries.name: PRECISION_LAND_MODE_OPPORTUNISTIC
entries.description: Use precision landing if beacon detected when land command accepted, otherwise land normally.

entries.name: PRECISION_LAND_MODE_REQUIRED
entries.description: Use precision landing, searching for beacon if not found when land command accepted (land normally if beacon cannot be found).

enums.name: AIS_TYPE

entries.name: AIS_TYPE_UNKNOWN
entries.description: Not available (default).

entries.name: AIS_TYPE_WIG
entries.description: Wing In Ground effect.

entries.name: AIS_TYPE_TOWING_LARGE
entries.description: Towing: length exceeds 200m or breadth exceeds 25m.

entries.name: AIS_TYPE_DREDGING
entries.description: Dredging or other underwater ops.

entries.name: AIS_TYPE_HSC
entries.description: High Speed Craft.

entries.name: AIS_TYPE_SAR
entries.description: Search And Rescue vessel.

entries.name: AIS_TYPE_ANTI_POLLUTION
entries.description: Anti-pollution equipment.

entries.name: AIS_TYPE_NONECOMBATANT
entries.description: Noncombatant ship according to RR Resolution No. 18.

entries.name: AIS_NAV_STATUS_UNDER_WAY
entries.description: Under way using engine.

entries.name: AIS_NAV_STATUS_AIS_SART
entries.description: Search And Rescue Transponder.

entries.name: AIS_NAV_STATUS_UNKNOWN
entries.description: Not available (default).

enums.name: AIS_FLAGS
enums.description: These flags are used in the AIS_VESSEL.fields bitmask to indicate validity of data in the other message fields. When set, the data is valid.

entries.name: AIS_FLAGS_POSITION_ACCURACY
entries.description: 1 = Position accuracy less than 10m, 0 = position accuracy greater than 10m.

entries.name: AIS_FLAGS_HIGH_VELOCITY
entries.description: 1 = Velocity over 52.5765m/s (102.2 knots)

entries.name: AIS_FLAGS_TURN_RATE_SIGN_ONLY
entries.description: Only the sign of the returned turn rate value is valid, either greater than 5deg/30s or less than -5deg/30s

entries.name: AIS_FLAGS_LARGE_BOW_DIMENSION
entries.description: Distance to bow is larger than 511m

entries.name: AIS_FLAGS_LARGE_STERN_DIMENSION
entries.description: Distance to stern is larger than 511m

entries.name: AIS_FLAGS_LARGE_PORT_DIMENSION
entries.description: Distance to port side is larger than 63m

entries.name: AIS_FLAGS_LARGE_STARBOARD_DIMENSION
entries.description: Distance to starboard side is larger than 63m

enums.name: FAILURE_UNIT
enums.description: List of possible units where failures can be injected.

enums.name: FAILURE_TYPE
enums.description: List of possible failure type to inject.

entries.name: FAILURE_TYPE_OK
entries.description: No failure injected, used to reset a previous failure.

entries.name: FAILURE_TYPE_OFF
entries.description: Sets unit off, so completely non-responsive.

entries.name: FAILURE_TYPE_STUCK
entries.description: Unit is stuck e.g. keeps reporting the same value.

entries.name: FAILURE_TYPE_GARBAGE
entries.description: Unit is reporting complete garbage.

entries.name: FAILURE_TYPE_WRONG
entries.description: Unit is consistently wrong.

entries.name: FAILURE_TYPE_SLOW
entries.description: Unit is slow, so e.g. reporting at slower than expected rate.

entries.name: FAILURE_TYPE_DELAYED
entries.description: Data of unit is delayed in time.

entries.name: FAILURE_TYPE_INTERMITTENT
entries.description: Unit is sometimes working, sometimes not.

entries.name: NAV_VTOL_LAND_OPTIONS_DEFAULT
entries.description: Default autopilot landing behaviour.

entries.name: NAV_VTOL_LAND_OPTIONS_FW_DESCENT
entries.description: Descend in fixed wing mode, transitioning to multicopter mode for vertical landing when close to the ground. The fixed wing descent pattern is at the discretion of the vehicle (e.g. transition altitude, loiter direction, radius, and speed, etc.).

entries.name: NAV_VTOL_LAND_OPTIONS_HOVER_DESCENT
entries.description: Land in multicopter mode on reaching the landing coordinates (the whole landing is by "hover descent").

enums.name: MAV_WINCH_STATUS_FLAG
enums.description: Winch status flags used in WINCH_STATUS

entries.name: MAV_WINCH_STATUS_HEALTHY
entries.description: Winch is healthy

entries.name: MAV_WINCH_STATUS_FULLY_RETRACTED
entries.description: Winch line is fully retracted

entries.name: MAV_WINCH_STATUS_MOVING
entries.description: Winch motor is moving

entries.name: MAV_WINCH_STATUS_CLUTCH_ENGAGED
entries.description: Winch clutch is engaged allowing motor to move freely.

entries.name: MAV_WINCH_STATUS_LOCKED
entries.description: Winch is locked by locking mechanism.

entries.name: MAV_WINCH_STATUS_DROPPING
entries.description: Winch is gravity dropping payload.

entries.name: MAV_WINCH_STATUS_ARRESTING
entries.description: Winch is arresting payload descent.

entries.name: MAV_WINCH_STATUS_GROUND_SENSE
entries.description: Winch is using torque measurements to sense the ground.

entries.name: MAV_WINCH_STATUS_RETRACTING
entries.description: Winch is returning to the fully retracted position.

entries.name: MAV_WINCH_STATUS_REDELIVER
entries.description: Winch is redelivering the payload. This is a failover state if the line tension goes above a threshold during RETRACTING.

entries.name: MAV_WINCH_STATUS_ABANDON_LINE
entries.description: Winch is abandoning the line and possibly payload. Winch unspools the entire calculated line length. This is a failover state from REDELIVER if the number of attempts exceeds a threshold.

entries.name: MAV_WINCH_STATUS_LOCKING
entries.description: Winch is engaging the locking mechanism.

entries.name: MAV_WINCH_STATUS_LOAD_LINE
entries.description: Winch is spooling on line.

entries.name: MAV_WINCH_STATUS_LOAD_PAYLOAD
entries.description: Winch is loading a payload.

enums.name: MAV_FTP_ERR
enums.description: MAV FTP error codes (https://mavlink.io/en/services/ftp.html)

entries.name: MAV_FTP_ERR_NONE
entries.description: None: No error

entries.name: MAV_FTP_ERR_FAIL
entries.description: Fail: Unknown failure

entries.name: MAV_FTP_ERR_FAILERRNO
entries.description: FailErrno: Command failed, Err number sent back in PayloadHeader.data[1]. This is a file-system error number understood by the server operating system.

entries.name: MAV_FTP_ERR_INVALIDDATASIZE
entries.description: InvalidDataSize: Payload size is invalid

entries.name: MAV_FTP_ERR_INVALIDSESSION
entries.description: InvalidSession: Session is not currently open

entries.name: MAV_FTP_ERR_NOSESSIONSAVAILABLE
entries.description: NoSessionsAvailable: All available sessions are already in use

entries.name: MAV_FTP_ERR_EOF
entries.description: EOF: Offset past end of file for ListDirectory and ReadFile commands

entries.name: MAV_FTP_ERR_UNKNOWNCOMMAND
entries.description: UnknownCommand: Unknown command / opcode

entries.name: MAV_FTP_ERR_FILEEXISTS
entries.description: FileExists: File/directory already exists

entries.name: MAV_FTP_ERR_FILEPROTECTED
entries.description: FileProtected: File/directory is write protected

entries.name: MAV_FTP_ERR_FILENOTFOUND
entries.description: FileNotFound: File/directory not found

enums.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE
enums.description: MAV FTP opcodes: https://mavlink.io/en/services/ftp.html

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_NONE
entries.description: None. Ignored, always ACKed

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_TERMINATESESSION
entries.description: TerminateSession: Terminates open Read session

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_RESETSESSION
entries.description: ResetSessions: Terminates all open read sessions

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_LISTDIRECTORY
entries.description: ListDirectory. List files and directories in path from offset

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_OPENFILERO
entries.description: OpenFileRO: Opens file at path for reading, returns session

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_READFILE
entries.description: ReadFile: Reads size bytes from offset in session

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_CREATEFILE
entries.description: CreateFile: Creates file at path for writing, returns session

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_WRITEFILE
entries.description: WriteFile: Writes size bytes to offset in session

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_REMOVEFILE
entries.description: RemoveFile: Remove file at path

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_CREATEDIRECTORY
entries.description: CreateDirectory: Creates directory at path

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_REMOVEDIRECTORY
entries.description: RemoveDirectory: Removes directory at path. The directory must be empty.

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_OPENFILEWO
entries.description: OpenFileWO: Opens file at path for writing, returns session

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_TRUNCATEFILE
entries.description: TruncateFile: Truncate file at path to offset length

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_RENAME
entries.description: Rename: Rename path1 to path2

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_CALCFILECRC
entries.description: CalcFileCRC32: Calculate CRC32 for file at path

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_BURSTREADFILE
entries.description: BurstReadFile: Burst download session file

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_ACK
entries.description: ACK: ACK response

entries.name: MAV_FTP_OPCODE_NAK
entries.description: NAK: NAK response

enums.name: MISSION_STATE
enums.description: States of the mission state machine. Note that these states are independent of whether the mission is in a mode that can execute mission items or not (is suspended). They may not all be relevant on all vehicles.

entries.name: MISSION_STATE_UNKNOWN
entries.description: The mission status reporting is not supported.

entries.name: MISSION_STATE_NO_MISSION
entries.description: No mission on the vehicle.

entries.name: MISSION_STATE_NOT_STARTED
entries.description: Mission has not started. This is the case after a mission has uploaded but not yet started executing.

entries.name: MISSION_STATE_ACTIVE
entries.description: Mission is active, and will execute mission items when in auto mode.

entries.name: MISSION_STATE_PAUSED
entries.description: Mission is paused when in auto mode.

entries.name: MISSION_STATE_COMPLETE
entries.description: Mission has executed all mission items.

enums.name: SAFETY_SWITCH_STATE
enums.description: Possible safety switch states.

entries.name: SAFETY_SWITCH_STATE_SAFE
entries.description: Safety switch is engaged and vehicle should be safe to approach.

entries.name: SAFETY_SWITCH_STATE_DANGEROUS
entries.description: Safety switch is NOT engaged and motors, propellers and other actuators should be considered active.

enums.name: ILLUMINATOR_MODE
enums.description: Modes of illuminator

entries.name: ILLUMINATOR_MODE_UNKNOWN
entries.description: Illuminator mode is not specified/unknown

entries.name: ILLUMINATOR_MODE_INTERNAL_CONTROL
entries.description: Illuminator behavior is controlled by MAV_CMD_DO_ILLUMINATOR_CONFIGURE settings

entries.name: ILLUMINATOR_MODE_EXTERNAL_SYNC
entries.description: Illuminator behavior is controlled by external factors: e.g. an external hardware signal

enums.name: ILLUMINATOR_ERROR_FLAGS
enums.description: Illuminator module error flags (bitmap, 0 means no error)

entries.name: ILLUMINATOR_ERROR_FLAGS_THERMAL_THROTTLING
entries.description: Illuminator thermal throttling error.

entries.name: ILLUMINATOR_ERROR_FLAGS_OVER_TEMPERATURE_SHUTDOWN
entries.description: Illuminator over temperature shutdown error.

entries.name: ILLUMINATOR_ERROR_FLAGS_THERMISTOR_FAILURE
entries.description: Illuminator thermistor failure.

enums.name: MAV_STANDARD_MODE
enums.description: Standard modes with a well understood meaning across flight stacks and vehicle types. For example, most flight stack have the concept of a "return" or "RTL" mode that takes a vehicle to safety, even though the precise mechanics of this mode may differ. The modes supported by a flight stack can be queried using AVAILABLE_MODES and set using MAV_CMD_DO_SET_STANDARD_MODE. The current mode is streamed in CURRENT_MODE. See https://mavlink.io/en/services/standard_modes.html

entries.name: MAV_STANDARD_MODE_NON_STANDARD
entries.description: Non standard mode. This may be used when reporting the mode if the current flight mode is not a standard mode.

entries.name: MAV_STANDARD_MODE_POSITION_HOLD
entries.description: Position mode (manual). Position-controlled and stabilized manual mode. When sticks are released vehicles return to their level-flight orientation and hold both position and altitude against wind and external forces. This mode can only be set by vehicles that can hold a fixed position. Multicopter (MC) vehicles actively brake and hold both position and altitude against wind and external forces. Hybrid MC/FW ("VTOL") vehicles first transition to multicopter mode (if needed) but otherwise behave in the same way as MC vehicles. Fixed-wing (FW) vehicles must not support this mode. Other vehicle types must not support this mode (this may be revisited through the PR process).

entries.name: MAV_STANDARD_MODE_ORBIT
entries.description: Orbit (manual). Position-controlled and stabilized manual mode. The vehicle circles around a fixed setpoint in the horizontal plane at a particular radius, altitude, and direction. Flight stacks may further allow manual control over the setpoint position, radius, direction, speed, and/or altitude of the circle, but this is not mandated. Flight stacks may support the [MAV_CMD_DO_ORBIT](https://mavlink.io/en/messages/common.html#MAV_CMD_DO_ORBIT) for changing the orbit parameters. MC and FW vehicles may support this mode. Hybrid MC/FW ("VTOL") vehicles may support this mode in MC/FW or both modes; if the mode is not supported by the current configuration the vehicle should transition to the supported configuration. Other vehicle types must not support this mode (this may be revisited through the PR process).

entries.name: MAV_STANDARD_MODE_CRUISE
entries.description: Cruise mode (manual). Position-controlled and stabilized manual mode. When sticks are released vehicles return to their level-flight orientation and hold their original track against wind and external forces. Fixed-wing (FW) vehicles level orientation and maintain current track and altitude against wind and external forces. Hybrid MC/FW ("VTOL") vehicles first transition to FW mode (if needed) but otherwise behave in the same way as MC vehicles. Multicopter (MC) vehicles must not support this mode. Other vehicle types must not support this mode (this may be revisited through the PR process).

entries.name: MAV_STANDARD_MODE_ALTITUDE_HOLD
entries.description: Altitude hold (manual). Altitude-controlled and stabilized manual mode. When sticks are released vehicles return to their level-flight orientation and hold their altitude. MC vehicles continue with existing momentum and may move with wind (or other external forces). FW vehicles continue with current heading, but may be moved off-track by wind. Hybrid MC/FW ("VTOL") vehicles behave according to their current configuration/mode (FW or MC). Other vehicle types must not support this mode (this may be revisited through the PR process).

entries.name: MAV_STANDARD_MODE_SAFE_RECOVERY
entries.description: Safe recovery mode (auto). Automatic mode that takes vehicle to a predefined safe location via a safe flight path, and may also automatically land the vehicle. This mode is more commonly referred to as RTL and/or or Smart RTL. The precise return location, flight path, and landing behaviour depend on vehicle configuration and type. For example, the vehicle might return to the home/launch location, a rally point, or the start of a mission landing, it might follow a direct path, mission path, or breadcrumb path, and land using a mission landing pattern or some other kind of descent.

entries.name: MAV_STANDARD_MODE_MISSION
entries.description: Mission mode (automatic). Automatic mode that executes MAVLink missions. Missions are executed from the current waypoint as soon as the mode is enabled.

entries.name: MAV_STANDARD_MODE_LAND
entries.description: Land mode (auto). Automatic mode that lands the vehicle at the current location. The precise landing behaviour depends on vehicle configuration and type.

entries.name: MAV_STANDARD_MODE_TAKEOFF
entries.description: Takeoff mode (auto). Automatic takeoff mode. The precise takeoff behaviour depends on vehicle configuration and type.

enums.name: MAV_MODE_PROPERTY
enums.description: Mode properties.

entries.name: MAV_MODE_PROPERTY_ADVANCED
entries.description: If set, this mode is an advanced mode. For example a rate-controlled manual mode might be advanced, whereas a position-controlled manual mode is not. A GCS can optionally use this flag to configure the UI for its intended users.

entries.name: MAV_MODE_PROPERTY_NOT_USER_SELECTABLE
entries.description: If set, this mode should not be added to the list of selectable modes. The mode might still be selected by the FC directly (for example as part of a failsafe).

entries.name: MAV_MODE_PROPERTY_AUTO_MODE
entries.description: If set, this mode is automatically controlled (it may use but does not require a manual controller). If unset the mode is a assumed to require user input (be a manual mode).

enums.name: HIL_ACTUATOR_CONTROLS_FLAGS
enums.description: Flags used in HIL_ACTUATOR_CONTROLS message.

entries.name: HIL_ACTUATOR_CONTROLS_FLAGS_LOCKSTEP
entries.description: Simulation is using lockstep

enums.name: COMPUTER_STATUS_FLAGS
enums.description: Flags used to report computer status.

entries.name: COMPUTER_STATUS_FLAGS_UNDER_VOLTAGE
entries.description: Indicates if the system is experiencing voltage outside of acceptable range.

entries.name: COMPUTER_STATUS_FLAGS_CPU_THROTTLE
entries.description: Indicates if CPU throttling is active.

entries.name: COMPUTER_STATUS_FLAGS_THERMAL_THROTTLE
entries.description: Indicates if thermal throttling is active.

entries.name: COMPUTER_STATUS_FLAGS_DISK_FULL
entries.description: Indicates if main disk is full.

enums.name: AIRSPEED_SENSOR_FLAGS
enums.description: Airspeed sensor flags

entries.name: AIRSPEED_SENSOR_UNHEALTHY
entries.description: Airspeed sensor is unhealthy

entries.name: AIRSPEED_SENSOR_USING
entries.description: True if the data from this sensor is being actively used by the flight controller for guidance, navigation or control.

messages.name: HEARTBEAT
messages.description: The heartbeat message shows that a system or component is present and responding. The type and autopilot fields (along with the message component id), allow the receiving system to treat further messages from this system appropriately (e.g. by laying out the user interface based on the autopilot). This microservice is documented at https://mavlink.io/en/services/heartbeat.html

fields.name: type
fields.description: Vehicle or component type. For a flight controller component the vehicle type (quadrotor, helicopter, etc.). For other components the component type (e.g. camera, gimbal, etc.). This should be used in preference to component id for identifying the component type.

fields.name: autopilot
fields.description: Autopilot type / class. Use MAV_AUTOPILOT_INVALID for components that are not flight controllers.

fields.name: custom_mode
fields.description: A bitfield for use for autopilot-specific flags

fields.name: mavlink_version
fields.description: MAVLink version, not writable by user, gets added by protocol because of magic data type: uint8_t_mavlink_version

messages.name: GLOBAL_POSITION_INT
messages.description: The filtered global position (e.g. fused GPS and accelerometers). The position is in GPS-frame (right-handed, Z-up). It is designed as scaled integer message since the resolution of float is not sufficient.

fields.name: alt
fields.description: Altitude (MSL). Note that virtually all GPS modules provide both WGS84 and MSL.

fields.name: hdg
fields.description: Vehicle heading (yaw angle), 0.0..359.99 degrees. If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX

messages.name: AUTOPILOT_VERSION
messages.description: Version and capability of autopilot software. This should be emitted in response to a request with MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE.

fields.name: flight_sw_version
fields.description: Firmware version number. The field must be encoded as 4 bytes, where each byte (shown from MSB to LSB) is part of a semantic version: (major) (minor) (patch) (FIRMWARE_VERSION_TYPE).

fields.name: board_version
fields.description: HW / board version (last 8 bits should be silicon ID, if any). The first 16 bits of this field specify a board type from an enumeration stored at https://github.com/PX4/PX4-Bootloader/blob/master/board_types.txt and with extensive additions at https://github.com/ArduPilot/ardupilot/blob/master/Tools/AP_Bootloader/board_types.txt

fields.name: flight_custom_version
fields.description: Custom version field, commonly the first 8 bytes of the git hash. This is not an unique identifier, but should allow to identify the commit using the main version number even for very large code bases.

fields.name: middleware_custom_version
fields.description: Custom version field, commonly the first 8 bytes of the git hash. This is not an unique identifier, but should allow to identify the commit using the main version number even for very large code bases.

fields.name: os_custom_version
fields.description: Custom version field, commonly the first 8 bytes of the git hash. This is not an unique identifier, but should allow to identify the commit using the main version number even for very large code bases.

fields.name: uid
fields.description: UID if provided by hardware (see uid2)

fields.name: uid2
fields.description: UID if provided by hardware (supersedes the uid field. If this is non-zero, use this field, otherwise use uid)

messages.name: SYS_STATUS
messages.description: Sensor and subsystem status information. Provides a compact representation of sensor/subsystem status and a few other basic statistics.

fields.name: onboard_control_sensors_present
fields.description: Bitmap showing which onboard controllers and sensors are present. Value of 0: not present. Value of 1: present.

fields.name: onboard_control_sensors_enabled
fields.description: Bitmap showing which onboard controllers and sensors are enabled: Value of 0: not enabled. Value of 1: enabled.

fields.name: onboard_control_sensors_health
fields.description: Bitmap showing which onboard controllers and sensors have an error (or are operational). Value of 0: error. Value of 1: healthy.

fields.name: load
fields.description: Maximum usage in percent of the mainloop time. Values: [0-1000] - should always be below 1000

fields.name: voltage_battery
fields.description: Battery voltage, UINT16_MAX: Voltage not sent by autopilot

fields.name: current_battery
fields.description: Battery current, -1: Current not sent by autopilot

fields.name: battery_remaining
fields.description: Battery energy remaining, -1: Battery remaining energy not sent by autopilot

fields.name: drop_rate_comm
fields.description: Communication drop rate, (UART, I2C, SPI, CAN), dropped packets on all links (packets that were corrupted on reception on the MAV)

fields.name: errors_comm
fields.description: Communication errors (UART, I2C, SPI, CAN), dropped packets on all links (packets that were corrupted on reception on the MAV)

fields.name: onboard_control_sensors_present_extended
fields.description: Bitmap showing which onboard controllers and sensors are present. Value of 0: not present. Value of 1: present.

fields.name: onboard_control_sensors_enabled_extended
fields.description: Bitmap showing which onboard controllers and sensors are enabled: Value of 0: not enabled. Value of 1: enabled.

fields.name: onboard_control_sensors_health_extended
fields.description: Bitmap showing which onboard controllers and sensors have an error (or are operational). Value of 0: error. Value of 1: healthy.

messages.name: SYSTEM_TIME
messages.description: The system time is the time of the sender's master clock. This can be emitted by flight controllers, onboard computers, or other components in the MAVLink network. Components that are using a less reliable time source, such as a battery-backed real time clock, can choose to match their system clock to that of a system that indicates a more recent time. This allows more broadly accurate date stamping of logs, and so on. If precise time synchronization is needed then use TIMESYNC instead.

messages.name: PING
messages.description: A ping message either requesting or responding to a ping. This allows to measure the system latencies, including serial port, radio modem and UDP connections. The ping microservice is documented at https://mavlink.io/en/services/ping.html

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: target_system
fields.description: 0: request ping from all receiving systems. If greater than 0: message is a ping response and number is the system id of the requesting system

fields.name: target_component
fields.description: 0: request ping from all receiving components. If greater than 0: message is a ping response and number is the component id of the requesting component.

messages.name: CHANGE_OPERATOR_CONTROL
messages.description: Request to control this MAV

fields.name: target_system
fields.description: System the GCS requests control for

fields.name: control_request
fields.description: 0: request control of this MAV, 1: Release control of this MAV

fields.name: version
fields.description: 0: key as plaintext, 1-255: future, different hashing/encryption variants. The GCS should in general use the safest mode possible initially and then gradually move down the encryption level if it gets a NACK message indicating an encryption mismatch.

fields.name: passkey
fields.description: Password / Key, depending on version plaintext or encrypted. 25 or less characters, NULL terminated. The characters may involve A-Z, a-z, 0-9, and "!?,.-"

messages.name: CHANGE_OPERATOR_CONTROL_ACK
messages.description: Accept / deny control of this MAV

fields.name: gcs_system_id
fields.description: ID of the GCS this message

fields.name: control_request
fields.description: 0: request control of this MAV, 1: Release control of this MAV

fields.name: ack
fields.description: 0: ACK, 1: NACK: Wrong passkey, 2: NACK: Unsupported passkey encryption method, 3: NACK: Already under control

messages.name: AUTH_KEY
messages.description: Emit an encrypted signature / key identifying this system. PLEASE NOTE: This protocol has been kept simple, so transmitting the key requires an encrypted channel for true safety.

messages.name: LINK_NODE_STATUS
messages.description: Status generated in each node in the communication chain and injected into MAVLink stream.

fields.name: rx_parse_err
fields.description: Number of bytes that could not be parsed correctly.

fields.name: tx_overflows
fields.description: Transmit buffer overflows. This number wraps around as it reaches UINT16_MAX

fields.name: rx_overflows
fields.description: Receive buffer overflows. This number wraps around as it reaches UINT16_MAX

messages.name: SET_MODE
messages.description: Set the system mode, as defined by enum MAV_MODE. There is no target component id as the mode is by definition for the overall aircraft, not only for one component.

fields.name: custom_mode
fields.description: The new autopilot-specific mode. This field can be ignored by an autopilot.

messages.name: PARAM_REQUEST_READ
messages.description: Request to read the onboard parameter with the param_id string id. Onboard parameters are stored as key[const char*] -> value[float]. This allows to send a parameter to any other component (such as the GCS) without the need of previous knowledge of possible parameter names. Thus the same GCS can store different parameters for different autopilots. See also https://mavlink.io/en/services/parameter.html for a full documentation of QGroundControl and IMU code.

fields.name: param_id
fields.description: Onboard parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string

fields.name: param_index
fields.description: Parameter index. Send -1 to use the param ID field as identifier (else the param id will be ignored)

messages.name: PARAM_REQUEST_LIST
messages.description: Request all parameters of this component. After this request, all parameters are emitted. The parameter microservice is documented at https://mavlink.io/en/services/parameter.html

messages.name: PARAM_VALUE
messages.description: Emit the value of a onboard parameter. The inclusion of param_count and param_index in the message allows the recipient to keep track of received parameters and allows him to re-request missing parameters after a loss or timeout. The parameter microservice is documented at https://mavlink.io/en/services/parameter.html

fields.name: param_id
fields.description: Onboard parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string

messages.name: PARAM_SET
messages.description: Set a parameter value (write new value to permanent storage). The receiving component should acknowledge the new parameter value by broadcasting a PARAM_VALUE message (broadcasting ensures that multiple GCS all have an up-to-date list of all parameters). If the sending GCS did not receive a PARAM_VALUE within its timeout time, it should re-send the PARAM_SET message. The parameter microservice is documented at https://mavlink.io/en/services/parameter.html.

fields.name: param_id
fields.description: Onboard parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string

messages.name: GPS_RAW_INT
messages.description: The global position, as returned by the Global Positioning System (GPS). This is NOT the global position estimate of the system, but rather a RAW sensor value. See message GLOBAL_POSITION_INT for the global position estimate.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: alt
fields.description: Altitude (MSL). Positive for up. Note that virtually all GPS modules provide the MSL altitude in addition to the WGS84 altitude.

fields.name: eph
fields.description: GPS HDOP horizontal dilution of position (unitless * 100). If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX

fields.name: epv
fields.description: GPS VDOP vertical dilution of position (unitless * 100). If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX

fields.name: vel
fields.description: GPS ground speed. If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX

fields.name: cog
fields.description: Course over ground (NOT heading, but direction of movement) in degrees * 100, 0.0..359.99 degrees. If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX

fields.name: satellites_visible
fields.description: Number of satellites visible. If unknown, set to UINT8_MAX

fields.name: alt_ellipsoid
fields.description: Altitude (above WGS84, EGM96 ellipsoid). Positive for up.

fields.name: yaw
fields.description: Yaw in earth frame from north. Use 0 if this GPS does not provide yaw. Use UINT16_MAX if this GPS is configured to provide yaw and is currently unable to provide it. Use 36000 for north.

messages.name: GPS_STATUS
messages.description: The positioning status, as reported by GPS. This message is intended to display status information about each satellite visible to the receiver. See message GLOBAL_POSITION_INT for the global position estimate. This message can contain information for up to 20 satellites.

fields.name: satellite_used
fields.description: 0: Satellite not used, 1: used for localization

fields.name: satellite_elevation
fields.description: Elevation (0: right on top of receiver, 90: on the horizon) of satellite

fields.name: satellite_snr
fields.description: Signal to noise ratio of satellite

messages.name: SCALED_IMU
messages.description: The RAW IMU readings for the usual 9DOF sensor setup. This message should contain the scaled values to the described units

fields.name: temperature
fields.description: Temperature, 0: IMU does not provide temperature values. If the IMU is at 0C it must send 1 (0.01C).

messages.name: RAW_IMU
messages.description: The RAW IMU readings for a 9DOF sensor, which is identified by the id (default IMU1). This message should always contain the true raw values without any scaling to allow data capture and system debugging.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Id. Ids are numbered from 0 and map to IMUs numbered from 1 (e.g. IMU1 will have a message with id=0)

fields.name: temperature
fields.description: Temperature, 0: IMU does not provide temperature values. If the IMU is at 0C it must send 1 (0.01C).

messages.name: RAW_PRESSURE
messages.description: The RAW pressure readings for the typical setup of one absolute pressure and one differential pressure sensor. The sensor values should be the raw, UNSCALED ADC values.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

messages.name: SCALED_PRESSURE
messages.description: The pressure readings for the typical setup of one absolute and differential pressure sensor. The units are as specified in each field.

fields.name: temperature_press_diff
fields.description: Differential pressure temperature (0, if not available). Report values of 0 (or 1) as 1 cdegC.

messages.name: ATTITUDE
messages.description: The attitude in the aeronautical frame (right-handed, Z-down, Y-right, X-front, ZYX, intrinsic).

messages.name: ATTITUDE_QUATERNION
messages.description: The attitude in the aeronautical frame (right-handed, Z-down, X-front, Y-right), expressed as quaternion. Quaternion order is w, x, y, z and a zero rotation would be expressed as (1 0 0 0).

fields.name: repr_offset_q
fields.description: Rotation offset by which the attitude quaternion and angular speed vector should be rotated for user display (quaternion with [w, x, y, z] order, zero-rotation is [1, 0, 0, 0], send [0, 0, 0, 0] if field not supported). This field is intended for systems in which the reference attitude may change during flight. For example, tailsitters VTOLs rotate their reference attitude by 90 degrees between hover mode and fixed wing mode, thus repr_offset_q is equal to [1, 0, 0, 0] in hover mode and equal to [0.7071, 0, 0.7071, 0] in fixed wing mode.

messages.name: LOCAL_POSITION_NED
messages.description: The filtered local position (e.g. fused computer vision and accelerometers). Coordinate frame is right-handed, Z-axis down (aeronautical frame, NED / north-east-down convention)

messages.name: RC_CHANNELS_SCALED
messages.description: The scaled values of the RC channels received: (-100%) -10000, (0%) 0, (100%) 10000. Channels that are inactive should be set to INT16_MAX.

fields.name: port
fields.description: Servo output port (set of 8 outputs = 1 port). Flight stacks running on Pixhawk should use: 0 = MAIN, 1 = AUX.

fields.name: rssi
fields.description: Receive signal strength indicator in device-dependent units/scale. Values: [0-254], UINT8_MAX: invalid/unknown.

messages.name: RC_CHANNELS_RAW
messages.description: The RAW values of the RC channels received. The standard PPM modulation is as follows: 1000 microseconds: 0%, 2000 microseconds: 100%. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused. Individual receivers/transmitters might violate this specification.

fields.name: port
fields.description: Servo output port (set of 8 outputs = 1 port). Flight stacks running on Pixhawk should use: 0 = MAIN, 1 = AUX.

fields.name: rssi
fields.description: Receive signal strength indicator in device-dependent units/scale. Values: [0-254], UINT8_MAX: invalid/unknown.

messages.name: SERVO_OUTPUT_RAW
messages.description: Superseded by ACTUATOR_OUTPUT_STATUS. The RAW values of the servo outputs (for RC input from the remote, use the RC_CHANNELS messages). The standard PPM modulation is as follows: 1000 microseconds: 0%, 2000 microseconds: 100%.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: port
fields.description: Servo output port (set of 8 outputs = 1 port). Flight stacks running on Pixhawk should use: 0 = MAIN, 1 = AUX.

messages.name: MISSION_REQUEST_PARTIAL_LIST
messages.description: Request a partial list of mission items from the system/component. https://mavlink.io/en/services/mission.html. If start and end index are the same, just send one waypoint.

fields.name: end_index
fields.description: End index, -1 by default (-1: send list to end). Else a valid index of the list

messages.name: MISSION_WRITE_PARTIAL_LIST
messages.description: This message is sent to the MAV to write a partial list. If start index == end index, only one item will be transmitted / updated. If the start index is NOT 0 and above the current list size, this request should be REJECTED!

fields.name: start_index
fields.description: Start index. Must be smaller / equal to the largest index of the current onboard list.

fields.name: end_index
fields.description: End index, equal or greater than start index.

messages.name: MISSION_ITEM
messages.description: Message encoding a mission item. This message is emitted to announce the presence of a mission item and to set a mission item on the system. The mission item can be either in x, y, z meters (type: LOCAL) or x:lat, y:lon, z:altitude. Local frame is Z-down, right handed (NED), global frame is Z-up, right handed (ENU). NaN may be used to indicate an optional/default value (e.g. to use the system's current latitude or yaw rather than a specific value). See also https://mavlink.io/en/services/mission.html.

fields.name: frame
fields.description: The coordinate system of the waypoint.

fields.name: command
fields.description: The scheduled action for the waypoint.

fields.name: autocontinue
fields.description: Autocontinue to next waypoint. 0: false, 1: true. Set false to pause mission after the item completes.

fields.name: x
fields.description: PARAM5 / local: X coordinate, global: latitude

fields.name: y
fields.description: PARAM6 / local: Y coordinate, global: longitude

fields.name: z
fields.description: PARAM7 / local: Z coordinate, global: altitude (relative or absolute, depending on frame).

messages.name: MISSION_REQUEST
messages.description: Request the information of the mission item with the sequence number seq. The response of the system to this message should be a MISSION_ITEM message. https://mavlink.io/en/services/mission.html

deprecated.description: A system that gets this request should respond with MISSION_ITEM_INT (as though MISSION_REQUEST_INT was received).

messages.name: MISSION_SET_CURRENT
messages.description: Set the mission item with sequence number seq as the current item and emit MISSION_CURRENT (whether or not the mission number changed). If a mission is currently being executed, the system will continue to this new mission item on the shortest path, skipping any intermediate mission items. Note that mission jump repeat counters are not reset (see MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP param2). This message may trigger a mission state-machine change on some systems: for example from MISSION_STATE_NOT_STARTED or MISSION_STATE_PAUSED to MISSION_STATE_ACTIVE. If the system is in mission mode, on those systems this command might therefore start, restart or resume the mission. If the system is not in mission mode this message must not trigger a switch to mission mode.

messages.name: MISSION_CURRENT
messages.description: Message that announces the sequence number of the current target mission item (that the system will fly towards/execute when the mission is running). This message should be streamed all the time (nominally at 1Hz). This message should be emitted following a call to MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MISSION_CURRENT or MISSION_SET_CURRENT.

fields.name: total
fields.description: Total number of mission items on vehicle (on last item, sequence == total). If the autopilot stores its home location as part of the mission this will be excluded from the total. 0: Not supported, UINT16_MAX if no mission is present on the vehicle.

fields.name: mission_state
fields.description: Mission state machine state. MISSION_STATE_UNKNOWN if state reporting not supported.

fields.name: mission_mode
fields.description: Vehicle is in a mode that can execute mission items or suspended. 0: Unknown, 1: In mission mode, 2: Suspended (not in mission mode).

fields.name: mission_id
fields.description: Id of current on-vehicle mission plan, or 0 if IDs are not supported or there is no mission loaded. GCS can use this to track changes to the mission plan type. The same value is returned on mission upload (in the MISSION_ACK).

fields.name: fence_id
fields.description: Id of current on-vehicle fence plan, or 0 if IDs are not supported or there is no fence loaded. GCS can use this to track changes to the fence plan type. The same value is returned on fence upload (in the MISSION_ACK).

fields.name: rally_points_id
fields.description: Id of current on-vehicle rally point plan, or 0 if IDs are not supported or there are no rally points loaded. GCS can use this to track changes to the rally point plan type. The same value is returned on rally point upload (in the MISSION_ACK).

messages.name: MISSION_REQUEST_LIST
messages.description: Request the overall list of mission items from the system/component.

messages.name: MISSION_COUNT
messages.description: This message is emitted as response to MISSION_REQUEST_LIST by the MAV and to initiate a write transaction. The GCS can then request the individual mission item based on the knowledge of the total number of waypoints.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Number of mission items in the sequence

fields.name: opaque_id
fields.description: Id of current on-vehicle mission, fence, or rally point plan (on download from vehicle). This field is used when downloading a plan from a vehicle to a GCS. 0 on upload to the vehicle from GCS. 0 if plan ids are not supported. The current on-vehicle plan ids are streamed in `MISSION_CURRENT`, allowing a GCS to determine if any part of the plan has changed and needs to be re-uploaded. The ids are recalculated by the vehicle when any part of the on-vehicle plan changes (when a new plan is uploaded, the vehicle returns the new id to the GCS in MISSION_ACK).

messages.name: MISSION_CLEAR_ALL
messages.description: Delete all mission items at once.

messages.name: MISSION_ITEM_REACHED
messages.description: A certain mission item has been reached. The system will either hold this position (or circle on the orbit) or (if the autocontinue on the WP was set) continue to the next waypoint.

messages.name: MISSION_ACK
messages.description: Acknowledgment message during waypoint handling. The type field states if this message is a positive ack (type=0) or if an error happened (type=non-zero).

fields.name: opaque_id
fields.description: Id of new on-vehicle mission, fence, or rally point plan (on upload to vehicle). The id is calculated and returned by a vehicle when a new plan is uploaded by a GCS. The only requirement on the id is that it must change when there is any change to the on-vehicle plan type (there is no requirement that the id be globally unique). 0 on download from the vehicle to the GCS (on download the ID is set in MISSION_COUNT). 0 if plan ids are not supported. The current on-vehicle plan ids are streamed in `MISSION_CURRENT`, allowing a GCS to determine if any part of the plan has changed and needs to be re-uploaded.

messages.name: SET_GPS_GLOBAL_ORIGIN
messages.description: Sets the GPS coordinates of the vehicle local origin (0,0,0) position. Vehicle should emit GPS_GLOBAL_ORIGIN irrespective of whether the origin is changed. This enables transform between the local coordinate frame and the global (GPS) coordinate frame, which may be necessary when (for example) indoor and outdoor settings are connected and the MAV should move from in- to outdoor.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

messages.name: GPS_GLOBAL_ORIGIN
messages.description: Publishes the GPS coordinates of the vehicle local origin (0,0,0) position. Emitted whenever a new GPS-Local position mapping is requested or set - e.g. following SET_GPS_GLOBAL_ORIGIN message.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

messages.name: PARAM_MAP_RC
messages.description: Bind a RC channel to a parameter. The parameter should change according to the RC channel value.

fields.name: param_id
fields.description: Onboard parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string

fields.name: param_index
fields.description: Parameter index. Send -1 to use the param ID field as identifier (else the param id will be ignored), send -2 to disable any existing map for this rc_channel_index.

fields.name: parameter_rc_channel_index
fields.description: Index of parameter RC channel. Not equal to the RC channel id. Typically corresponds to a potentiometer-knob on the RC.

fields.name: scale
fields.description: Scale, maps the RC range [-1, 1] to a parameter value

fields.name: param_value_min
fields.description: Minimum param value. The protocol does not define if this overwrites an onboard minimum value. (Depends on implementation)

fields.name: param_value_max
fields.description: Maximum param value. The protocol does not define if this overwrites an onboard maximum value. (Depends on implementation)

messages.name: MISSION_REQUEST_INT
messages.description: Request the information of the mission item with the sequence number seq. The response of the system to this message should be a MISSION_ITEM_INT message. https://mavlink.io/en/services/mission.html

messages.name: SAFETY_SET_ALLOWED_AREA
messages.description: Set a safety zone (volume), which is defined by two corners of a cube. This message can be used to tell the MAV which setpoints/waypoints to accept and which to reject. Safety areas are often enforced by national or competition regulations.

fields.name: frame
fields.description: Coordinate frame. Can be either global, GPS, right-handed with Z axis up or local, right handed, Z axis down.

messages.name: SAFETY_ALLOWED_AREA
messages.description: Read out the safety zone the MAV currently assumes.

fields.name: frame
fields.description: Coordinate frame. Can be either global, GPS, right-handed with Z axis up or local, right handed, Z axis down.

messages.name: ATTITUDE_QUATERNION_COV
messages.description: The attitude in the aeronautical frame (right-handed, Z-down, X-front, Y-right), expressed as quaternion. Quaternion order is w, x, y, z and a zero rotation would be expressed as (1 0 0 0).

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: q
fields.description: Quaternion components, w, x, y, z (1 0 0 0 is the null-rotation)

fields.name: covariance
fields.description: Row-major representation of a 3x3 attitude covariance matrix (states: roll, pitch, yaw; first three entries are the first ROW, next three entries are the second row, etc.). If unknown, assign NaN value to first element in the array.

messages.name: NAV_CONTROLLER_OUTPUT
messages.description: The state of the navigation and position controller.

fields.name: xtrack_error
fields.description: Current crosstrack error on x-y plane

messages.name: GLOBAL_POSITION_INT_COV
messages.description: The filtered global position (e.g. fused GPS and accelerometers). The position is in GPS-frame (right-handed, Z-up). It is designed as scaled integer message since the resolution of float is not sufficient. NOTE: This message is intended for onboard networks / companion computers and higher-bandwidth links and optimized for accuracy and completeness. Please use the GLOBAL_POSITION_INT message for a minimal subset.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: estimator_type
fields.description: Class id of the estimator this estimate originated from.

fields.name: covariance
fields.description: Row-major representation of a 6x6 position and velocity 6x6 cross-covariance matrix (states: lat, lon, alt, vx, vy, vz; first six entries are the first ROW, next six entries are the second row, etc.). If unknown, assign NaN value to first element in the array.

messages.name: LOCAL_POSITION_NED_COV
messages.description: The filtered local position (e.g. fused computer vision and accelerometers). Coordinate frame is right-handed, Z-axis down (aeronautical frame, NED / north-east-down convention)

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: estimator_type
fields.description: Class id of the estimator this estimate originated from.

fields.name: covariance
fields.description: Row-major representation of position, velocity and acceleration 9x9 cross-covariance matrix upper right triangle (states: x, y, z, vx, vy, vz, ax, ay, az; first nine entries are the first ROW, next eight entries are the second row, etc.). If unknown, assign NaN value to first element in the array.

messages.name: RC_CHANNELS
messages.description: The PPM values of the RC channels received. The standard PPM modulation is as follows: 1000 microseconds: 0%, 2000 microseconds: 100%. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused. Individual receivers/transmitters might violate this specification.

fields.name: chancount
fields.description: Total number of RC channels being received. This can be larger than 18, indicating that more channels are available but not given in this message. This value should be 0 when no RC channels are available.

fields.name: rssi
fields.description: Receive signal strength indicator in device-dependent units/scale. Values: [0-254], UINT8_MAX: invalid/unknown.

messages.name: REQUEST_DATA_STREAM
messages.description: Request a data stream.

fields.name: target_system
fields.description: The target requested to send the message stream.

fields.name: target_component
fields.description: The target requested to send the message stream.

fields.name: req_stream_id
fields.description: The ID of the requested data stream

fields.name: start_stop
fields.description: 1 to start sending, 0 to stop sending.

messages.name: DATA_STREAM
messages.description: Data stream status information.

fields.name: stream_id
fields.description: The ID of the requested data stream

fields.name: on_off
fields.description: 1 stream is enabled, 0 stream is stopped.

messages.name: MANUAL_CONTROL
messages.description: Manual (joystick) control message. This message represents movement axes and button using standard joystick axes nomenclature. Unused axes can be disabled and buttons states are transmitted as individual on/off bits of a bitmask. For more information see https://mavlink.io/en/manual_control.html

fields.name: x
fields.description: X-axis, normalized to the range [-1000,1000]. A value of INT16_MAX indicates that this axis is invalid. Generally corresponds to forward(1000)-backward(-1000) movement on a joystick and the pitch of a vehicle.

fields.name: y
fields.description: Y-axis, normalized to the range [-1000,1000]. A value of INT16_MAX indicates that this axis is invalid. Generally corresponds to left(-1000)-right(1000) movement on a joystick and the roll of a vehicle.

fields.name: z
fields.description: Z-axis, normalized to the range [-1000,1000]. A value of INT16_MAX indicates that this axis is invalid. Generally corresponds to a separate slider movement with maximum being 1000 and minimum being -1000 on a joystick and the thrust of a vehicle. Positive values are positive thrust, negative values are negative thrust.

fields.name: r
fields.description: R-axis, normalized to the range [-1000,1000]. A value of INT16_MAX indicates that this axis is invalid. Generally corresponds to a twisting of the joystick, with clockwise being 1000 and counter-clockwise being -1000, and the yaw of a vehicle.

fields.name: buttons
fields.description: A bitfield corresponding to the joystick buttons' 0-15 current state, 1 for pressed, 0 for released. The lowest bit corresponds to Button 1.

fields.name: buttons2
fields.description: A bitfield corresponding to the joystick buttons' 16-31 current state, 1 for pressed, 0 for released. The lowest bit corresponds to Button 16.

fields.name: enabled_extensions
fields.description: Set bits to 1 to indicate which of the following extension fields contain valid data: bit 0: pitch, bit 1: roll, bit 2: aux1, bit 3: aux2, bit 4: aux3, bit 5: aux4, bit 6: aux5, bit 7: aux6

fields.name: s
fields.description: Pitch-only-axis, normalized to the range [-1000,1000]. Generally corresponds to pitch on vehicles with additional degrees of freedom. Valid if bit 0 of enabled_extensions field is set. Set to 0 if invalid.

fields.name: t
fields.description: Roll-only-axis, normalized to the range [-1000,1000]. Generally corresponds to roll on vehicles with additional degrees of freedom. Valid if bit 1 of enabled_extensions field is set. Set to 0 if invalid.

fields.name: aux1
fields.description: Aux continuous input field 1. Normalized in the range [-1000,1000]. Purpose defined by recipient. Valid data if bit 2 of enabled_extensions field is set. 0 if bit 2 is unset.

fields.name: aux2
fields.description: Aux continuous input field 2. Normalized in the range [-1000,1000]. Purpose defined by recipient. Valid data if bit 3 of enabled_extensions field is set. 0 if bit 3 is unset.

fields.name: aux3
fields.description: Aux continuous input field 3. Normalized in the range [-1000,1000]. Purpose defined by recipient. Valid data if bit 4 of enabled_extensions field is set. 0 if bit 4 is unset.

fields.name: aux4
fields.description: Aux continuous input field 4. Normalized in the range [-1000,1000]. Purpose defined by recipient. Valid data if bit 5 of enabled_extensions field is set. 0 if bit 5 is unset.

fields.name: aux5
fields.description: Aux continuous input field 5. Normalized in the range [-1000,1000]. Purpose defined by recipient. Valid data if bit 6 of enabled_extensions field is set. 0 if bit 6 is unset.

fields.name: aux6
fields.description: Aux continuous input field 6. Normalized in the range [-1000,1000]. Purpose defined by recipient. Valid data if bit 7 of enabled_extensions field is set. 0 if bit 7 is unset.

messages.name: RC_CHANNELS_OVERRIDE
messages.description: The RAW values of the RC channels sent to the MAV to override info received from the RC radio. The standard PPM modulation is as follows: 1000 microseconds: 0%, 2000 microseconds: 100%. Individual receivers/transmitters might violate this specification. Note carefully the semantic differences between the first 8 channels and the subsequent channels

fields.name: chan1_raw
fields.description: RC channel 1 value. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of 0 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan2_raw
fields.description: RC channel 2 value. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of 0 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan3_raw
fields.description: RC channel 3 value. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of 0 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan4_raw
fields.description: RC channel 4 value. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of 0 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan5_raw
fields.description: RC channel 5 value. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of 0 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan6_raw
fields.description: RC channel 6 value. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of 0 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan7_raw
fields.description: RC channel 7 value. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of 0 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan8_raw
fields.description: RC channel 8 value. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of 0 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan9_raw
fields.description: RC channel 9 value. A value of 0 or UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of UINT16_MAX-1 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan10_raw
fields.description: RC channel 10 value. A value of 0 or UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of UINT16_MAX-1 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan11_raw
fields.description: RC channel 11 value. A value of 0 or UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of UINT16_MAX-1 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan12_raw
fields.description: RC channel 12 value. A value of 0 or UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of UINT16_MAX-1 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan13_raw
fields.description: RC channel 13 value. A value of 0 or UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of UINT16_MAX-1 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan14_raw
fields.description: RC channel 14 value. A value of 0 or UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of UINT16_MAX-1 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan15_raw
fields.description: RC channel 15 value. A value of 0 or UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of UINT16_MAX-1 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan16_raw
fields.description: RC channel 16 value. A value of 0 or UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of UINT16_MAX-1 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan17_raw
fields.description: RC channel 17 value. A value of 0 or UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of UINT16_MAX-1 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

fields.name: chan18_raw
fields.description: RC channel 18 value. A value of 0 or UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field. A value of UINT16_MAX-1 means to release this channel back to the RC radio.

messages.name: MISSION_ITEM_INT
messages.description: Message encoding a mission item. This message is emitted to announce the presence of a mission item and to set a mission item on the system. The mission item can be either in x, y, z meters (type: LOCAL) or x:lat, y:lon, z:altitude. Local frame is Z-down, right handed (NED), global frame is Z-up, right handed (ENU). NaN or INT32_MAX may be used in float/integer params (respectively) to indicate optional/default values (e.g. to use the component's current latitude, yaw rather than a specific value). See also https://mavlink.io/en/services/mission.html.

fields.name: seq
fields.description: Waypoint ID (sequence number). Starts at zero. Increases monotonically for each waypoint, no gaps in the sequence (0,1,2,3,4).

fields.name: frame
fields.description: The coordinate system of the waypoint.

fields.name: command
fields.description: The scheduled action for the waypoint.

fields.name: autocontinue
fields.description: Autocontinue to next waypoint. 0: false, 1: true. Set false to pause mission after the item completes.

fields.name: x
fields.description: PARAM5 / local: x position in meters * 1e4, global: latitude in degrees * 10^7

fields.name: y
fields.description: PARAM6 / y position: local: x position in meters * 1e4, global: longitude in degrees *10^7

fields.name: z
fields.description: PARAM7 / z position: global: altitude in meters (relative or absolute, depending on frame.

messages.name: VFR_HUD
messages.description: Metrics typically displayed on a HUD for fixed wing aircraft.

fields.name: airspeed
fields.description: Vehicle speed in form appropriate for vehicle type. For standard aircraft this is typically calibrated airspeed (CAS) or indicated airspeed (IAS) - either of which can be used by a pilot to estimate stall speed.

messages.name: COMMAND_INT
messages.description: Send a command with up to seven parameters to the MAV, where params 5 and 6 are integers and the other values are floats. This is preferred over COMMAND_LONG as it allows the MAV_FRAME to be specified for interpreting positional information, such as altitude. COMMAND_INT is also preferred when sending latitude and longitude data in params 5 and 6, as it allows for greater precision. Param 5 and 6 encode positional data as scaled integers, where the scaling depends on the actual command value. NaN or INT32_MAX may be used in float/integer params (respectively) to indicate optional/default values (e.g. to use the component's current latitude, yaw rather than a specific value). The command microservice is documented at https://mavlink.io/en/services/command.html

fields.name: frame
fields.description: The coordinate system of the COMMAND.

fields.name: command
fields.description: The scheduled action for the mission item.

fields.name: x
fields.description: PARAM5 / local: x position in meters * 1e4, global: latitude in degrees * 10^7

fields.name: y
fields.description: PARAM6 / local: y position in meters * 1e4, global: longitude in degrees * 10^7

fields.name: z
fields.description: PARAM7 / z position: global: altitude in meters (relative or absolute, depending on frame).

messages.name: COMMAND_LONG
messages.description: Send a command with up to seven parameters to the MAV. COMMAND_INT is generally preferred when sending MAV_CMD commands that include positional information; it offers higher precision and allows the MAV_FRAME to be specified (which may otherwise be ambiguous, particularly for altitude). The command microservice is documented at https://mavlink.io/en/services/command.html

fields.name: target_system
fields.description: System which should execute the command

fields.name: target_component
fields.description: Component which should execute the command, 0 for all components

fields.name: confirmation
fields.description: 0: First transmission of this command. 1-255: Confirmation transmissions (e.g. for kill command)

messages.name: COMMAND_ACK
messages.description: Report status of a command. Includes feedback whether the command was executed. The command microservice is documented at https://mavlink.io/en/services/command.html

fields.name: progress
fields.description: The progress percentage when result is MAV_RESULT_IN_PROGRESS. Values: [0-100], or UINT8_MAX if the progress is unknown.

fields.name: result_param2
fields.description: Additional result information. Can be set with a command-specific enum containing command-specific error reasons for why the command might be denied. If used, the associated enum must be documented in the corresponding MAV_CMD (this enum should have a 0 value to indicate "unused" or "unknown").

fields.name: target_system
fields.description: System ID of the target recipient. This is the ID of the system that sent the command for which this COMMAND_ACK is an acknowledgement.

fields.name: target_component
fields.description: Component ID of the target recipient. This is the ID of the system that sent the command for which this COMMAND_ACK is an acknowledgement.

messages.name: COMMAND_CANCEL
messages.description: Cancel a long running command. The target system should respond with a COMMAND_ACK to the original command with result=MAV_RESULT_CANCELLED if the long running process was cancelled. If it has already completed, the cancel action can be ignored. The cancel action can be retried until some sort of acknowledgement to the original command has been received. The command microservice is documented at https://mavlink.io/en/services/command.html

If unknown, assign NaN value to first element in the array.

messages.name: TIMESYNC
messages.description: Time synchronization message. The message is used for both timesync requests and responses. The request is sent with `ts1=syncing component timestamp` and `tc1=0`, and may be broadcast or targeted to a specific system/component. The response is sent with `ts1=syncing component timestamp` (mirror back unchanged), and `tc1=responding component timestamp`, with the `target_system` and `target_component` set to ids of the original request. Systems can determine if they are receiving a request or response based on the value of `tc`. If the response has `target_system==target_component==0` the remote system has not been updated to use the component IDs and cannot reliably timesync; the requester may report an error. Timestamps are UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot in nanoseconds (the timestamp format can be inferred by checking for the magnitude of the number; generally it doesn't matter as only the offset is used). The message sequence is repeated numerous times with results being filtered/averaged to estimate the offset. See also: https://mavlink.io/en/services/timesync.html.

fields.name: tc1
fields.description: Time sync timestamp 1. Syncing: 0. Responding: Timestamp of responding component.

fields.name: ts1
fields.description: Time sync timestamp 2. Timestamp of syncing component (mirrored in response).

fields.name: target_system
fields.description: Target system id. Request: 0 (broadcast) or id of specific system. Response must contain system id of the requesting component.

fields.name: target_component
fields.description: Target component id. Request: 0 (broadcast) or id of specific component. Response must contain component id of the requesting component.
