messages.name: SCALED_IMU3
messages.description: The RAW IMU readings for 3rd 9DOF sensor setup. This message should contain the scaled values to the described units

fields.name: temperature
fields.description: Temperature, 0: IMU does not provide temperature values. If the IMU is at 0C it must send 1 (0.01C).

messages.name: DATA_TRANSMISSION_HANDSHAKE
messages.description: Handshake message to initiate, control and stop image streaming when using the Image Transmission Protocol: https://mavlink.io/en/services/image_transmission.html.

fields.name: size
fields.description: total data size (set on ACK only).

fields.name: width
fields.description: Width of a matrix or image.

fields.name: height
fields.description: Height of a matrix or image.

fields.name: packets
fields.description: Number of packets being sent (set on ACK only).

fields.name: payload
fields.description: Payload size per packet (normally 253 byte, see DATA field size in message ENCAPSULATED_DATA) (set on ACK only).

messages.name: ENCAPSULATED_DATA
messages.description: Data packet for images sent using the Image Transmission Protocol: https://mavlink.io/en/services/image_transmission.html.

fields.name: seqnr
fields.description: sequence number (starting with 0 on every transmission)

messages.name: DISTANCE_SENSOR
messages.description: Distance sensor information for an onboard rangefinder.

fields.name: min_distance
fields.description: Minimum distance the sensor can measure

fields.name: max_distance
fields.description: Maximum distance the sensor can measure

fields.name: orientation
fields.description: Direction the sensor faces. downward-facing: ROTATION_PITCH_270, upward-facing: ROTATION_PITCH_90, backward-facing: ROTATION_PITCH_180, forward-facing: ROTATION_NONE, left-facing: ROTATION_YAW_90, right-facing: ROTATION_YAW_270

fields.name: covariance
fields.description: Measurement variance. Max standard deviation is 6cm. UINT8_MAX if unknown.

fields.name: horizontal_fov
fields.description: Horizontal Field of View (angle) where the distance measurement is valid and the field of view is known. Otherwise this is set to 0.

fields.name: vertical_fov
fields.description: Vertical Field of View (angle) where the distance measurement is valid and the field of view is known. Otherwise this is set to 0.

fields.name: quaternion
fields.description: Quaternion of the sensor orientation in vehicle body frame (w, x, y, z order, zero-rotation is 1, 0, 0, 0). Zero-rotation is along the vehicle body x-axis. This field is required if the orientation is set to MAV_SENSOR_ROTATION_CUSTOM. Set it to 0 if invalid."

fields.name: signal_quality
fields.description: Signal quality of the sensor. Specific to each sensor type, representing the relation of the signal strength with the target reflectivity, distance, size or aspect, but normalised as a percentage. 0 = unknown/unset signal quality, 1 = invalid signal, 100 = perfect signal.

messages.name: TERRAIN_REQUEST
messages.description: Request for terrain data and terrain status. See terrain protocol docs: https://mavlink.io/en/services/terrain.html

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude of SW corner of first grid

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude of SW corner of first grid

fields.name: mask
fields.description: Bitmask of requested 4x4 grids (row major 8x7 array of grids, 56 bits)

messages.name: TERRAIN_DATA
messages.description: Terrain data sent from GCS. The lat/lon and grid_spacing must be the same as a lat/lon from a TERRAIN_REQUEST. See terrain protocol docs: https://mavlink.io/en/services/terrain.html

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude of SW corner of first grid

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude of SW corner of first grid

fields.name: gridbit
fields.description: bit within the terrain request mask

messages.name: TERRAIN_CHECK
messages.description: Request that the vehicle report terrain height at the given location (expected response is a TERRAIN_REPORT). Used by GCS to check if vehicle has all terrain data needed for a mission.

messages.name: TERRAIN_REPORT
messages.description: Streamed from drone to report progress of terrain map download (initiated by TERRAIN_REQUEST), or sent as a response to a TERRAIN_CHECK request. See terrain protocol docs: https://mavlink.io/en/services/terrain.html

fields.name: spacing
fields.description: grid spacing (zero if terrain at this location unavailable)

fields.name: current_height
fields.description: Current vehicle height above lat/lon terrain height

fields.name: pending
fields.description: Number of 4x4 terrain blocks waiting to be received or read from disk

fields.name: loaded
fields.description: Number of 4x4 terrain blocks in memory

messages.name: SCALED_PRESSURE2
messages.description: Barometer readings for 2nd barometer

fields.name: temperature_press_diff
fields.description: Differential pressure temperature (0, if not available). Report values of 0 (or 1) as 1 cdegC.

messages.name: ATT_POS_MOCAP
messages.description: Motion capture attitude and position

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: q
fields.description: Attitude quaternion (w, x, y, z order, zero-rotation is 1, 0, 0, 0)

fields.name: covariance
fields.description: Row-major representation of a pose 6x6 cross-covariance matrix upper right triangle (states: x, y, z, roll, pitch, yaw; first six entries are the first ROW, next five entries are the second ROW, etc.). If unknown, assign NaN value to first element in the array.

messages.name: SET_ACTUATOR_CONTROL_TARGET
messages.description: Set the vehicle attitude and body angular rates.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: group_mlx
fields.description: Actuator group. The "_mlx" indicates this is a multi-instance message and a MAVLink parser should use this field to difference between instances.

fields.name: controls
fields.description: Actuator controls. Normed to -1..+1 where 0 is neutral position. Throttle for single rotation direction motors is 0..1, negative range for reverse direction. Standard mapping for attitude controls (group 0): (index 0-7): roll, pitch, yaw, throttle, flaps, spoilers, airbrakes, landing gear. Load a pass-through mixer to repurpose them as generic outputs.

messages.name: ACTUATOR_CONTROL_TARGET
messages.description: Set the vehicle attitude and body angular rates.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: group_mlx
fields.description: Actuator group. The "_mlx" indicates this is a multi-instance message and a MAVLink parser should use this field to difference between instances.

fields.name: controls
fields.description: Actuator controls. Normed to -1..+1 where 0 is neutral position. Throttle for single rotation direction motors is 0..1, negative range for reverse direction. Standard mapping for attitude controls (group 0): (index 0-7): roll, pitch, yaw, throttle, flaps, spoilers, airbrakes, landing gear. Load a pass-through mixer to repurpose them as generic outputs.

messages.name: ALTITUDE
messages.description: The current system altitude.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: altitude_monotonic
fields.description: This altitude measure is initialized on system boot and monotonic (it is never reset, but represents the local altitude change). The only guarantee on this field is that it will never be reset and is consistent within a flight. The recommended value for this field is the uncorrected barometric altitude at boot time. This altitude will also drift and vary between flights.

fields.name: altitude_amsl
fields.description: This altitude measure is strictly above mean sea level and might be non-monotonic (it might reset on events like GPS lock or when a new QNH value is set). It should be the altitude to which global altitude waypoints are compared to. Note that it is *not* the GPS altitude, however, most GPS modules already output MSL by default and not the WGS84 altitude.

fields.name: altitude_local
fields.description: This is the local altitude in the local coordinate frame. It is not the altitude above home, but in reference to the coordinate origin (0, 0, 0). It is up-positive.

fields.name: altitude_relative
fields.description: This is the altitude above the home position. It resets on each change of the current home position.

fields.name: altitude_terrain
fields.description: This is the altitude above terrain. It might be fed by a terrain database or an altimeter. Values smaller than -1000 should be interpreted as unknown.

fields.name: bottom_clearance
fields.description: This is not the altitude, but the clear space below the system according to the fused clearance estimate. It generally should max out at the maximum range of e.g. the laser altimeter. It is generally a moving target. A negative value indicates no measurement available.

messages.name: RESOURCE_REQUEST
messages.description: The autopilot is requesting a resource (file, binary, other type of data)

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: Request ID. This ID should be reused when sending back URI contents

fields.name: uri_type
fields.description: The type of requested URI. 0 = a file via URL. 1 = a UAVCAN binary

fields.name: uri
fields.description: The requested unique resource identifier (URI). It is not necessarily a straight domain name (depends on the URI type enum)

fields.name: transfer_type
fields.description: The way the autopilot wants to receive the URI. 0 = MAVLink FTP. 1 = binary stream.

fields.name: storage
fields.description: The storage path the autopilot wants the URI to be stored in. Will only be valid if the transfer_type has a storage associated (e.g. MAVLink FTP).

messages.name: SCALED_PRESSURE3
messages.description: Barometer readings for 3rd barometer

fields.name: temperature_press_diff
fields.description: Differential pressure temperature (0, if not available). Report values of 0 (or 1) as 1 cdegC.

messages.name: FOLLOW_TARGET
messages.description: Current motion information from a designated system

fields.name: est_capabilities
fields.description: bit positions for tracker reporting capabilities (POS = 0, VEL = 1, ACCEL = 2, ATT + RATES = 3)

fields.name: custom_state
fields.description: button states or switches of a tracker device

messages.name: CONTROL_SYSTEM_STATE
messages.description: The smoothed, monotonic system state used to feed the control loops of the system.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

messages.name: BATTERY_STATUS
messages.description: Battery information. Updates GCS with flight controller battery status. Smart batteries also use this message, but may additionally send BATTERY_INFO.

fields.name: temperature
fields.description: Temperature of the battery. INT16_MAX for unknown temperature.

fields.name: voltages
fields.description: Battery voltage of cells 1 to 10 (see voltages_ext for cells 11-14). Cells in this field above the valid cell count for this battery should have the UINT16_MAX value. If individual cell voltages are unknown or not measured for this battery, then the overall battery voltage should be filled in cell 0, with all others set to UINT16_MAX. If the voltage of the battery is greater than (UINT16_MAX - 1), then cell 0 should be set to (UINT16_MAX - 1), and cell 1 to the remaining voltage. This can be extended to multiple cells if the total voltage is greater than 2 * (UINT16_MAX - 1).

fields.name: current_battery
fields.description: Battery current, -1: autopilot does not measure the current

fields.name: current_consumed
fields.description: Consumed charge, -1: autopilot does not provide consumption estimate

fields.name: energy_consumed
fields.description: Consumed energy, -1: autopilot does not provide energy consumption estimate

fields.name: battery_remaining
fields.description: Remaining battery energy. Values: [0-100], -1: autopilot does not estimate the remaining battery.

fields.name: time_remaining
fields.description: Remaining battery time, 0: autopilot does not provide remaining battery time estimate

fields.name: charge_state
fields.description: State for extent of discharge, provided by autopilot for warning or external reactions

fields.name: voltages_ext
fields.description: Battery voltages for cells 11 to 14. Cells above the valid cell count for this battery should have a value of 0, where zero indicates not supported (note, this is different than for the voltages field and allows empty byte truncation). If the measured value is 0 then 1 should be sent instead.

fields.name: mode
fields.description: Battery mode. Default (0) is that battery mode reporting is not supported or battery is in normal-use mode.

fields.name: fault_bitmask
fields.description: Fault/health indications. These should be set when charge_state is MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_FAILED or MAV_BATTERY_CHARGE_STATE_UNHEALTHY (if not, fault reporting is not supported).

messages.name: LANDING_TARGET
messages.description: The location of a landing target. See: https://mavlink.io/en/services/landing_target.html

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: target_num
fields.description: The ID of the target if multiple targets are present

fields.name: frame
fields.description: Coordinate frame used for following fields.

fields.name: angle_x
fields.description: X-axis angular offset of the target from the center of the image

fields.name: angle_y
fields.description: Y-axis angular offset of the target from the center of the image

fields.name: distance
fields.description: Distance to the target from the vehicle

fields.name: x
fields.description: X Position of the landing target in MAV_FRAME

fields.name: y
fields.description: Y Position of the landing target in MAV_FRAME

fields.name: z
fields.description: Z Position of the landing target in MAV_FRAME

fields.name: q
fields.description: Quaternion of landing target orientation (w, x, y, z order, zero-rotation is 1, 0, 0, 0)

fields.name: position_valid
fields.description: Position fields (x, y, z, q, type) contain valid target position information (MAV_BOOL_FALSE: invalid values). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

messages.name: FENCE_STATUS
messages.description: Status of geo-fencing. Sent in extended status stream when fencing enabled.

fields.name: breach_status
fields.description: Breach status (0 if currently inside fence, 1 if outside).

fields.name: breach_mitigation
fields.description: Active action to prevent fence breach

messages.name: MAG_CAL_REPORT
messages.description: Reports results of completed compass calibration. Sent until MAG_CAL_ACK received.

messages.name: EFI_STATUS
messages.description: EFI status output

fields.name: ignition_voltage
fields.description: Supply voltage to EFI sparking system. Zero in this value means "unknown", so if the supply voltage really is zero volts use 0.0001 instead.

fields.name: fuel_pressure
fields.description: Fuel pressure. Zero in this value means "unknown", so if the fuel pressure really is zero kPa use 0.0001 instead.

messages.name: ESTIMATOR_STATUS
messages.description: Estimator status message including flags, innovation test ratios and estimated accuracies. The flags message is an integer bitmask containing information on which EKF outputs are valid. See the ESTIMATOR_STATUS_FLAGS enum definition for further information. The innovation test ratios show the magnitude of the sensor innovation divided by the innovation check threshold. Under normal operation the innovation test ratios should be below 0.5 with occasional values up to 1.0. Values greater than 1.0 should be rare under normal operation and indicate that a measurement has been rejected by the filter. The user should be notified if an innovation test ratio greater than 1.0 is recorded. Notifications for values in the range between 0.5 and 1.0 should be optional and controllable by the user.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Bitmap indicating which EKF outputs are valid.

fields.name: hagl_ratio
fields.description: Height above terrain innovation test ratio

fields.name: pos_horiz_accuracy
fields.description: Horizontal position 1-STD accuracy relative to the EKF local origin

fields.name: pos_vert_accuracy
fields.description: Vertical position 1-STD accuracy relative to the EKF local origin

messages.name: WIND_COV
messages.description: Wind estimate from vehicle. Note that despite the name, this message does not actually contain any covariances but instead variability and accuracy fields in terms of standard deviation (1-STD).

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: wind_x
fields.description: Wind in North (NED) direction (NAN if unknown)

fields.name: wind_y
fields.description: Wind in East (NED) direction (NAN if unknown)

fields.name: wind_z
fields.description: Wind in down (NED) direction (NAN if unknown)

fields.name: var_horiz
fields.description: Variability of wind in XY, 1-STD estimated from a 1 Hz lowpassed wind estimate (NAN if unknown)

fields.name: var_vert
fields.description: Variability of wind in Z, 1-STD estimated from a 1 Hz lowpassed wind estimate (NAN if unknown)

fields.name: wind_alt
fields.description: Altitude (MSL) that this measurement was taken at (NAN if unknown)

messages.name: GPS_INPUT
messages.description: GPS sensor input message. This is a raw sensor value sent by the GPS. This is NOT the global position estimate of the system.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: gps_id
fields.description: ID of the GPS for multiple GPS inputs

fields.name: ignore_flags
fields.description: Bitmap indicating which GPS input flags fields to ignore. All other fields must be provided.

fields.name: time_week_ms
fields.description: GPS time (from start of GPS week)

fields.name: fix_type
fields.description: 0-1: no fix, 2: 2D fix, 3: 3D fix. 4: 3D with DGPS. 5: 3D with RTK

fields.name: hdop
fields.description: GPS HDOP horizontal dilution of position (unitless). If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX

fields.name: vdop
fields.description: GPS VDOP vertical dilution of position (unitless). If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX

fields.name: vn
fields.description: GPS velocity in north direction in earth-fixed NED frame

fields.name: ve
fields.description: GPS velocity in east direction in earth-fixed NED frame

fields.name: vd
fields.description: GPS velocity in down direction in earth-fixed NED frame

fields.name: yaw
fields.description: Yaw of vehicle relative to Earth's North, zero means not available, use 36000 for north

messages.name: GPS_RTCM_DATA
messages.description: RTCM message for injecting into the onboard GPS (used for DGPS)

fields.name: flags
fields.description: LSB: 1 means message is fragmented, next 2 bits are the fragment ID, the remaining 5 bits are used for the sequence ID. Messages are only to be flushed to the GPS when the entire message has been reconstructed on the autopilot. The fragment ID specifies which order the fragments should be assembled into a buffer, while the sequence ID is used to detect a mismatch between different buffers. The buffer is considered fully reconstructed when either all 4 fragments are present, or all the fragments before the first fragment with a non full payload is received. This management is used to ensure that normal GPS operation doesn't corrupt RTCM data, and to recover from a unreliable transport delivery order.

messages.name: HIGH_LATENCY
messages.description: Message appropriate for high latency connections like Iridium

fields.name: custom_mode
fields.description: A bitfield for use for autopilot-specific flags.

fields.name: landed_state
fields.description: The landed state. Is set to MAV_LANDED_STATE_UNDEFINED if landed state is unknown.

fields.name: altitude_sp

fields.name: gps_nsat
fields.description: Number of satellites visible. If unknown, set to UINT8_MAX

fields.name: temperature_air

fields.name: failsafe
fields.description: failsafe (each bit represents a failsafe where 0=ok, 1=failsafe active (bit0:RC, bit1:batt, bit2:GPS, bit3:GCS, bit4:fence)

messages.name: HIGH_LATENCY2
messages.description: Message appropriate for high latency connections like Iridium (version 2)

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Timestamp (milliseconds since boot or Unix epoch)

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the MAV (quadrotor, helicopter, etc.)

fields.name: autopilot
fields.description: Autopilot type / class. Use MAV_AUTOPILOT_INVALID for components that are not flight controllers.

fields.name: custom_mode
fields.description: A bitfield for use for autopilot-specific flags (2 byte version).

fields.name: target_distance
fields.description: Distance to target waypoint or position

fields.name: eph
fields.description: Maximum error horizontal position since last message

fields.name: epv
fields.description: Maximum error vertical position since last message

fields.name: climb_rate
fields.description: Maximum climb rate magnitude since last message

fields.name: battery

messages.name: VIBRATION
messages.description: Vibration levels and accelerometer clipping

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

messages.name: HOME_POSITION
messages.description: Contains the home position. The home position is the default position that the system will return to and land on. The position must be set automatically by the system during the takeoff, and may also be explicitly set using MAV_CMD_DO_SET_HOME. The global and local positions encode the position in the respective coordinate frames, while the q parameter encodes the orientation of the surface. Under normal conditions it describes the heading and terrain slope, which can be used by the aircraft to adjust the approach. The approach 3D vector describes the point to which the system should fly in normal flight mode and then perform a landing sequence along the vector. Note: this message can be requested by sending the MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE with param1=242 (or the deprecated MAV_CMD_GET_HOME_POSITION command).

fields.name: x
fields.description: Local X position of this position in the local coordinate frame (NED)

fields.name: y
fields.description: Local Y position of this position in the local coordinate frame (NED)

fields.name: z
fields.description: Local Z position of this position in the local coordinate frame (NED: positive "down")

fields.name: q
fields.description: Quaternion indicating world-to-surface-normal and heading transformation of the takeoff position. Used to indicate the heading and slope of the ground. All fields should be set to NaN if an accurate quaternion for both heading and surface slope cannot be supplied.

fields.name: approach_x
fields.description: Local X position of the end of the approach vector. Multicopters should set this position based on their takeoff path. Grass-landing fixed wing aircraft should set it the same way as multicopters. Runway-landing fixed wing aircraft should set it to the opposite direction of the takeoff, assuming the takeoff happened from the threshold / touchdown zone.

fields.name: approach_y
fields.description: Local Y position of the end of the approach vector. Multicopters should set this position based on their takeoff path. Grass-landing fixed wing aircraft should set it the same way as multicopters. Runway-landing fixed wing aircraft should set it to the opposite direction of the takeoff, assuming the takeoff happened from the threshold / touchdown zone.

fields.name: approach_z
fields.description: Local Z position of the end of the approach vector. Multicopters should set this position based on their takeoff path. Grass-landing fixed wing aircraft should set it the same way as multicopters. Runway-landing fixed wing aircraft should set it to the opposite direction of the takeoff, assuming the takeoff happened from the threshold / touchdown zone.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

messages.name: SET_HOME_POSITION
messages.description: Sets the home position. The home position is the default position that the system will return to and land on. The position is set automatically by the system during the takeoff (and may also be set using this message). The global and local positions encode the position in the respective coordinate frames, while the q parameter encodes the orientation of the surface. Under normal conditions it describes the heading and terrain slope, which can be used by the aircraft to adjust the approach. The approach 3D vector describes the point to which the system should fly in normal flight mode and then perform a landing sequence along the vector. Note: the current home position may be emitted in a HOME_POSITION message on request (using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE with param1=242).

fields.name: x
fields.description: Local X position of this position in the local coordinate frame (NED)

fields.name: y
fields.description: Local Y position of this position in the local coordinate frame (NED)

fields.name: z
fields.description: Local Z position of this position in the local coordinate frame (NED: positive "down")

fields.name: q
fields.description: World to surface normal and heading transformation of the takeoff position. Used to indicate the heading and slope of the ground

fields.name: approach_x
fields.description: Local X position of the end of the approach vector. Multicopters should set this position based on their takeoff path. Grass-landing fixed wing aircraft should set it the same way as multicopters. Runway-landing fixed wing aircraft should set it to the opposite direction of the takeoff, assuming the takeoff happened from the threshold / touchdown zone.

fields.name: approach_y
fields.description: Local Y position of the end of the approach vector. Multicopters should set this position based on their takeoff path. Grass-landing fixed wing aircraft should set it the same way as multicopters. Runway-landing fixed wing aircraft should set it to the opposite direction of the takeoff, assuming the takeoff happened from the threshold / touchdown zone.

fields.name: approach_z
fields.description: Local Z position of the end of the approach vector. Multicopters should set this position based on their takeoff path. Grass-landing fixed wing aircraft should set it the same way as multicopters. Runway-landing fixed wing aircraft should set it to the opposite direction of the takeoff, assuming the takeoff happened from the threshold / touchdown zone.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

messages.name: MESSAGE_INTERVAL
messages.description: The interval between messages for a particular MAVLink message ID. This message is sent in response to the MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE command with param1=244 (this message) and param2=message_id (the id of the message for which the interval is required). It may also be sent in response to MAV_CMD_GET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL. This interface replaces DATA_STREAM.

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: The ID of the requested MAVLink message. v1.0 is limited to 254 messages.

fields.name: interval_us
fields.description: The interval between two messages. A value of -1 indicates this stream is disabled, 0 indicates it is not available, > 0 indicates the interval at which it is sent.

messages.name: EXTENDED_SYS_STATE
messages.description: Provides state for additional features

fields.name: vtol_state
fields.description: The VTOL state if applicable. Is set to MAV_VTOL_STATE_UNDEFINED if UAV is not in VTOL configuration.

fields.name: landed_state
fields.description: The landed state. Is set to MAV_LANDED_STATE_UNDEFINED if landed state is unknown.

messages.name: ADSB_VEHICLE
messages.description: The location and information of an ADSB vehicle

fields.name: ver_velocity
fields.description: The vertical velocity. Positive is up

fields.name: tslc
fields.description: Time since last communication in seconds

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Bitmap to indicate various statuses including valid data fields

fields.name: squawk
fields.description: Squawk code. Note that the code is in decimal: e.g. 7700 (general emergency) is encoded as binary 0b0001_1110_0001_0100, not(!) as 0b0000_111_111_000_000

messages.name: COLLISION
messages.description: Information about a potential collision

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier, domain based on src field

fields.name: action
fields.description: Action that is being taken to avoid this collision

fields.name: threat_level
fields.description: How concerned the aircraft is about this collision

fields.name: altitude_minimum_delta
fields.description: Closest vertical distance between vehicle and object

fields.name: horizontal_minimum_delta
fields.description: Closest horizontal distance between vehicle and object

messages.name: V2_EXTENSION
messages.description: Message implementing parts of the V2 payload specs in V1 frames for transitional support.

fields.name: message_type
fields.description: A code that identifies the software component that understands this message (analogous to USB device classes or mime type strings). If this code is less than 32768, it is considered a 'registered' protocol extension and the corresponding entry should be added to https://github.com/mavlink/mavlink/definition_files/extension_message_ids.xml. Software creators can register blocks of message IDs as needed (useful for GCS specific metadata, etc...). Message_types greater than 32767 are considered local experiments and should not be checked in to any widely distributed codebase.

fields.name: payload
fields.description: Variable length payload. The length must be encoded in the payload as part of the message_type protocol, e.g. by including the length as payload data, or by terminating the payload data with a non-zero marker. This is required in order to reconstruct zero-terminated payloads that are (or otherwise would be) trimmed by MAVLink 2 empty-byte truncation. The entire content of the payload block is opaque unless you understand the encoding message_type. The particular encoding used can be extension specific and might not always be documented as part of the MAVLink specification.

messages.name: MEMORY_VECT
messages.description: Send raw controller memory. The use of this message is discouraged for normal packets, but a quite efficient way for testing new messages and getting experimental debug output.

fields.name: address
fields.description: Starting address of the debug variables

fields.name: ver
fields.description: Version code of the type variable. 0=unknown, type ignored and assumed int16_t. 1=as below

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type code of the memory variables. for ver = 1: 0=16 x int16_t, 1=16 x uint16_t, 2=16 x Q15, 3=16 x 1Q14

messages.name: DEBUG_VECT
messages.description: To debug something using a named 3D vector.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

messages.name: NAMED_VALUE_FLOAT
messages.description: Send a key-value pair as float. The use of this message is discouraged for normal packets, but a quite efficient way for testing new messages and getting experimental debug output.

messages.name: NAMED_VALUE_INT
messages.description: Send a key-value pair as integer. The use of this message is discouraged for normal packets, but a quite efficient way for testing new messages and getting experimental debug output.

messages.name: STATUSTEXT
messages.description: Status text message. These messages are printed in yellow in the COMM console of QGroundControl. WARNING: They consume quite some bandwidth, so use only for important status and error messages. If implemented wisely, these messages are buffered on the MCU and sent only at a limited rate (e.g. 10 Hz).

fields.name: severity
fields.description: Severity of status. Relies on the definitions within RFC-5424.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Status text message, without null termination character. UTF-8 encoded.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique (opaque) identifier for this statustext message. May be used to reassemble a logical long-statustext message from a sequence of chunks. A value of zero indicates this is the only chunk in the sequence and the message can be emitted immediately.

fields.name: chunk_seq
fields.description: This chunk's sequence number; indexing is from zero. Any null character in the text field is taken to mean this was the last chunk.

messages.name: DEBUG
messages.description: Send a debug value. The index is used to discriminate between values. These values show up in the plot of QGroundControl as DEBUG N.

messages.name: SETUP_SIGNING
messages.description: Setup a MAVLink2 signing key. If called with secret_key of all zero and zero initial_timestamp will disable signing

messages.name: BUTTON_CHANGE
messages.description: Report button state change.

fields.name: last_change_ms
fields.description: Time of last change of button state.

messages.name: PLAY_TUNE
messages.description: Control vehicle tone generation (buzzer).

messages.name: CAMERA_INFORMATION
messages.description: Information about a camera. Can be requested with a MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE command.

fields.name: firmware_version
fields.description: Version of the camera firmware, encoded as: `(Dev & 0xff) << 24 + (Patch & 0xff) << 16 + (Minor & 0xff) << 8 + (Major & 0xff)`. Use 0 if not known.

fields.name: focal_length
fields.description: Focal length. Use NaN if not known.

fields.name: sensor_size_h
fields.description: Image sensor size horizontal. Use NaN if not known.

fields.name: sensor_size_v
fields.description: Image sensor size vertical. Use NaN if not known.

fields.name: resolution_h
fields.description: Horizontal image resolution. Use 0 if not known.

fields.name: resolution_v
fields.description: Vertical image resolution. Use 0 if not known.

fields.name: lens_id
fields.description: Reserved for a lens ID. Use 0 if not known.

fields.name: cam_definition_version
fields.description: Camera definition version (iteration). Use 0 if not known.

fields.name: cam_definition_uri
fields.description: Camera definition URI (if any, otherwise only basic functions will be available). HTTP- (http://) and MAVLink FTP- (mavlinkftp://) formatted URIs are allowed (and both must be supported by any GCS that implements the Camera Protocol). The definition file may be xz compressed, which will be indicated by the file extension .xml.xz (a GCS that implements the protocol must support decompressing the file). The string needs to be zero terminated. Use a zero-length string if not known.

fields.name: gimbal_device_id
fields.description: Gimbal id of a gimbal associated with this camera. This is the component id of the gimbal device, or 1-6 for non mavlink gimbals. Use 0 if no gimbal is associated with the camera.

fields.name: camera_device_id
fields.description: Camera id of a non-MAVLink camera attached to an autopilot (1-6). 0 if the component is a MAVLink camera (with its own component id).

messages.name: CAMERA_SETTINGS
messages.description: Settings of a camera. Can be requested with a MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE command.

fields.name: zoomLevel
fields.description: Current zoom level as a percentage of the full range (0.0 to 100.0, NaN if not known)

fields.name: focusLevel
fields.description: Current focus level as a percentage of the full range (0.0 to 100.0, NaN if not known)

fields.name: camera_device_id
fields.description: Camera id of a non-MAVLink camera attached to an autopilot (1-6). 0 if the component is a MAVLink camera (with its own component id).

messages.name: STORAGE_INFORMATION
messages.description: Information about a storage medium. This message is sent in response to a request with MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE and whenever the status of the storage changes (STORAGE_STATUS). Use MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE.param2 to indicate the index/id of requested storage: 0 for all, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.

fields.name: storage_id
fields.description: Storage ID (1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

fields.name: total_capacity
fields.description: Total capacity. If storage is not ready (STORAGE_STATUS_READY) value will be ignored.

fields.name: used_capacity
fields.description: Used capacity. If storage is not ready (STORAGE_STATUS_READY) value will be ignored.

fields.name: available_capacity
fields.description: Available storage capacity. If storage is not ready (STORAGE_STATUS_READY) value will be ignored.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Textual storage name to be used in UI (microSD 1, Internal Memory, etc.) This is a NULL terminated string. If it is exactly 32 characters long, add a terminating NULL. If this string is empty, the generic type is shown to the user.

fields.name: storage_usage
fields.description: Flags indicating whether this instance is preferred storage for photos, videos, etc. Note: Implementations should initially set the flags on the system-default storage id used for saving media (if possible/supported). This setting can then be overridden using MAV_CMD_SET_STORAGE_USAGE. If the media usage flags are not set, a GCS may assume storage ID 1 is the default storage for all media types.

messages.name: CAMERA_CAPTURE_STATUS
messages.description: Information about the status of a capture. Can be requested with a MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE command.

fields.name: image_status
fields.description: Current status of image capturing (0: idle, 1: capture in progress, 2: interval set but idle, 3: interval set and capture in progress)

fields.name: video_status
fields.description: Current status of video capturing (0: idle, 1: capture in progress)

fields.name: recording_time_ms
fields.description: Elapsed time since recording started (0: Not supported/available). A GCS should compute recording time and use non-zero values of this field to correct any discrepancy.

fields.name: image_count
fields.description: Total number of images captured ('forever', or until reset using MAV_CMD_STORAGE_FORMAT).

fields.name: camera_device_id
fields.description: Camera id of a non-MAVLink camera attached to an autopilot (1-6). 0 if the component is a MAVLink camera (with its own component id).

messages.name: CAMERA_IMAGE_CAPTURED
messages.description: Information about a captured image. This is emitted every time a message is captured. MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE can be used to (re)request this message for a specific sequence number or range of sequence numbers: MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE.param2 indicates the sequence number the first image to send, or set to -1 to send the message for all sequence numbers. MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE.param3 is used to specify a range of messages to send: set to 0 (default) to send just the the message for the sequence number in param 2, set to -1 to send the message for the sequence number in param 2 and all the following sequence numbers, set to the sequence number of the final message in the range.

fields.name: time_utc
fields.description: Timestamp (time since UNIX epoch) in UTC. 0 for unknown.

fields.name: camera_id
fields.description: Camera id of a non-MAVLink camera attached to an autopilot (1-6). 0 if the component is a MAVLink camera (with its own component id). Field name is usually camera_device_id.

fields.name: q
fields.description: Quaternion of camera orientation (w, x, y, z order, zero-rotation is 1, 0, 0, 0)

fields.name: image_index
fields.description: Zero based index of this image (i.e. a new image will have index CAMERA_CAPTURE_STATUS.image count -1)

fields.name: capture_result
fields.description: Image was captured successfully (MAV_BOOL_TRUE). Values not equal to 0 or 1 are invalid.

fields.name: file_url
fields.description: URL of image taken. Either local storage or http://foo.jpg if camera provides an HTTP interface.

messages.name: FLIGHT_INFORMATION
messages.description: Flight information. This includes time since boot for arm, takeoff, and land, and a flight number. Takeoff and landing values reset to zero on arm. This can be requested using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE. Note, some fields are misnamed - timestamps are from boot (not UTC) and the flight_uuid is a sequence number.

fields.name: arming_time_utc
fields.description: Timestamp at arming (since system boot). Set to 0 on boot. Set value on arming. Note, field is misnamed UTC.

fields.name: takeoff_time_utc
fields.description: Timestamp at takeoff (since system boot). Set to 0 at boot and on arming. Note, field is misnamed UTC.

fields.name: flight_uuid
fields.description: Flight number. Note, field is misnamed UUID.

fields.name: landing_time
fields.description: Timestamp at landing (in ms since system boot). Set to 0 at boot and on arming.

messages.name: MOUNT_ORIENTATION
messages.description: Orientation of a mount

fields.name: roll
fields.description: Roll in global frame (set to NaN for invalid).

fields.name: pitch
fields.description: Pitch in global frame (set to NaN for invalid).

fields.name: yaw
fields.description: Yaw relative to vehicle (set to NaN for invalid).

fields.name: yaw_absolute
fields.description: Yaw in absolute frame relative to Earth's North, north is 0 (set to NaN for invalid).

messages.name: LOGGING_DATA
messages.description: A message containing logged data (see also MAV_CMD_LOGGING_START)

fields.name: first_message_offset
fields.description: offset into data where first message starts. This can be used for recovery, when a previous message got lost (set to UINT8_MAX if no start exists).

messages.name: LOGGING_DATA_ACKED
messages.description: A message containing logged data which requires a LOGGING_ACK to be sent back

fields.name: first_message_offset
fields.description: offset into data where first message starts. This can be used for recovery, when a previous message got lost (set to UINT8_MAX if no start exists).

messages.name: LOGGING_ACK
messages.description: An ack for a LOGGING_DATA_ACKED message

fields.name: sequence
fields.description: sequence number (must match the one in LOGGING_DATA_ACKED)

messages.name: VIDEO_STREAM_INFORMATION
messages.description: Information about video stream. It may be requested using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE, where param2 indicates the video stream id: 0 for all streams, 1 for first, 2 for second, etc.

fields.name: stream_id
fields.description: Video Stream ID (1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

fields.name: uri
fields.description: Video stream URI (TCP or RTSP URI ground station should connect to) or port number (UDP port ground station should listen to).

fields.name: camera_device_id
fields.description: Camera id of a non-MAVLink camera attached to an autopilot (1-6). 0 if the component is a MAVLink camera (with its own component id).

messages.name: VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS
messages.description: Information about the status of a video stream. It may be requested using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE.

fields.name: stream_id
fields.description: Video Stream ID (1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

fields.name: camera_device_id
fields.description: Camera id of a non-MAVLink camera attached to an autopilot (1-6). 0 if the component is a MAVLink camera (with its own component id).

messages.name: CAMERA_FOV_STATUS
messages.description: Information about the field of view of a camera. Can be requested with a MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE command.

fields.name: lat_image
fields.description: Latitude of center of image (INT32_MAX if unknown, INT32_MIN if at infinity, not intersecting with horizon).

fields.name: lon_image
fields.description: Longitude of center of image (INT32_MAX if unknown, INT32_MIN if at infinity, not intersecting with horizon).

fields.name: alt_image
fields.description: Altitude (MSL) of center of image (INT32_MAX if unknown, INT32_MIN if at infinity, not intersecting with horizon).

fields.name: q
fields.description: Quaternion of camera orientation (w, x, y, z order, zero-rotation is 1, 0, 0, 0)

fields.name: hfov
fields.description: Horizontal field of view (NaN if unknown).

fields.name: vfov
fields.description: Vertical field of view (NaN if unknown).

fields.name: camera_device_id
fields.description: Camera id of a non-MAVLink camera attached to an autopilot (1-6). 0 if the component is a MAVLink camera (with its own component id).

messages.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_IMAGE_STATUS
messages.description: Camera tracking status, sent while in active tracking. Use MAV_CMD_SET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL to define message interval.

fields.name: point_x
fields.description: Current tracked point x value if CAMERA_TRACKING_MODE_POINT (normalized 0..1, 0 is left, 1 is right), NAN if unknown

fields.name: point_y
fields.description: Current tracked point y value if CAMERA_TRACKING_MODE_POINT (normalized 0..1, 0 is top, 1 is bottom), NAN if unknown

fields.name: radius
fields.description: Current tracked radius if CAMERA_TRACKING_MODE_POINT (normalized 0..1, 0 is image left, 1 is image right), NAN if unknown

fields.name: rec_top_x
fields.description: Current tracked rectangle top x value if CAMERA_TRACKING_MODE_RECTANGLE (normalized 0..1, 0 is left, 1 is right), NAN if unknown

fields.name: rec_top_y
fields.description: Current tracked rectangle top y value if CAMERA_TRACKING_MODE_RECTANGLE (normalized 0..1, 0 is top, 1 is bottom), NAN if unknown

fields.name: rec_bottom_x
fields.description: Current tracked rectangle bottom x value if CAMERA_TRACKING_MODE_RECTANGLE (normalized 0..1, 0 is left, 1 is right), NAN if unknown

fields.name: rec_bottom_y
fields.description: Current tracked rectangle bottom y value if CAMERA_TRACKING_MODE_RECTANGLE (normalized 0..1, 0 is top, 1 is bottom), NAN if unknown

fields.name: camera_device_id
fields.description: Camera id of a non-MAVLink camera attached to an autopilot (1-6). 0 if the component is a MAVLink camera (with its own component id).

messages.name: CAMERA_TRACKING_GEO_STATUS
messages.description: Camera tracking status, sent while in active tracking. Use MAV_CMD_SET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL to define message interval.

fields.name: vel_n
fields.description: North velocity of tracked object. NAN if unknown

fields.name: vel_e
fields.description: East velocity of tracked object. NAN if unknown

fields.name: vel_d
fields.description: Down velocity of tracked object. NAN if unknown

fields.name: dist
fields.description: Distance between camera and tracked object. NAN if unknown

fields.name: hdg
fields.description: Heading in radians, in NED. NAN if unknown

fields.name: hdg_acc
fields.description: Accuracy of heading, in NED. NAN if unknown

fields.name: camera_device_id
fields.description: Camera id of a non-MAVLink camera attached to an autopilot (1-6). 0 if the component is a MAVLink camera (with its own component id).

messages.name: CAMERA_THERMAL_RANGE
messages.description: Camera absolute thermal range. This can be streamed when the associated VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS `flag` field bit VIDEO_STREAM_STATUS_FLAGS_THERMAL_RANGE_ENABLED is set, but a GCS may choose to only request it for the current active stream. Use MAV_CMD_SET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL to define message interval (param3 indicates the stream id of the current camera, or 0 for all streams, param4 indicates the target camera_device_id for autopilot-attached cameras or 0 for MAVLink cameras).

fields.name: stream_id
fields.description: Video Stream ID (1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)

fields.name: camera_device_id
fields.description: Camera id of a non-MAVLink camera attached to an autopilot (1-6). 0 if the component is a MAVLink camera (with its own component id).

fields.name: max_point_x
fields.description: Temperature max point x value (normalized 0..1, 0 is left, 1 is right), NAN if unknown.

fields.name: max_point_y
fields.description: Temperature max point y value (normalized 0..1, 0 is top, 1 is bottom), NAN if unknown.

fields.name: min_point_x
fields.description: Temperature min point x value (normalized 0..1, 0 is left, 1 is right), NAN if unknown.

fields.name: min_point_y
fields.description: Temperature min point y value (normalized 0..1, 0 is top, 1 is bottom), NAN if unknown.

messages.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_INFORMATION
messages.description: Information about a high level gimbal manager. This message should be requested by a ground station using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE.

fields.name: gimbal_device_id
fields.description: Gimbal device ID that this gimbal manager is responsible for. Component ID of gimbal device (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal).

fields.name: roll_min
fields.description: Minimum hardware roll angle (positive: rolling to the right, negative: rolling to the left)

fields.name: roll_max
fields.description: Maximum hardware roll angle (positive: rolling to the right, negative: rolling to the left)

fields.name: pitch_min
fields.description: Minimum pitch angle (positive: up, negative: down)

fields.name: pitch_max
fields.description: Maximum pitch angle (positive: up, negative: down)

fields.name: yaw_min
fields.description: Minimum yaw angle (positive: to the right, negative: to the left)

fields.name: yaw_max
fields.description: Maximum yaw angle (positive: to the right, negative: to the left)

messages.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_STATUS
messages.description: Current status about a high level gimbal manager. This message should be broadcast at a low regular rate (e.g. 5Hz).

fields.name: flags
fields.description: High level gimbal manager flags currently applied.

fields.name: gimbal_device_id
fields.description: Gimbal device ID that this gimbal manager is responsible for. Component ID of gimbal device (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal).

fields.name: primary_control_sysid
fields.description: System ID of MAVLink component with primary control, 0 for none.

fields.name: primary_control_compid
fields.description: Component ID of MAVLink component with primary control, 0 for none.

fields.name: secondary_control_sysid
fields.description: System ID of MAVLink component with secondary control, 0 for none.

fields.name: secondary_control_compid
fields.description: Component ID of MAVLink component with secondary control, 0 for none.

messages.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_SET_ATTITUDE
messages.description: High level message to control a gimbal's attitude. This message is to be sent to the gimbal manager (e.g. from a ground station). Angles and rates can be set to NaN according to use case.

fields.name: flags
fields.description: High level gimbal manager flags to use.

fields.name: gimbal_device_id
fields.description: Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 for all gimbal device components. Send command multiple times for more than one gimbal (but not all gimbals).

fields.name: q
fields.description: Quaternion components, w, x, y, z (1 0 0 0 is the null-rotation, the frame is depends on whether the flag GIMBAL_MANAGER_FLAGS_YAW_LOCK is set)

fields.name: angular_velocity_x
fields.description: X component of angular velocity, positive is rolling to the right, NaN to be ignored.

fields.name: angular_velocity_y
fields.description: Y component of angular velocity, positive is pitching up, NaN to be ignored.

fields.name: angular_velocity_z
fields.description: Z component of angular velocity, positive is yawing to the right, NaN to be ignored.

messages.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_INFORMATION
messages.description: Information about a low level gimbal. This message should be requested by the gimbal manager or a ground station using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE. The maximum angles and rates are the limits by hardware. However, the limits by software used are likely different/smaller and dependent on mode/settings/etc..

fields.name: custom_name
fields.description: Custom name of the gimbal given to it by the user.

fields.name: firmware_version
fields.description: Version of the gimbal firmware, encoded as: `(Dev & 0xff) << 24 + (Patch & 0xff) << 16 + (Minor & 0xff) << 8 + (Major & 0xff)`.

fields.name: hardware_version
fields.description: Version of the gimbal hardware, encoded as: `(Dev & 0xff) << 24 + (Patch & 0xff) << 16 + (Minor & 0xff) << 8 + (Major & 0xff)`.

fields.name: uid
fields.description: UID of gimbal hardware (0 if unknown).

fields.name: custom_cap_flags
fields.description: Bitmap for use for gimbal-specific capability flags.

fields.name: roll_min
fields.description: Minimum hardware roll angle (positive: rolling to the right, negative: rolling to the left). NAN if unknown.

fields.name: roll_max
fields.description: Maximum hardware roll angle (positive: rolling to the right, negative: rolling to the left). NAN if unknown.

fields.name: pitch_min
fields.description: Minimum hardware pitch angle (positive: up, negative: down). NAN if unknown.

fields.name: pitch_max
fields.description: Maximum hardware pitch angle (positive: up, negative: down). NAN if unknown.

fields.name: yaw_min
fields.description: Minimum hardware yaw angle (positive: to the right, negative: to the left). NAN if unknown.

fields.name: yaw_max
fields.description: Maximum hardware yaw angle (positive: to the right, negative: to the left). NAN if unknown.

fields.name: gimbal_device_id
fields.description: This field is to be used if the gimbal manager and the gimbal device are the same component and hence have the same component ID. This field is then set to a number between 1-6. If the component ID is separate, this field is not required and must be set to 0.

messages.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_SET_ATTITUDE
messages.description: Low level message to control a gimbal device's attitude. This message is to be sent from the gimbal manager to the gimbal device component. The quaternion and angular velocities can be set to NaN according to use case. For the angles encoded in the quaternion and the angular velocities holds: If the flag GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_VEHICLE_FRAME is set, then they are relative to the vehicle heading (vehicle frame). If the flag GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME is set, then they are relative to absolute North (earth frame). If neither of these flags are set, then (for backwards compatibility) it holds: If the flag GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_LOCK is set, then they are relative to absolute North (earth frame), else they are relative to the vehicle heading (vehicle frame). Setting both GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_VEHICLE_FRAME and GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME is not allowed. These rules are to ensure backwards compatibility. New implementations should always set either GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_VEHICLE_FRAME or GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME.

fields.name: q
fields.description: Quaternion components, w, x, y, z (1 0 0 0 is the null-rotation). The frame is described in the message description. Set fields to NaN to be ignored.

fields.name: angular_velocity_x
fields.description: X component of angular velocity (positive: rolling to the right). The frame is described in the message description. NaN to be ignored.

fields.name: angular_velocity_y
fields.description: Y component of angular velocity (positive: pitching up). The frame is described in the message description. NaN to be ignored.

fields.name: angular_velocity_z
fields.description: Z component of angular velocity (positive: yawing to the right). The frame is described in the message description. NaN to be ignored.

messages.name: GIMBAL_DEVICE_ATTITUDE_STATUS
messages.description: Message reporting the status of a gimbal device. This message should be broadcast by a gimbal device component at a low regular rate (e.g. 5 Hz). For the angles encoded in the quaternion and the angular velocities holds: If the flag GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_VEHICLE_FRAME is set, then they are relative to the vehicle heading (vehicle frame). If the flag GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME is set, then they are relative to absolute North (earth frame). If neither of these flags are set, then (for backwards compatibility) it holds: If the flag GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_LOCK is set, then they are relative to absolute North (earth frame), else they are relative to the vehicle heading (vehicle frame). Other conditions of the flags are not allowed. The quaternion and angular velocities in the other frame can be calculated from delta_yaw and delta_yaw_velocity as q_earth = q_delta_yaw * q_vehicle and w_earth = w_delta_yaw_velocity + w_vehicle (if not NaN). If neither the GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_VEHICLE_FRAME nor the GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME flag is set, then (for backwards compatibility) the data in the delta_yaw and delta_yaw_velocity fields are to be ignored. New implementations should always set either GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_VEHICLE_FRAME or GIMBAL_DEVICE_FLAGS_YAW_IN_EARTH_FRAME, and always should set delta_yaw and delta_yaw_velocity either to the proper value or NaN.

fields.name: q
fields.description: Quaternion components, w, x, y, z (1 0 0 0 is the null-rotation). The frame is described in the message description.

fields.name: angular_velocity_x
fields.description: X component of angular velocity (positive: rolling to the right). The frame is described in the message description. NaN if unknown.

fields.name: angular_velocity_y
fields.description: Y component of angular velocity (positive: pitching up). The frame is described in the message description. NaN if unknown.

fields.name: angular_velocity_z
fields.description: Z component of angular velocity (positive: yawing to the right). The frame is described in the message description. NaN if unknown.

fields.name: delta_yaw
fields.description: Yaw angle relating the quaternions in earth and body frames (see message description). NaN if unknown.

fields.name: delta_yaw_velocity
fields.description: Yaw angular velocity relating the angular velocities in earth and body frames (see message description). NaN if unknown.

fields.name: gimbal_device_id
fields.description: This field is to be used if the gimbal manager and the gimbal device are the same component and hence have the same component ID. This field is then set a number between 1-6. If the component ID is separate, this field is not required and must be set to 0.

messages.name: AUTOPILOT_STATE_FOR_GIMBAL_DEVICE
messages.description: Low level message containing autopilot state relevant for a gimbal device. This message is to be sent from the autopilot to the gimbal device component. The data of this message are for the gimbal device's estimator corrections, in particular horizon compensation, as well as indicates autopilot control intentions, e.g. feed forward angular control in the z-axis.

fields.name: q
fields.description: Quaternion components of autopilot attitude: w, x, y, z (1 0 0 0 is the null-rotation, Hamilton convention).

fields.name: q_estimated_delay_us
fields.description: Estimated delay of the attitude data. 0 if unknown.

fields.name: vx
fields.description: X Speed in NED (North, East, Down). NAN if unknown.

fields.name: vy
fields.description: Y Speed in NED (North, East, Down). NAN if unknown.

fields.name: vz
fields.description: Z Speed in NED (North, East, Down). NAN if unknown.

fields.name: v_estimated_delay_us
fields.description: Estimated delay of the speed data. 0 if unknown.

fields.name: feed_forward_angular_velocity_z
fields.description: Feed forward Z component of angular velocity (positive: yawing to the right). NaN to be ignored. This is to indicate if the autopilot is actively yawing.

fields.name: estimator_status
fields.description: Bitmap indicating which estimator outputs are valid.

fields.name: landed_state
fields.description: The landed state. Is set to MAV_LANDED_STATE_UNDEFINED if landed state is unknown.

fields.name: angular_velocity_z
fields.description: Z component of angular velocity in NED (North, East, Down). NaN if unknown.

messages.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_SET_PITCHYAW
messages.description: Set gimbal manager pitch and yaw angles (high rate message). This message is to be sent to the gimbal manager (e.g. from a ground station) and will be ignored by gimbal devices. Angles and rates can be set to NaN according to use case. Use MAV_CMD_DO_GIMBAL_MANAGER_PITCHYAW for low-rate adjustments that require confirmation.

fields.name: flags
fields.description: High level gimbal manager flags to use.

fields.name: gimbal_device_id
fields.description: Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 for all gimbal device components. Send command multiple times for more than one gimbal (but not all gimbals).

fields.name: pitch
fields.description: Pitch angle (positive: up, negative: down, NaN to be ignored).

fields.name: yaw
fields.description: Yaw angle (positive: to the right, negative: to the left, NaN to be ignored).

fields.name: pitch_rate
fields.description: Pitch angular rate (positive: up, negative: down, NaN to be ignored).

fields.name: yaw_rate
fields.description: Yaw angular rate (positive: to the right, negative: to the left, NaN to be ignored).

messages.name: GIMBAL_MANAGER_SET_MANUAL_CONTROL
messages.description: High level message to control a gimbal manually. The angles or angular rates are unitless; the actual rates will depend on internal gimbal manager settings/configuration (e.g. set by parameters). This message is to be sent to the gimbal manager (e.g. from a ground station). Angles and rates can be set to NaN according to use case.

fields.name: gimbal_device_id
fields.description: Component ID of gimbal device to address (or 1-6 for non-MAVLink gimbal), 0 for all gimbal device components. Send command multiple times for more than one gimbal (but not all gimbals).

fields.name: pitch
fields.description: Pitch angle unitless (-1..1, positive: up, negative: down, NaN to be ignored).

fields.name: yaw
fields.description: Yaw angle unitless (-1..1, positive: to the right, negative: to the left, NaN to be ignored).

fields.name: pitch_rate
fields.description: Pitch angular rate unitless (-1..1, positive: up, negative: down, NaN to be ignored).

fields.name: yaw_rate
fields.description: Yaw angular rate unitless (-1..1, positive: to the right, negative: to the left, NaN to be ignored).

messages.name: ESC_INFO
messages.description: ESC information for lower rate streaming. Recommended streaming rate 1Hz. See ESC_STATUS for higher-rate ESC data.

fields.name: index
fields.description: Index of the first ESC in this message (ESC are indexed in motor order). minValue = 0, maxValue = 60, increment = 4.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude the number.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Total number of ESCs in all messages of this type. Message fields with an index higher than this should be ignored because they contain invalid data.

fields.name: connection_type
fields.description: Connection type protocol for all ESC.

fields.name: info
fields.description: Information regarding online/offline status of each ESC.

fields.name: error_count
fields.description: Number of reported errors by each ESC since boot.

fields.name: temperature
fields.description: Temperature of each ESC. INT16_MAX: if data not supplied by ESC.

messages.name: ESC_STATUS
messages.description: ESC information for higher rate streaming. Recommended streaming rate is ~10 Hz. Information that changes more slowly is sent in ESC_INFO. It should typically only be streamed on high-bandwidth links (i.e. to a companion computer).

fields.name: index
fields.description: Index of the first ESC in this message (ESC are indexed in motor order). minValue = 0, maxValue = 60, increment = 4.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude the number.

fields.name: rpm
fields.description: Reported motor RPM from each ESC (negative for reverse rotation).

messages.name: AIRSPEED
messages.description: Airspeed information from a sensor.

messages.name: WIFI_CONFIG_AP
messages.description: Configure WiFi AP SSID, password, and mode. This message is re-emitted as an acknowledgement by the AP. The message may also be explicitly requested using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE

fields.name: ssid
fields.description: Name of Wi-Fi network (SSID). Blank to leave it unchanged when setting. Current SSID when sent back as a response.

fields.name: password
fields.description: Password. Blank for an open AP. MD5 hash when message is sent back as a response.

fields.name: response
fields.description: Message acceptance response (sent back to GS).

messages.name: PROTOCOL_VERSION
messages.description: Version and capability of protocol version. This message can be requested with MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE and is used as part of the handshaking to establish which MAVLink version should be used on the network. Every node should respond to a request for PROTOCOL_VERSION to enable the handshaking. Library implementers should consider adding this into the default decoding state machine to allow the protocol core to respond directly.

deprecated.description: No longer needed. Support is being removed from flight stacks.

fields.name: version
fields.description: Currently active MAVLink version number * 100: v1.0 is 100, v2.0 is 200, etc.

fields.name: max_version
fields.description: Maximum MAVLink version supported (set to the same value as version by default)

fields.name: spec_version_hash
fields.description: The first 8 bytes (not characters printed in hex!) of the git hash.

fields.name: library_version_hash
fields.description: The first 8 bytes (not characters printed in hex!) of the git hash.

messages.name: AIS_VESSEL
messages.description: The location and information of an AIS vessel

fields.name: MMSI
fields.description: Mobile Marine Service Identifier, 9 decimal digits

fields.name: dimension_bow
fields.description: Distance from lat/lon location to bow

fields.name: dimension_stern
fields.description: Distance from lat/lon location to stern

fields.name: dimension_port
fields.description: Distance from lat/lon location to port side

fields.name: dimension_starboard
fields.description: Distance from lat/lon location to starboard side

fields.name: tslc
fields.description: Time since last communication in seconds

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Bitmask to indicate various statuses including valid data fields

messages.name: UAVCAN_NODE_STATUS
messages.description: General status information of an UAVCAN node. Please refer to the definition of the UAVCAN message "uavcan.protocol.NodeStatus" for the background information. The UAVCAN specification is available at http://uavcan.org.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: uptime_sec
fields.description: Time since the start-up of the node.

messages.name: UAVCAN_NODE_INFO
messages.description: General information describing a particular UAVCAN node. Please refer to the definition of the UAVCAN service "uavcan.protocol.GetNodeInfo" for the background information. This message should be emitted by the system whenever a new node appears online, or an existing node reboots. Additionally, it can be emitted upon request from the other end of the MAVLink channel (see MAV_CMD_UAVCAN_GET_NODE_INFO). It is also not prohibited to emit this message unconditionally at a low frequency. The UAVCAN specification is available at http://uavcan.org.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: uptime_sec
fields.description: Time since the start-up of the node.

fields.name: sw_vcs_commit
fields.description: Version control system (VCS) revision identifier (e.g. git short commit hash). 0 if unknown.

messages.name: PARAM_EXT_REQUEST_READ
messages.description: Request to read the value of a parameter with either the param_id string id or param_index. PARAM_EXT_VALUE should be emitted in response.

fields.name: param_id
fields.description: Parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string

fields.name: param_index
fields.description: Parameter index. Set to -1 to use the Parameter ID field as identifier (else param_id will be ignored)

messages.name: PARAM_EXT_REQUEST_LIST
messages.description: Request all parameters of this component. All parameters should be emitted in response as PARAM_EXT_VALUE.

messages.name: PARAM_EXT_VALUE
messages.description: Emit the value of a parameter. The inclusion of param_count and param_index in the message allows the recipient to keep track of received parameters and allows them to re-request missing parameters after a loss or timeout.

fields.name: param_id
fields.description: Parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string

messages.name: PARAM_EXT_SET
messages.description: Set a parameter value. In order to deal with message loss (and retransmission of PARAM_EXT_SET), when setting a parameter value and the new value is the same as the current value, you will immediately get a PARAM_ACK_ACCEPTED response. If the current state is PARAM_ACK_IN_PROGRESS, you will accordingly receive a PARAM_ACK_IN_PROGRESS in response.

fields.name: param_id
fields.description: Parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string

messages.name: PARAM_EXT_ACK
messages.description: Response from a PARAM_EXT_SET message.

fields.name: param_id
fields.description: Parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string

fields.name: param_value
fields.description: Parameter value (new value if PARAM_ACK_ACCEPTED, current value otherwise)

messages.name: OBSTACLE_DISTANCE
messages.description: Obstacle distances in front of the sensor, starting from the left in increment degrees to the right

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: sensor_type
fields.description: Class id of the distance sensor type.

fields.name: distances
fields.description: Distance of obstacles around the vehicle with index 0 corresponding to north + angle_offset, unless otherwise specified in the frame. A value of 0 is valid and means that the obstacle is practically touching the sensor. A value of max_distance +1 means no obstacle is present. A value of UINT16_MAX for unknown/not used. In a array element, one unit corresponds to 1cm.

fields.name: increment
fields.description: Angular width in degrees of each array element. Increment direction is clockwise. This field is ignored if increment_f is non-zero.

fields.name: min_distance
fields.description: Minimum distance the sensor can measure.

fields.name: max_distance
fields.description: Maximum distance the sensor can measure.

fields.name: increment_f
fields.description: Angular width in degrees of each array element as a float. If non-zero then this value is used instead of the uint8_t increment field. Positive is clockwise direction, negative is counter-clockwise.

fields.name: angle_offset
fields.description: Relative angle offset of the 0-index element in the distances array. Value of 0 corresponds to forward. Positive is clockwise direction, negative is counter-clockwise.

fields.name: frame
fields.description: Coordinate frame of reference for the yaw rotation and offset of the sensor data. Defaults to MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL, which is north aligned. For body-mounted sensors use MAV_FRAME_BODY_FRD, which is vehicle front aligned.

messages.name: ODOMETRY
messages.description: Odometry message to communicate odometry information with an external interface. Fits ROS REP 147 standard for aerial vehicles (http://www.ros.org/reps/rep-0147.html).

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: frame_id
fields.description: Coordinate frame of reference for the pose data.

fields.name: child_frame_id
fields.description: Coordinate frame of reference for the velocity in free space (twist) data.

fields.name: q
fields.description: Quaternion components, w, x, y, z (1 0 0 0 is the null-rotation)

fields.name: pose_covariance
fields.description: Row-major representation of a 6x6 pose cross-covariance matrix upper right triangle (states: x, y, z, roll, pitch, yaw; first six entries are the first ROW, next five entries are the second ROW, etc.). If unknown, assign NaN value to first element in the array.

fields.name: velocity_covariance
fields.description: Row-major representation of a 6x6 velocity cross-covariance matrix upper right triangle (states: vx, vy, vz, rollspeed, pitchspeed, yawspeed; first six entries are the first ROW, next five entries are the second ROW, etc.). If unknown, assign NaN value to first element in the array.

fields.name: reset_counter
fields.description: Estimate reset counter. This should be incremented when the estimate resets in any of the dimensions (position, velocity, attitude, angular speed). This is designed to be used when e.g an external SLAM system detects a loop-closure and the estimate jumps.

fields.name: estimator_type
fields.description: Type of estimator that is providing the odometry.

fields.name: quality
fields.description: Optional odometry quality metric as a percentage. -1 = odometry has failed, 0 = unknown/unset quality, 1 = worst quality, 100 = best quality

messages.name: TRAJECTORY_REPRESENTATION_WAYPOINTS
messages.description: Describe a trajectory using an array of up-to 5 waypoints in the local frame (MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_NED).

deprecated.description: Implemented PX4 v1.11 to v1.14. Not used in current flight stacks.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: valid_points
fields.description: Number of valid points (up-to 5 waypoints are possible)

fields.name: pos_x
fields.description: X-coordinate of waypoint, set to NaN if not being used

fields.name: pos_y
fields.description: Y-coordinate of waypoint, set to NaN if not being used

fields.name: pos_z

fields.name: vel_x

fields.name: vel_y
fields.description: Y-velocity of waypoint, set to NaN if not being used

fields.name: vel_z

fields.name: acc_x

fields.name: acc_y
fields.description: Y-acceleration of waypoint, set to NaN if not being used

fields.name: acc_z

fields.name: pos_yaw
fields.description: Yaw angle, set to NaN if not being used

fields.name: vel_yaw
fields.description: Yaw rate, set to NaN if not being used

fields.name: command

messages.name: TRAJECTORY_REPRESENTATION_BEZIER
messages.description: Describe a trajectory using an array of up-to 5 bezier control points in the local frame (MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_NED).

deprecated.description: Implemented PX4 v1.11 to v1.14. Not used in current flight stacks.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: valid_points
fields.description: Number of valid control points (up-to 5 points are possible)

fields.name: pos_x
fields.description: X-coordinate of bezier control points. Set to NaN if not being used

fields.name: pos_y
fields.description: Y-coordinate of bezier control points. Set to NaN if not being used

fields.name: pos_yaw

messages.name: CELLULAR_STATUS

fields.name: failure_reason

fields.description: Cellular network radio type: gsm, cdma, lte...

fields.name: mnc

fields.name: lac
