messages.name: ISBD_LINK_STATUS
messages.description: Status of the Iridium SBD link.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: last_heartbeat
fields.description: Timestamp of the last successful sbd session. The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: signal_quality
fields.description: Signal quality equal to the number of bars displayed on the ISU signal strength indicator. Range is 0 to 5, where 0 indicates no signal and 5 indicates maximum signal strength.

fields.name: ring_pending
fields.description: 1: Ring call pending, 0: No call pending.

fields.name: tx_session_pending
fields.description: 1: Transmission session pending, 0: No transmission session pending.

fields.name: rx_session_pending

messages.name: CELLULAR_CONFIG
messages.description: Configure cellular modems. This message is re-emitted as an acknowledgement by the modem. The message may also be explicitly requested using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE.

fields.name: enable_lte
fields.description: Enable/disable LTE. 0: setting unchanged, 1: disabled, 2: enabled. Current setting when sent back as a response.

fields.name: enable_pin
fields.description: Enable/disable PIN on the SIM card. 0: setting unchanged, 1: disabled, 2: enabled. Current setting when sent back as a response.

fields.name: new_pin

fields.name: apn

fields.name: puk

fields.name: roaming

fields.name: response
fields.description: Message acceptance response (sent back to GS).

messages.name: RAW_RPM

messages.name: UTM_GLOBAL_POSITION

fields.name: update_rate

fields.name: flags

messages.name: PARAM_ERROR
messages.description: Parameter set/get error. Returned from a MAVLink node in response to an error in the parameter protocol, for example failing to set a parameter because it does not exist.

fields.name: param_id
fields.description: Parameter id. Terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string

fields.name: param_index

messages.name: DEBUG_FLOAT_ARRAY
messages.description: Large debug/prototyping array. The message uses the maximum available payload for data. The array_id and name fields are used to discriminate between messages in code and in user interfaces (respectively). Do not use in production code.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name, for human-friendly display in a Ground Control Station

fields.name: array_id
fields.description: Unique ID used to discriminate between arrays

messages.name: ORBIT_EXECUTION_STATUS
messages.description: Vehicle status report that is sent out while orbit execution is in progress (see MAV_CMD_DO_ORBIT).

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: radius
fields.description: Radius of the orbit circle. Positive values orbit clockwise, negative values orbit counter-clockwise.

fields.name: frame
fields.description: The coordinate system of the fields: x, y, z.

fields.name: x
fields.description: X coordinate of center point. Coordinate system depends on frame field: local = x position in meters * 1e4, global = latitude in degrees * 1e7.

fields.name: y
fields.description: Y coordinate of center point. Coordinate system depends on frame field: local = x position in meters * 1e4, global = latitude in degrees * 1e7.

fields.name: z
fields.description: Altitude of center point. Coordinate system depends on frame field.

messages.name: SMART_BATTERY_INFO
messages.description: Smart Battery information (static/infrequent update). Use for updates from: smart battery to flight stack, flight stack to GCS. Use BATTERY_STATUS for the frequent battery updates.

fields.name: capacity_full_specification
fields.description: Capacity when full according to manufacturer, -1: field not provided.

fields.name: capacity_full
fields.description: Capacity when full (accounting for battery degradation), -1: field not provided.

fields.name: cycle_count
fields.description: Charge/discharge cycle count. UINT16_MAX: field not provided.

fields.name: serial_number
fields.description: Serial number in ASCII characters, 0 terminated. All 0: field not provided.

fields.name: device_name
fields.description: Static device name in ASCII characters, 0 terminated. All 0: field not provided. Encode as manufacturer name then product name separated using an underscore.

fields.name: discharge_minimum_voltage
fields.description: Minimum per-cell voltage when discharging. If not supplied set to UINT16_MAX value.

fields.name: charging_minimum_voltage
fields.description: Minimum per-cell voltage when charging. If not supplied set to UINT16_MAX value.

fields.name: resting_minimum_voltage
fields.description: Minimum per-cell voltage when resting. If not supplied set to UINT16_MAX value.

fields.name: charging_maximum_voltage
fields.description: Maximum per-cell voltage when charged. 0: field not provided.

fields.name: cells_in_series
fields.description: Number of battery cells in series. 0: field not provided.

fields.name: discharge_maximum_current
fields.description: Maximum pack discharge current. 0: field not provided.

fields.name: discharge_maximum_burst_current
fields.description: Maximum pack discharge burst current. 0: field not provided.

fields.name: manufacture_date
fields.description: Manufacture date (DD/MM/YYYY) in ASCII characters, 0 terminated. All 0: field not provided.

messages.name: FIGURE_EIGHT_EXECUTION_STATUS
messages.description: Vehicle status report that is sent out while figure eight execution is in progress (see MAV_CMD_DO_FIGURE_EIGHT). This may typically send at low rates: of the order of 2Hz.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: major_radius
fields.description: Major axis radius of the figure eight. Positive: orbit the north circle clockwise. Negative: orbit the north circle counter-clockwise.

fields.name: minor_radius
fields.description: Minor axis radius of the figure eight. Defines the radius of two circles that make up the figure.

fields.name: orientation
fields.description: Orientation of the figure eight major axis with respect to true north in [-pi,pi).

fields.name: frame
fields.description: The coordinate system of the fields: x, y, z.

fields.name: x
fields.description: X coordinate of center point. Coordinate system depends on frame field.

fields.name: y
fields.description: Y coordinate of center point. Coordinate system depends on frame field.

fields.name: z
fields.description: Altitude of center point. Coordinate system depends on frame field.

messages.name: FUEL_STATUS
messages.description: Fuel status. This message provides "generic" fuel level information for in a GCS and for triggering failsafes in an autopilot. The fuel type and associated units for fields in this message are defined in the enum MAV_FUEL_TYPE. The reported `consumed_fuel` and `remaining_fuel` must only be supplied if measured: they must not be inferred from the `maximum_fuel` and the other value. A recipient can assume that if these fields are supplied they are accurate. If not provided, the recipient can infer `remaining_fuel` from `maximum_fuel` and `consumed_fuel` on the assumption that the fuel was initially at its maximum (this is what battery monitors assume). Note however that this is an assumption, and the UI should prompt the user appropriately (i.e. notify user that they should fill the tank before boot). This kind of information may also be sent in fuel-specific messages such as BATTERY_STATUS_V2. If both messages are sent for the same fuel system, the ids and corresponding information must match. This should be streamed (nominally at 0.1 Hz).

fields.name: id
fields.description: Fuel ID. Must match ID of other messages for same fuel system, such as BATTERY_STATUS_V2.

fields.name: maximum_fuel
fields.description: Capacity when full. Must be provided.

fields.name: consumed_fuel
fields.description: Consumed fuel (measured). This value should not be inferred: if not measured set to NaN. NaN: field not provided.

fields.name: remaining_fuel
fields.description: Remaining fuel until empty (measured). The value should not be inferred: if not measured set to NaN. NaN: field not provided.

fields.name: percent_remaining
fields.description: Percentage of remaining fuel, relative to full. Values: [0-100], UINT8_MAX: field not provided.

fields.name: flow_rate
fields.description: Positive value when emptying/using, and negative if filling/replacing. NaN: field not provided.

fields.name: temperature
fields.description: Fuel temperature. NaN: field not provided.

fields.name: fuel_type
fields.description: Fuel type. Defines units for fuel capacity and consumption fields above.

messages.name: BATTERY_INFO
messages.description: Battery information that is static, or requires infrequent update. This message should requested using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE and/or streamed at very low rate. BATTERY_STATUS_V2 is used for higher-rate battery status information.

fields.name: state_of_health
fields.description: State of Health (SOH) estimate. Typically 100% at the time of manufacture and will decrease over time and use. -1: field not provided.

fields.name: cells_in_series
fields.description: Number of battery cells in series. 0: field not provided.

fields.name: cycle_count
fields.description: Lifetime count of the number of charge/discharge cycles (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charge_cycle). UINT16_MAX: field not provided.

fields.name: discharge_minimum_voltage
fields.description: Minimum per-cell voltage when discharging. 0: field not provided.

fields.name: charging_minimum_voltage
fields.description: Minimum per-cell voltage when charging. 0: field not provided.

fields.name: resting_minimum_voltage
fields.description: Minimum per-cell voltage when resting. 0: field not provided.

fields.name: charging_maximum_voltage
fields.description: Maximum per-cell voltage when charged. 0: field not provided.

fields.name: charging_maximum_current
fields.description: Maximum pack continuous charge current. 0: field not provided.

fields.name: nominal_voltage
fields.description: Battery nominal voltage. Used for conversion between Wh and Ah. 0: field not provided.

fields.name: discharge_maximum_current
fields.description: Maximum pack discharge current. 0: field not provided.

fields.name: discharge_maximum_burst_current
fields.description: Maximum pack discharge burst current. 0: field not provided.

fields.name: design_capacity
fields.description: Fully charged design capacity. 0: field not provided.

fields.name: full_charge_capacity
fields.description: Predicted battery capacity when fully charged (accounting for battery degradation). NAN: field not provided.

fields.name: manufacture_date
fields.description: Manufacture date (DDMMYYYY) in ASCII characters, 0 terminated. All 0: field not provided.

fields.name: serial_number
fields.description: Serial number in ASCII characters, 0 terminated. All 0: field not provided.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Battery device name. Formatted as manufacturer name then product name, separated with an underscore (in ASCII characters), 0 terminated. All 0: field not provided.

messages.name: GENERATOR_STATUS
messages.description: Telemetry of power generation system. Alternator or mechanical generator.

fields.name: generator_speed
fields.description: Speed of electrical generator or alternator. UINT16_MAX: field not provided.

fields.name: battery_current
fields.description: Current into/out of battery. Positive for out. Negative for in. NaN: field not provided.

fields.name: load_current
fields.description: Current going to the UAV. If battery current not available this is the DC current from the generator. Positive for out. Negative for in. NaN: field not provided

fields.name: power_generated
fields.description: The power being generated. NaN: field not provided

fields.name: bus_voltage
fields.description: Voltage of the bus seen at the generator, or battery bus if battery bus is controlled by generator and at a different voltage to main bus.

fields.name: rectifier_temperature
fields.description: The temperature of the rectifier or power converter. INT16_MAX: field not provided.

fields.name: bat_current_setpoint
fields.description: The target battery current. Positive for out. Negative for in. NaN: field not provided

fields.name: generator_temperature
fields.description: The temperature of the mechanical motor, fuel cell core or generator. INT16_MAX: field not provided.

fields.name: runtime
fields.description: Seconds this generator has run since it was rebooted. UINT32_MAX: field not provided.

fields.name: time_until_maintenance
fields.description: Seconds until this generator requires maintenance. A negative value indicates maintenance is past-due. INT32_MAX: field not provided.

messages.name: ACTUATOR_OUTPUT_STATUS
messages.description: The raw values of the actuator outputs (e.g. on Pixhawk, from MAIN, AUX ports). This message supersedes SERVO_OUTPUT_RAW.

fields.name: actuator
fields.description: Servo / motor output array values. Zero values indicate unused channels.

messages.name: TIME_ESTIMATE_TO_TARGET
messages.description: Time/duration estimates for various events and actions given the current vehicle state and position.

fields.name: safe_return
fields.description: Estimated time to complete the vehicle's configured "safe return" action from its current position (e.g. RTL, Smart RTL, etc.). -1 indicates that the vehicle is landed, or that no time estimate available.

fields.name: land
fields.description: Estimated time for vehicle to complete the LAND action from its current position. -1 indicates that the vehicle is landed, or that no time estimate available.

fields.name: mission_next_item
fields.description: Estimated time for reaching/completing the currently active mission item. -1 means no time estimate available.

fields.name: mission_end
fields.description: Estimated time for completing the current mission. -1 means no mission active and/or no estimate available.

fields.name: commanded_action
fields.description: Estimated time for completing the current commanded action (i.e. Go To, Takeoff, Land, etc.). -1 means no action active and/or no estimate available.

messages.name: TUNNEL
messages.description: Message for transporting "arbitrary" variable-length data from one component to another (broadcast is not forbidden, but discouraged). The encoding of the data is usually extension specific, i.e. determined by the source, and is usually not documented as part of the MAVLink specification.

fields.name: target_system
fields.description: System ID (can be 0 for broadcast, but this is discouraged)

fields.name: target_component
fields.description: Component ID (can be 0 for broadcast, but this is discouraged)

fields.name: payload_type
fields.description: A code that identifies the content of the payload (0 for unknown, which is the default). If this code is less than 32768, it is a 'registered' payload type and the corresponding code should be added to the MAV_TUNNEL_PAYLOAD_TYPE enum. Software creators can register blocks of types as needed. Codes greater than 32767 are considered local experiments and should not be checked in to any widely distributed codebase.

fields.name: payload_length
fields.description: Length of the data transported in payload

fields.name: payload
fields.description: Variable length payload. The payload length is defined by payload_length. The entire content of this block is opaque unless you understand the encoding specified by payload_type.

messages.name: CAN_FRAME
messages.description: A forwarded CAN frame as requested by MAV_CMD_CAN_FORWARD.

messages.name: ONBOARD_COMPUTER_STATUS
messages.description: Hardware status sent by an onboard computer.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the onboard computer: 0: Mission computer primary, 1: Mission computer backup 1, 2: Mission computer backup 2, 3: Compute node, 4-5: Compute spares, 6-9: Payload computers.

fields.name: cpu_cores
fields.description: CPU usage on the component in percent (100 - idle). A value of UINT8_MAX implies the field is unused.

fields.name: cpu_combined
fields.description: Combined CPU usage as the last 10 slices of 100 MS (a histogram). This allows to identify spikes in load that max out the system, but only for a short amount of time. A value of UINT8_MAX implies the field is unused.

fields.name: gpu_cores
fields.description: GPU usage on the component in percent (100 - idle). A value of UINT8_MAX implies the field is unused.

fields.name: gpu_combined
fields.description: Combined GPU usage as the last 10 slices of 100 MS (a histogram). This allows to identify spikes in load that max out the system, but only for a short amount of time. A value of UINT8_MAX implies the field is unused.

fields.name: temperature_board
fields.description: Temperature of the board. A value of INT8_MAX implies the field is unused.

fields.name: temperature_core
fields.description: Temperature of the CPU core. A value of INT8_MAX implies the field is unused.

fields.name: fan_speed
fields.description: Fan speeds. A value of INT16_MAX implies the field is unused.

fields.name: ram_usage
fields.description: Amount of used RAM on the component system. A value of UINT32_MAX implies the field is unused.

fields.name: ram_total
fields.description: Total amount of RAM on the component system. A value of UINT32_MAX implies the field is unused.

fields.name: storage_type
fields.description: Storage type: 0: HDD, 1: SSD, 2: EMMC, 3: SD card (non-removable), 4: SD card (removable). A value of UINT32_MAX implies the field is unused.

fields.name: storage_usage
fields.description: Amount of used storage space on the component system. A value of UINT32_MAX implies the field is unused.

fields.name: storage_total
fields.description: Total amount of storage space on the component system. A value of UINT32_MAX implies the field is unused.

fields.name: link_type
fields.description: Link type: 0-9: UART, 10-19: Wired network, 20-29: Wifi, 30-39: Point-to-point proprietary, 40-49: Mesh proprietary

fields.name: link_tx_rate
fields.description: Network traffic from the component system. A value of UINT32_MAX implies the field is unused.

fields.name: link_rx_rate
fields.description: Network traffic to the component system. A value of UINT32_MAX implies the field is unused.

fields.name: link_tx_max
fields.description: Network capacity from the component system. A value of UINT32_MAX implies the field is unused.

fields.name: link_rx_max
fields.description: Network capacity to the component system. A value of UINT32_MAX implies the field is unused.

messages.name: COMPONENT_INFORMATION
messages.description: Component information message, which may be requested using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE.

fields.name: general_metadata_file_crc
fields.description: CRC32 of the general metadata file (general_metadata_uri).

fields.name: general_metadata_uri
fields.description: MAVLink FTP URI for the general metadata file (COMP_METADATA_TYPE_GENERAL), which may be compressed with xz. The file contains general component metadata, and may contain URI links for additional metadata (see COMP_METADATA_TYPE). The information is static from boot, and may be generated at compile time. The string needs to be zero terminated.

fields.name: peripherals_metadata_uri
fields.description: (Optional) MAVLink FTP URI for the peripherals metadata file (COMP_METADATA_TYPE_PERIPHERALS), which may be compressed with xz. This contains data about "attached components" such as UAVCAN nodes. The peripherals are in a separate file because the information must be generated dynamically at runtime. The string needs to be zero terminated.

messages.name: COMPONENT_INFORMATION_BASIC
messages.description: Basic component information data. Should be requested using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE on startup, or when required.

fields.name: time_manufacture_s
fields.description: Date of manufacture as a UNIX Epoch time (since 1.1.1970) in seconds.

fields.name: vendor_name
fields.description: Name of the component vendor. Needs to be zero terminated. The field is optional and can be empty/all zeros.

fields.name: model_name
fields.description: Name of the component model. Needs to be zero terminated. The field is optional and can be empty/all zeros.

fields.name: software_version
fields.description: Software version. The recommended format is SEMVER: 'major.minor.patch' (any format may be used). The field must be zero terminated if it has a value. The field is optional and can be empty/all zeros.

fields.name: hardware_version
fields.description: Hardware version. The recommended format is SEMVER: 'major.minor.patch' (any format may be used). The field must be zero terminated if it has a value. The field is optional and can be empty/all zeros.

fields.name: serial_number
fields.description: Hardware serial number. The field must be zero terminated if it has a value. The field is optional and can be empty/all zeros.

messages.name: COMPONENT_METADATA
messages.description: Component metadata message, which may be requested using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE. This contains the MAVLink FTP URI and CRC for the component's general metadata file. The file must be hosted on the component, and may be xz compressed. The file CRC can be used for file caching. The general metadata file can be read to get the locations of other metadata files (COMP_METADATA_TYPE) and translations, which may be hosted either on the vehicle or the internet. For more information see: https://mavlink.io/en/services/component_information.html. Note: Camera components should use CAMERA_INFORMATION instead, and autopilots may use both this message and AUTOPILOT_VERSION.

fields.name: file_crc
fields.description: CRC32 of the general metadata file.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: MAVLink FTP URI for the general metadata file (COMP_METADATA_TYPE_GENERAL), which may be compressed with xz. The file contains general component metadata, and may contain URI links for additional metadata (see COMP_METADATA_TYPE). The information is static from boot, and may be generated at compile time. The string needs to be zero terminated.

messages.name: PLAY_TUNE_V2
messages.description: Play vehicle tone/tune (buzzer). Supersedes message PLAY_TUNE.

fields.name: tune
fields.description: Tune definition as a NULL-terminated string.

messages.name: SUPPORTED_TUNES
messages.description: Tune formats supported by vehicle. This should be emitted as response to MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE.

messages.name: EVENT
messages.description: Event message. Each new event from a particular component gets a new sequence number. The same message might be sent multiple times if (re-)requested. Most events are broadcast, some can be specific to a target component (as receivers keep track of the sequence for missed events, all events need to be broadcast. Thus we use destination_component instead of target_component).

fields.name: id
fields.description: Event ID (as defined in the component metadata)

fields.name: event_time_boot_ms
fields.description: Timestamp (time since system boot when the event happened).

fields.name: log_levels
fields.description: Log levels: 4 bits MSB: internal (for logging purposes), 4 bits LSB: external. Levels: Emergency = 0, Alert = 1, Critical = 2, Error = 3, Warning = 4, Notice = 5, Info = 6, Debug = 7, Protocol = 8, Disabled = 9

messages.name: CURRENT_EVENT_SEQUENCE
messages.description: Regular broadcast for the current latest event sequence number for a component. This is used to check for dropped events.

messages.name: REQUEST_EVENT
messages.description: Request one or more events to be (re-)sent. If first_sequence==last_sequence, only a single event is requested. Note that first_sequence can be larger than last_sequence (because the sequence number can wrap). Each sequence will trigger an EVENT or EVENT_ERROR response.

fields.name: first_sequence
fields.description: First sequence number of the requested event.

fields.name: last_sequence
fields.description: Last sequence number of the requested event.

messages.name: RESPONSE_EVENT_ERROR
messages.description: Response to a REQUEST_EVENT in case of an error (e.g. the event is not available anymore).

fields.name: sequence_oldest_available
fields.description: Oldest Sequence number that is still available after the sequence set in REQUEST_EVENT.

messages.name: AVAILABLE_MODES
messages.description: Information about a flight mode. The message can be enumerated to get information for all modes, or requested for a particular mode, using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE. Specify 0 in param2 to request that the message is emitted for all available modes or the specific index for just one mode. The modes must be available/settable for the current vehicle/frame type. Each mode should only be emitted once (even if it is both standard and custom). Note that the current mode should be emitted in CURRENT_MODE, and that if the mode list can change then AVAILABLE_MODES_MONITOR must be emitted on first change and subsequently streamed. See https://mavlink.io/en/services/standard_modes.html

fields.name: number_modes
fields.description: The total number of available modes for the current vehicle type.

fields.name: mode_index
fields.description: The current mode index within number_modes, indexed from 1. The index is not guaranteed to be persistent, and may change between reboots or if the set of modes change.

fields.name: custom_mode
fields.description: A bitfield for use for autopilot-specific flags

fields.name: mode_name
fields.description: Name of custom mode, with null termination character. Should be omitted for standard modes.

messages.name: CURRENT_MODE
messages.description: Get the current mode. This should be emitted on any mode change, and broadcast at low rate (nominally 0.5 Hz). It may be requested using MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE. See https://mavlink.io/en/services/standard_modes.html

fields.name: custom_mode
fields.description: A bitfield for use for autopilot-specific flags

fields.name: intended_custom_mode
fields.description: The custom_mode of the mode that was last commanded by the user (for example, with MAV_CMD_DO_SET_STANDARD_MODE, MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MODE or via RC). This should usually be the same as custom_mode. It will be different if the vehicle is unable to enter the intended mode, or has left that mode due to a failsafe condition. 0 indicates the intended custom mode is unknown/not supplied

messages.name: AVAILABLE_MODES_MONITOR
messages.description: A change to the sequence number indicates that the set of AVAILABLE_MODES has changed. A receiver must re-request all available modes whenever the sequence number changes. This is only emitted after the first change and should then be broadcast at low rate (nominally 0.3 Hz) and on change. See https://mavlink.io/en/services/standard_modes.html

fields.name: seq
fields.description: Sequence number. The value iterates sequentially whenever AVAILABLE_MODES changes (e.g. support for a new mode is added/removed dynamically).

messages.name: ILLUMINATOR_STATUS
messages.description: Illuminator status

fields.name: uptime_ms
fields.description: Time since the start-up of the illuminator in ms

messages.name: CANFD_FRAME
messages.description: A forwarded CANFD frame as requested by MAV_CMD_CAN_FORWARD. These are separated from CAN_FRAME as they need different handling (eg. TAO handling)

messages.name: CAN_FILTER_MODIFY
messages.description: Modify the filter of what CAN messages to forward over the mavlink. This can be used to make CAN forwarding work well on low bandwidth links. The filtering is applied on bits 8 to 24 of the CAN id (2nd and 3rd bytes) which corresponds to the DroneCAN message ID for DroneCAN. Filters with more than 16 IDs can be constructed by sending multiple CAN_FILTER_MODIFY messages.

fields.name: operation
fields.description: what operation to perform on the filter list. See CAN_FILTER_OP enum.

fields.name: num_ids
fields.description: number of IDs in filter list

messages.name: WHEEL_DISTANCE
messages.description: Cumulative distance traveled for each reported wheel.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (synced to UNIX time or since system boot).

fields.name: distance
fields.description: Distance reported by individual wheel encoders. Forward rotations increase values, reverse rotations decrease them. Not all wheels will necessarily have wheel encoders; the mapping of encoders to wheel positions must be agreed/understood by the endpoints.

messages.name: WINCH_STATUS
messages.description: Winch status.

fields.name: time_usec
fields.description: Timestamp (synced to UNIX time or since system boot).

fields.name: line_length
fields.description: Length of line released. NaN if unknown

fields.name: speed
fields.description: Speed line is being released or retracted. Positive values if being released, negative values if being retracted, NaN if unknown

fields.name: tension
fields.description: Tension on the line. NaN if unknown

fields.name: voltage
fields.description: Voltage of the battery supplying the winch. NaN if unknown

fields.name: current
fields.description: Current draw from the winch. NaN if unknown

fields.name: temperature
fields.description: Temperature of the motor. INT16_MAX if unknown

messages.name: OPEN_DRONE_ID_BASIC_ID
messages.description: Data for filling the OpenDroneID Basic ID message. This and the below messages are primarily meant for feeding data to/from an OpenDroneID implementation. E.g. https://github.com/opendroneid/opendroneid-core-c. These messages are compatible with the ASTM F3411 Remote ID standard and the ASD-STAN prEN 4709-002 Direct Remote ID standard. Additional information and usage of these messages is documented at https://mavlink.io/en/services/opendroneid.html.

fields.name: id_or_mac
fields.description: Only used for drone ID data received from other UAs. See detailed description at https://mavlink.io/en/services/opendroneid.html.

fields.name: id_type
fields.description: Indicates the format for the uas_id field of this message.

fields.name: ua_type
fields.description: Indicates the type of UA (Unmanned Aircraft).

fields.name: uas_id
fields.description: UAS (Unmanned Aircraft System) ID following the format specified by id_type. Shall be filled with nulls in the unused portion of the field.

messages.name: OPEN_DRONE_ID_LOCATION
messages.description: Data for filling the OpenDroneID Location message. The float data types are 32-bit IEEE 754. The Location message provides the location, altitude, direction and speed of the aircraft.

fields.name: id_or_mac
fields.description: Only used for drone ID data received from other UAs. See detailed description at https://mavlink.io/en/services/opendroneid.html.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Indicates whether the unmanned aircraft is on the ground or in the air.

fields.name: direction
fields.description: Direction over ground (not heading, but direction of movement) measured clockwise from true North: 0 - 35999 centi-degrees. If unknown: 36100 centi-degrees.

fields.name: speed_horizontal
fields.description: Ground speed. Positive only. If unknown: 25500 cm/s. If speed is larger than 25425 cm/s, use 25425 cm/s.

fields.name: speed_vertical
fields.description: The vertical speed. Up is positive. If unknown: 6300 cm/s. If speed is larger than 6200 cm/s, use 6200 cm/s. If lower than -6200 cm/s, use -6200 cm/s.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: Current latitude of the unmanned aircraft. If unknown: 0 (both Lat/Lon).

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: Current longitude of the unmanned aircraft. If unknown: 0 (both Lat/Lon).

fields.name: altitude_barometric
fields.description: The altitude calculated from the barometric pressure. Reference is against 29.92inHg or 1013.2mb. If unknown: -1000 m.

fields.name: altitude_geodetic
fields.description: The geodetic altitude as defined by WGS84. If unknown: -1000 m.

fields.name: height_reference
fields.description: Indicates the reference point for the height field.

fields.name: height
fields.description: The current height of the unmanned aircraft above the take-off location or the ground as indicated by height_reference. If unknown: -1000 m.

fields.name: horizontal_accuracy
fields.description: The accuracy of the horizontal position.

fields.name: vertical_accuracy
fields.description: The accuracy of the vertical position.

fields.name: barometer_accuracy
fields.description: The accuracy of the barometric altitude.

fields.name: speed_accuracy
fields.description: The accuracy of the horizontal and vertical speed.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Seconds after the full hour with reference to UTC time. Typically the GPS outputs a time-of-week value in milliseconds. First convert that to UTC and then convert for this field using ((float) (time_week_ms % (60*60*1000))) / 1000. If unknown: 0xFFFF.

messages.name: OPEN_DRONE_ID_AUTHENTICATION
messages.description: Data for filling the OpenDroneID Authentication message. The Authentication Message defines a field that can provide a means of authenticity for the identity of the UAS (Unmanned Aircraft System). The Authentication message can have two different formats. For data page 0, the fields PageCount, Length and TimeStamp are present and AuthData is only 17 bytes. For data page 1 through 15, PageCount, Length and TimeStamp are not present and the size of AuthData is 23 bytes.

fields.name: id_or_mac
fields.description: Only used for drone ID data received from other UAs. See detailed description at https://mavlink.io/en/services/opendroneid.html.

fields.name: last_page_index
fields.description: This field is only present for page 0. Allowed range is 0 - 15. See the description of struct ODID_Auth_data at https://github.com/opendroneid/opendroneid-core-c/blob/master/libopendroneid/opendroneid.h.

fields.name: length
fields.description: This field is only present for page 0. Total bytes of authentication_data from all data pages. See the description of struct ODID_Auth_data at https://github.com/opendroneid/opendroneid-core-c/blob/master/libopendroneid/opendroneid.h.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: This field is only present for page 0. 32 bit Unix Timestamp in seconds since 00:00:00 01/01/2019.

fields.name: authentication_data
fields.description: Opaque authentication data. For page 0, the size is only 17 bytes. For other pages, the size is 23 bytes. Shall be filled with nulls in the unused portion of the field.

messages.name: OPEN_DRONE_ID_SELF_ID
messages.description: Data for filling the OpenDroneID Self ID message. The Self ID Message is an opportunity for the operator to (optionally) declare their identity and purpose of the flight. This message can provide additional information that could reduce the threat profile of a UA (Unmanned Aircraft) flying in a particular area or manner. This message can also be used to provide optional additional clarification in an emergency/remote ID system failure situation.

fields.name: id_or_mac
fields.description: Only used for drone ID data received from other UAs. See detailed description at https://mavlink.io/en/services/opendroneid.html.

fields.name: description_type
fields.description: Indicates the type of the description field.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Text description or numeric value expressed as ASCII characters. Shall be filled with nulls in the unused portion of the field.

messages.name: OPEN_DRONE_ID_SYSTEM
messages.description: Data for filling the OpenDroneID System message. The System Message contains general system information including the operator location/altitude and possible aircraft group and/or category/class information.

fields.name: id_or_mac
fields.description: Only used for drone ID data received from other UAs. See detailed description at https://mavlink.io/en/services/opendroneid.html.

fields.name: classification_type
fields.description: Specifies the classification type of the UA.

fields.name: operator_latitude
fields.description: Latitude of the operator. If unknown: 0 (both Lat/Lon).

fields.name: operator_longitude
fields.description: Longitude of the operator. If unknown: 0 (both Lat/Lon).

fields.name: area_count
fields.description: Number of aircraft in the area, group or formation (default 1). Used only for swarms/multiple UA.

fields.name: area_radius
fields.description: Radius of the cylindrical area of the group or formation (default 0). Used only for swarms/multiple UA.

fields.name: area_ceiling
fields.description: Area Operations Ceiling relative to WGS84. If unknown: -1000 m. Used only for swarms/multiple UA.

fields.name: area_floor
fields.description: Area Operations Floor relative to WGS84. If unknown: -1000 m. Used only for swarms/multiple UA.

fields.name: category_eu
fields.description: When classification_type is MAV_ODID_CLASSIFICATION_TYPE_EU, specifies the category of the UA.

fields.name: class_eu
fields.description: When classification_type is MAV_ODID_CLASSIFICATION_TYPE_EU, specifies the class of the UA.

fields.name: operator_altitude_geo
fields.description: Geodetic altitude of the operator relative to WGS84. If unknown: -1000 m.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: 32 bit Unix Timestamp in seconds since 00:00:00 01/01/2019.

messages.name: OPEN_DRONE_ID_OPERATOR_ID
messages.description: Data for filling the OpenDroneID Operator ID message, which contains the CAA (Civil Aviation Authority) issued operator ID.

fields.name: id_or_mac
fields.description: Only used for drone ID data received from other UAs. See detailed description at https://mavlink.io/en/services/opendroneid.html.

fields.name: operator_id_type
fields.description: Indicates the type of the operator_id field.

fields.name: operator_id
fields.description: Text description or numeric value expressed as ASCII characters. Shall be filled with nulls in the unused portion of the field.

messages.name: OPEN_DRONE_ID_MESSAGE_PACK
messages.description: An OpenDroneID message pack is a container for multiple encoded OpenDroneID messages (i.e. not in the format given for the above message descriptions but after encoding into the compressed OpenDroneID byte format). Used e.g. when transmitting on Bluetooth 5.0 Long Range/Extended Advertising or on WiFi Neighbor Aware Networking or on WiFi Beacon.

fields.name: id_or_mac
fields.description: Only used for drone ID data received from other UAs. See detailed description at https://mavlink.io/en/services/opendroneid.html.

fields.name: single_message_size
fields.description: This field must currently always be equal to 25 (bytes), since all encoded OpenDroneID messages are specified to have this length.

fields.name: msg_pack_size
fields.description: Number of encoded messages in the pack (not the number of bytes). Allowed range is 1 - 9.

fields.name: messages
fields.description: Concatenation of encoded OpenDroneID messages. Shall be filled with nulls in the unused portion of the field.

messages.name: OPEN_DRONE_ID_ARM_STATUS
messages.description: Transmitter (remote ID system) is enabled and ready to start sending location and other required information. This is streamed by transmitter. A flight controller uses it as a condition to arm.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status level indicating if arming is allowed.

fields.name: error
fields.description: Text error message, should be empty if status is good to arm. Fill with nulls in unused portion.

messages.name: OPEN_DRONE_ID_SYSTEM_UPDATE
messages.description: Update the data in the OPEN_DRONE_ID_SYSTEM message with new location information. This can be sent to update the location information for the operator when no other information in the SYSTEM message has changed. This message allows for efficient operation on radio links which have limited uplink bandwidth while meeting requirements for update frequency of the operator location.

fields.name: operator_latitude
fields.description: Latitude of the operator. If unknown: 0 (both Lat/Lon).

fields.name: operator_longitude
fields.description: Longitude of the operator. If unknown: 0 (both Lat/Lon).

fields.name: operator_altitude_geo
fields.description: Geodetic altitude of the operator relative to WGS84. If unknown: -1000 m.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: 32 bit Unix Timestamp in seconds since 00:00:00 01/01/2019.

messages.name: HYGROMETER_SENSOR
messages.description: Temperature and humidity from hygrometer.
